excerpts: For the record the 4 items served on the Wednesday I visited were the Well-done Flank and Beef Brisket Noodle Soup, the Rare Beef Noodle Soup, the Chicken Noodle Soup and Imperial Rolls.
so I ordered a large Rare Beef Noodle Soup and a couple of Imperial Rolls.
As I've come to expect from their Geary location the service here is just as speedy with your food ready in mere minutes after your order is placed.
rare beef noodle soup.author: Wilhelm Y.
rare beef noodle soup.review:
I've eaten at the Turtle Tower Restaurant on Geary Blvd. numerous times, and I've never reviewed them so when I saw that Turtle Tower was opening up a third location on the corner of 6th and Bryant Streets, the space formerly occupied by TEN7M and Quiznos before that, I was giddy with anticipation being that the new location is just a block and a half from where I work.

Fast forward only two short weeks and the restaurant is now open for business serving a limited menu during their soft opening.  The official grand opening is scheduled for next Wednesday, June 1, but I couldn't wait one whole week so as soon as I heard what the limited menu was I stepped in to try it out.

For the record the 4 items served on the Wednesday I visited were the Well-done Flank and Beef Brisket Noodle Soup, the Rare Beef Noodle Soup, the Chicken Noodle Soup and Imperial Rolls.

Those four choices suited me fine as all I really wanted was a hot bowl of beef noodle soup so I ordered a large Rare Beef Noodle Soup and a couple of Imperial Rolls.  As I've come to expect from their Geary location the service here is just as speedy with your food ready in mere minutes after your order is placed.  Accompanied by a lime wedge and some thinly sliced jalapenos plated separately the clear beef broth seemed just a tad too oily (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/KAHDxIOccnc1P1m5abjM0A?select=qPxHdydcJr9tM9QTa4xC_w), but once I dove into that bowl the extra oil on top seemed unnoticeable.

The flavor-rich broth was perfectly seasoned and I loved the hint of ginger in it.  The portion of noodles and beef to broth was perfect.  The Imperial Rolls can be ordered as an entrée with vermicelli noodles and fresh veggies, but I elected to order just two on its own (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/KAHDxIOccnc1P1m5abjM0A?select=zdAwClljoGD8NWdEzZUlDg).  These were very good as most deep-fried goodies are, and since I do no deep-frying at home you can bet I'll order these again on a future visit.

So far in 2011 I've done a lot more cooking at home, and brown-bagging my meals for work have become the norm for me, but I know for a fact I can't make pho this good at home so I may need to rethink this whole not-going-out-to-restaurants-too-often thing thanks to the new Turtle Tower Restaurant.

As mentioned by another Yelper in her review some culinary surprises available only at this Turtle Tower location awaits you.  For a sneak preview I've posted the menu in the photos section.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Turtle Tower!  I have a feeling you're going to be seeing me very often.

excerpts: Ventured to the Turtle Tower in SoMA and ordered the Pho Tai (rare beef noodle soup).
First time trying "Northern style" pho, which apparently is served without the bean sprouts, basil leaves, and lime wedges
that I'm accustomed to.
rare beef noodle soup.author: Phoebe C.
rare beef noodle soup.review:
Ventured to the Turtle Tower in SoMA and ordered the Pho Tai (rare beef noodle soup). First time trying "Northern style" pho, which apparently is served without the bean sprouts, basil leaves, and lime wedges that I'm accustomed to. No worries, going with the flow, I thought...

Either I was extremely hungry, or it was just that good. I'm leaning towards the former and a wee bit of the latter. I do have to say, their rare beef was exceptionally on par - soft and tender, melts in your mouth, just the right amount of redness, and complimented the soup base well. Though I finished all of my soup (an anomaly for me), I did feel as if it was missing...something. Let's just say, an extra kick. Bean sprouts, basil leaves, and/or lime wedges sure would have been perfect! 

Overall, my friend and I were satisfied with our noodle soups on a such a chilly and rainy early evening. However, my friend did say the main location is better in terms of food. Lat but not lease, cash only.

Well done was what we got.

excerpts: I got the beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup and loved its strong taste.
The soup was very savory and the taste of wine was moderate.
I especially loved the beef because it was so tender and immediately melted in my mouth.
This dish is definitely for you if you love a fusion of different flavors.
I would also highly recommend adding the lime in any of their soups to give the flavor a little kick.
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.author: Leslie C.
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.review: Absolutely lovely! I got the beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup and loved its strong taste. The soup was very savory and the taste of wine was moderate. I especially loved the beef because it was so tender and immediately melted in my mouth. This dish is definitely for you if you love a fusion of different flavors. I would also highly recommend adding the lime in any of their soups to give the flavor a little kick.

excerpts: Beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.
It doesn't look the best
but it is SO AMAZING.
Can I make love to this soup because it is just that amazing.
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.author: Jane A.
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.review:
NORTHERN STYLE PHO
(5 stars)

Once you go Northern, you never go back.

- FOOD, delicious pho
- PRICES, affordable
- SERVICE, fast
- AMBIANCE, small

I go to this location because its the less crowded one and I find it to be the cleanest too. I like exposing friends to "northern style" and when they have it they are pretty amazed. Only come here for the soups, the sandwiches were not the business. When I bring people here they never believe me how good it is until you dip into it. 

HEFFER STATUS.

PHO SOT VANG ($6.50) - Beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup. It doesn't look the best but it is SO AMAZING. Can I make love to this soup because it is just that amazing. Hmmm Hmmmm Hmmmm....

PHO GA ($6.50) - Chicken noodle soup. Yah, doesn't sound interesting but this is the best chicken pho i've ever had. You just have to order it to really know what it is all about.

Will I be back? YES YES YES YES YES.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....

excerpts: I especially like the Ph St Vang (Beef Stewed in Wine Sauce Noodle Soup).
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.author: Ali A.
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.review:
Turtle Tower on Larkin street is awesome. They have some of the best Pho I've had in the city. I especially like the Ph St Vang (Beef Stewed in Wine Sauce Noodle Soup).

Turtle Tower on 6th street?...not so much. I got all happy that they opened up a new Turtle Tower that was closer to my house but after coming here 3 times now, I have to say I'm kinda disappointed with the quality of the food. It's still decent but just not nearly as good as the one on Larkin street. 

There's usually a line to be seated but once you're in, the service is generally pretty good and fast. 

Bottom line...if you love Pho, you gotta check out Turtle Tower but if you have the choice, go to the other branch on Larkin street instead.

excerpts: (Beef Stewed in Wine Sauce Noodle Soup) is one of the most unique soups i've ever had, with super tender pieces of beef.
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.author: Susan L.
beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup.review:
my go-to place when it's chilly and i'm in need of something soupy...oh wait, that's like every night in SF :D  what's even more awesome is that the 6th st. location is only 2 blocks away from me!

the pho ga broth is AH-MAAAAAA-ZZZZZING:  clear, flavorful, and fresh-tasting.

the Pho Sot Vang (Beef Stewed in Wine Sauce Noodle Soup) is one of the most unique soups i've ever had, with super tender pieces of beef.

we've even mixed it up and gotten the banh mi a few times.  TASTY! (albeit no contest with saigon sammies)

not sure why TT gets a bad rap sometimes.  it is what it is, and it doesn't pretend to be something it's not.  i'm always satisfied when i walk out of there and counting down the hours until it's appropriate to go back for another bowl of hot steamy delicious soup ^_^

excerpts: and my bf had #5 (Pho Sot Vang - Beef Stewed in Wine Sauce Noodle Soup).

excerpts:
Here's what I had:

PHO GA - CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP - $10.75
The selection of shredded chicken was both dark and white, and had a good amount of chopped green onions!
chicken noodle soup.author: Tu-Anh N.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I came here with 2 others just before noon and was able to beat the rush! We found free street parking just on Bryant St.  

Coming in we were greeted warmly and seated right away!

Here's what I had:

PHO GA - CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP - $10.75 (Large)
My sis and I decided to share a large bowl and it was the perfect amount for us both! I really really enjoyed the pho! The broth was so rich and flavorful.  The selection of shredded chicken was both dark and white, and had a good amount of chopped green onions! I enjoyed this very much!

VIETNAMESE COFFEE - $4.25
So happy this was prepared the traditional and correct way: over a small metal drip bar...that happens to have a faded Nike logo printed on it.  A tad pricey in my opinion but hey, I got exactly what I wanted!  It was sweet and rich and taste with a nice caffeine kick to it!

I really appreciated the stellar service here.  The staff was super friendly.  The restaurant was clean, well lit and I had a wonderful time!

excerpts: Pho Ga/Chicken Noodle Soup is a pretty popular choice here, I got that the first time I came.
In my opinion, the noodles at this location are too soft/mushy and feel as if they've been left in the broth too long.
Broth is pretty satisfying though!
The second time I came, I got the Spring Rolls and a side of Chicken Broth.
Chicken Broth - Comes in a small bowl and makes for a great side!
I noticed that it comes as a small side for the rice & meat plates which was nice.
Flavorful, bit on the salty side.
My friend got the rice plate with fried chicken and commented that it was pretty good.
chicken noodle soup.author: Chelsea W.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Authentic, inexpensive Northern Vietnamese fare. I often frequent and prefer the original Tenderloin location, but the Soma location has its conveniences. I only had some appetizers here recently, so probably can't give the most accurate review.

Service and cleanliness of the place is a bit shoddy but honestly not expecting much. Menu consists of pho, rice & meat plates, etc and entrees generally cost about $9-10. 

Pho Ga/Chicken Noodle Soup is a pretty popular choice here, I got that the first time I came. In my opinion, the noodles at this location are too soft/mushy and feel as if they've been left in the broth too long. Broth is pretty satisfying though! Has a very clean and light taste.

The second time I came, I got the Spring Rolls and a side of Chicken Broth. 

Spring Rolls - The so-called "Fresh" Spring Rolls didn't live up to its name. The meat was also pretty sparsely distributed in the roll. Given that this isn't a  particularly challenging appetizer to execute, this definitely fell short.

Chicken Broth - Comes in a small bowl and makes for a great side! I noticed that it comes as a small side for the rice & meat plates which was nice. Flavorful, bit on the salty side. My
main criticism is that it came with way too much cilantro.. but then again I'm not sure if thats a Vietnamese culinary practice. 

My friend got the rice plate with fried chicken and commented that it was pretty good. From observation, veggies at this restaurant don't seem too fresh.

Cheap Viet eats, but I think next time the Tenderloin location will be my go-to.

excerpts: second for their fresh wide flat noodles, and third for having pho ga, chicken noodle soup.
Having said this, the rolls were a bit over fried and the fresh noodles were over cooked.
But I did enjoy the home style broth and would go back and give it another try.
chicken noodle soup.author: Beatrice L.
chicken noodle soup.review: I wanted to try this place,  first  when I saw that they make their Imperial Rolls with rice paper, which is the authentic recipe and method, second for their fresh wide flat noodles, and third for having pho ga, chicken noodle soup.  Having said this, the rolls were a bit over fried and the fresh noodles were over cooked.  But I did enjoy the home style broth and would go back and give it another try.

excerpts: I ordered the Pho Ga chicken noodle soup and it was delicious.
The broth was cleansing and didn't taste like there was a bunch of MSG added.
In fact, the broth elevated the taste of the noodles.
The noodles absorbed much of the broth
so I didn't even need to add any sriracha to make it taste better.
There was a good amount of chicken to keep the balance well maintained and the Small size portion was perfect for me since I was able to finish the entire bowl and felt full but not overstuffed.
chicken noodle soup.author: Diana C.
chicken noodle soup.review:
What's the best food for hangovers, sick days, and rainy days? PHO! Today's lunch falls under rainy day weather and when I came at 15 minutes past noon, it was already packed with a line out the door that turned out was NOT people waiting for a bus. The wait wasn't too long but next time, I would come half an hour later just to skip the lunch rush.

It was my first time having Northern style pho and all my life, I've only had Southern style so I was a bit thrown off when observing everything. First off, 

-Northern style does not come with the beansprouts and basil plate that is usually in Southern style pho
-But you do get the jalapenos and limes
-There is no hoisin sauce
-But there is sriracha (in a jar container rather than in the bottle form)
-Noodles are flat and wider than Southern style pho
-Broth seems to be the focal point of the dish

I ordered the Pho Ga chicken noodle soup and it was delicious. The broth was cleansing and didn't taste like there was a bunch of MSG added. In fact, the broth elevated the taste of the noodles. The noodles absorbed much of the broth so I didn't even need to add any sriracha to make it taste better. There was a good amount of chicken to keep the balance well maintained and the Small size portion was perfect for me since I was able to finish the entire bowl and felt full but not overstuffed. 

Outside, the menu says Cash Only but I think they started to use Square now so they do take credit card. They have other items besides pho such as banh mi. Bowl sizes comes in just Small or Large and prices range from $6-9.

excerpts: I know the popular dish here is just the chicken noodle soup, but y'all should really try #11.
It's the same soup and chicken but with another type of pork meat and egg shreds added to it!
chicken noodle soup.author: Juila L.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I know the popular dish here is just the chicken noodle soup, but y'all should really try #11.  It's the same soup and chicken but with another type of pork meat and egg shreds added to it!  

I had an awesome experience at this location.  Waiter seems like whatever but he's actually very informative and straight forward about his suggestions which I really appreciate.  Some waiters just say, everything is good, but we all know that's not the truth. This guy is honest with his recommendation.

Yes it's kinda pricy but this is the standard turtle tower experience we all know.  It get get busy during the meal times, expect to wait or come early before or after the rush!  I'd be back again if I'm close by.  Parking isn't easy in the city

excerpts: I order the large chicken noodle soup for take out usually
and it's the best broth, noodles and chicken.
They use Free range btw.
The price is more than reasonable and everything tastes refreshing!
How much better can it get?!
Highly recommend.
chicken noodle soup.author: Jenna C.
chicken noodle soup.review: I don't quite understand the 3 stars for this incredible tasting noodle soup! I order the large chicken noodle soup for take out usually and it's the best broth, noodles and chicken. They use Free range btw. The price is more than reasonable and everything tastes refreshing! How much better can it get?! Highly recommend.

excerpts: I recommended that he try the chicken noodle soup, which is what they're known for, or rare steak, but he wanted to try the same one I get, Pho Sot Vang.
I don't usually recommend this to people who haven't had pho because it's so different, and because both of my roommates have pretty much knocked it, but what do they know about Vietnamese food!?
Anyway he liked it, and though the service was slow, the food was on point.
chicken noodle soup.author: Crystal C.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Okay okay, I know I come here waaayyy too often, and sometimes the food is better or worse than other times, but Turtle Tower is truly my favorite pho I have ever experienced. There is nothing I don't like about the ambiance, the noodles, the meat, the veggies. It's all good, just not really consistently so. 

Last time I went, I brought my friend who had never ever had pho (!!) and he liked it a lot. I recommended that he try the chicken noodle soup, which is what they're known for, or rare steak, but he wanted to try the same one I get, Pho Sot Vang. I don't usually recommend this to people who haven't had pho because it's so different, and because both of my roommates have pretty much knocked it, but what do they know about Vietnamese food!? Anyway he liked it, and though the service was slow, the food was on point.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken noodle soup and they have the best broth I've ever had!
It didn't feel like it was doused in MSG or salt.
It felt clean and I'm pleased that they were generous with the chicken.
Bonus points for meaty pieces of chicken, also --
it wasn't just chunks of fat and skin!
I also love how the bowl was filled with cilantro and veggies.
I'll definitely be back.
I'm sure this would be the perfect place for a hangover ;)
chicken noodle soup.author: Janet H.
chicken noodle soup.review:
More like 3.5 stars...

I'm not a huge pho lover or maybe I've just never had amazing pho in my life, but Turtle Tower is solid! I ordered the chicken noodle soup and they have the best broth I've ever had! It didn't feel like it was doused in MSG or salt. It felt clean and I'm pleased that they were generous with the chicken. Bonus points for meaty pieces of chicken, also -- it wasn't just chunks of fat and skin! I also love how the bowl was filled with cilantro and veggies. I'll definitely be back. I'm sure this would be the perfect place for a hangover ;)

excerpts: We had a bowl of the traditional beef pho and the "chicken noodle soup" with eggrolls.
The chicken noodle soup was actually my preference over the beef pho, though it was also very basic.
The chicken noodle soup was actually my preference over the beef pho, though it was also very basic.
chicken noodle soup.author: Trish P.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Came here on a HowAboutWe date which included two bowls of pho, two coffees, and an order of eggrolls.

When we arrived, there was a crowd of people waiting to get in.  When I went to the front counter to give my name, the woman seemed irritated and was short with me - probably due to the afternoon rush.

After about a 10 minute wait, we sat down at our little table near the bathroom.  The interior is modest, if not slightly dingy.  

The same woman seemed to have a change in attitude and politely explained our choices.  We had a bowl of the traditional beef pho and the "chicken noodle soup" with eggrolls. She even poured our Vietnamese coffees for us (strong as hell, but good).

Now, I'm Vietnamese American and am a little embarrassed to admit that this was my first time tasting Northern style.  The taste of the beef pho....surprised me. It was oily and had a grilled taste that overpowered the broth.  There was no hoisin or siracha. 

It wasn't bad, by any means, but just different than what I'm used to.  I found it to be lacking the complex and hearty flavors of Southern pho - it was simple and just okay. 

The chicken noodle soup was actually my preference over the beef pho, though it was also very basic.  The eggrolls were fine.  

Overall, just kind of a ho-hum experience.

excerpts: Number 9 chicken noodle soup is really good
but sometimes if I'm feeling intestines I get the number 10.
Coffee is nice but takes awhile
chicken noodle soup.author: Cm Tú Đ.
chicken noodle soup.review: Number 9 chicken noodle soup is really good but sometimes if I'm feeling intestines I get the number 10. Coffee is nice but takes awhile

excerpts: I've also tried the Chicken Noodle Soup, which was tasty as well.
I only wish that they would remove the skin from the chicken!
The pho noodles resemble more like "Haw Fun" and it is not served with bean sprouts!
chicken noodle soup.author: Steven L.
chicken noodle soup.review:
My favorite is the Combination Rare Beef, Tripe and Well Done Beef Noodle Soup!  It is very tasty and the broth was full of flavor.  I've also tried the Chicken Noodle Soup, which was tasty as well.  I only wish that they would remove the skin from the chicken!  The pho noodles resemble more like "Haw Fun" and it is not served with bean sprouts!  I believe it's from a different part of Vietnam.  

Service is good and workers are friendly, but often a very long wait during lunch time. They have a sign in sheet at the door, but you know it may be awhile when you see folks congregating outside.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken noodle soup, and we got it extremely fast.
I ended up giving my roommate all my chicken and tried to go for the noodles and soup.
chicken noodle soup.author: Brittany P.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Mannnn, I don't know if it was that day or if it was me but I did not have a good expereince at Turtle Tower. 

My friend and her boyfriend love this place, so I decided to try it out with her. The server was super sweet and nice but the place was a little dirty. They sat us down, but there was noodles and soup all over the table and seat. (I don't mind, I understand he was busy) I ordered the chicken noodle soup, and we got it extremely fast. 

Something about the soup turned me off, it had a weird stench to it, to the point where it didn't smell clean. I ended up giving my roommate all my chicken and tried to go for the noodles and soup. I liked that the noodles were thick comparing it to the other pho, but it was reallllllyyyy soggy. 

I am hoping the next time I go, it will be a better taste! I want to love you, Turtle Tower, I really do... 

Tasty Tip: I don't have one...

excerpts: Their Chicken Noodle Soup Vietnamese Style tastes the same here.
chicken noodle soup.author: Tiffany D.
chicken noodle soup.review:
The surrounding area has no crowd or anything enticing besides this restaurant.  The location to have this restaurant there seems random, but if you want to dine in seclusion, this place is it!  

Their Chicken Noodle Soup Vietnamese Style tastes the same here.  

At least you can pay by credit card and not only cash.  It is the smallest Turtle Tower compared to the other two places in San Francisco.  Inconvenient that it is closed on Sundays.

excerpts: Nothing hits the spot like a delicious bowl of northern Vietnamese style chicken noodle soup (pho ga)!

This time, I ordered off the "secret menu" and got the F9 pho ha which came with some extras (julienned pieces of the fancy pork, some pieces of the rice noodles pan fried with corn oil which created some more complex flavors in the bowl) and was delightful.
If you like pho ga, try the secret menu version for a yummy twist.

chicken noodle soup.review: Highly recommend! Arguable the best chicken noodle soup in SF! Be sure to try the imperial roll as well, delicious. Owner came out and chatted with us, great guy and a great place!

excerpts: For the record the 4 items served on the Wednesday I visited were the Well-done Flank and Beef Brisket Noodle Soup, the Rare Beef Noodle Soup, the Chicken Noodle Soup and Imperial Rolls.
so I ordered a large Rare Beef Noodle Soup and a couple of Imperial Rolls.
As I've come to expect from their Geary location the service here is just as speedy with your food ready in mere minutes after your order is placed.
chicken noodle soup.author: Wilhelm Y.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I've eaten at the Turtle Tower Restaurant on Geary Blvd. numerous times, and I've never reviewed them so when I saw that Turtle Tower was opening up a third location on the corner of 6th and Bryant Streets, the space formerly occupied by TEN7M and Quiznos before that, I was giddy with anticipation being that the new location is just a block and a half from where I work.

Fast forward only two short weeks and the restaurant is now open for business serving a limited menu during their soft opening.  The official grand opening is scheduled for next Wednesday, June 1, but I couldn't wait one whole week so as soon as I heard what the limited menu was I stepped in to try it out.

For the record the 4 items served on the Wednesday I visited were the Well-done Flank and Beef Brisket Noodle Soup, the Rare Beef Noodle Soup, the Chicken Noodle Soup and Imperial Rolls.

Those four choices suited me fine as all I really wanted was a hot bowl of beef noodle soup so I ordered a large Rare Beef Noodle Soup and a couple of Imperial Rolls.  As I've come to expect from their Geary location the service here is just as speedy with your food ready in mere minutes after your order is placed.  Accompanied by a lime wedge and some thinly sliced jalapenos plated separately the clear beef broth seemed just a tad too oily (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/KAHDxIOccnc1P1m5abjM0A?select=qPxHdydcJr9tM9QTa4xC_w), but once I dove into that bowl the extra oil on top seemed unnoticeable.

The flavor-rich broth was perfectly seasoned and I loved the hint of ginger in it.  The portion of noodles and beef to broth was perfect.  The Imperial Rolls can be ordered as an entrée with vermicelli noodles and fresh veggies, but I elected to order just two on its own (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/KAHDxIOccnc1P1m5abjM0A?select=zdAwClljoGD8NWdEzZUlDg).  These were very good as most deep-fried goodies are, and since I do no deep-frying at home you can bet I'll order these again on a future visit.

So far in 2011 I've done a lot more cooking at home, and brown-bagging my meals for work have become the norm for me, but I know for a fact I can't make pho this good at home so I may need to rethink this whole not-going-out-to-restaurants-too-often thing thanks to the new Turtle Tower Restaurant.

As mentioned by another Yelper in her review some culinary surprises available only at this Turtle Tower location awaits you.  For a sneak preview I've posted the menu in the photos section.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Turtle Tower!  I have a feeling you're going to be seeing me very often.

excerpts: - Chicken noodle soup.
Yah, doesn't sound interesting but this is the best chicken pho i've ever had.
chicken noodle soup.author: Jane A.
chicken noodle soup.review:
NORTHERN STYLE PHO
(5 stars)

Once you go Northern, you never go back.

- FOOD, delicious pho
- PRICES, affordable
- SERVICE, fast
- AMBIANCE, small

I go to this location because its the less crowded one and I find it to be the cleanest too. I like exposing friends to "northern style" and when they have it they are pretty amazed. Only come here for the soups, the sandwiches were not the business. When I bring people here they never believe me how good it is until you dip into it. 

HEFFER STATUS.

PHO SOT VANG ($6.50) - Beef stewed in wine sauce noodle soup. It doesn't look the best but it is SO AMAZING. Can I make love to this soup because it is just that amazing. Hmmm Hmmmm Hmmmm....

PHO GA ($6.50) - Chicken noodle soup. Yah, doesn't sound interesting but this is the best chicken pho i've ever had. You just have to order it to really know what it is all about.

Will I be back? YES YES YES YES YES.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....

excerpts: I'd highly recommend the chicken noodle soup or (pho GA), if you're feeling adventurous I'd recommend them with the giblets too - they add an extra depth of flavor and interesting texture.
chicken noodle soup.author: Keyue B.
chicken noodle soup.review: No idea why this place only has 3 stars, it's amazing. The noodles are soft but you have the options to change them, the broth is extremely flavorful and not because of MSG. I'd highly recommend the chicken noodle soup or (pho GA), if you're feeling adventurous I'd recommend them with the giblets too - they add an extra depth of flavor and interesting texture.

excerpts: my default at turtle tower is always the chicken noodle soup
so i also cant say how the other choices are.
chicken noodle soup.author: Alex H.
chicken noodle soup.review:
it doesnt seem as good as the one on geary but considering there arent many other choices for a nice bowl of noodle soup, this is the best option you have in the soma area. 
its a small place so you should also prepare to wait if you get there around noon.

my default at turtle tower is always the chicken noodle soup so i also cant say how the other choices are.

excerpts: Think of it as the best chicken noodle soup you will ever eat.
A fragrant, flavorful chicken broth deepened with the wonderful spices that define pho.
Excellent quality, though quite oily.
Thick, fresh noodles that render you incapable of understanding how any restaurant can serve anything else, finished with a generous topping of green onions and cilantro to brighten the dish.
It's heavenly.
If you were hungover, sick, or depressed, I think this would fix you right up.
It was damn near perfect, but the serving of chicken, though ample, was a tad dry.
Tender, moist chicken would have made this pho absolutely flawless, and would probably have had me on my knees with tears streaming down my face.
I'm kind of glad it wasn't,
so I could keep it together.
But the one flaw could be overlooked, and I'll still consider this one of the best bowls of pho I've ever had.
The portion was huge, too.
We both ordered smalls, which were only $6.75, and were more than satisfied.
I couldn't even finish, which was unusual for me!
chicken noodle soup.author: Victoria T.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Turtle Tower is unique because it serves northern-style pho, also known as pho bac. Its simplicity sets it apart from the southern style pho you'd find in most restaurants. You don't get the plate of garnishes considered standard with southern style, so you can't customize your pho. Northern pho is designed to eat exactly as is - though there were actually some sauces on the table and jalepenos brought on the side, so maybe pho bac isn't as strict as I thought. Or Turtle Tower has made a few compromises. Either way.

I always think of parking in San Francisco as a big pain. Parallel parking and meters prevail, and I'm too lazy to deal with it all, so I rarely make it into the city. Parking here wasn't too bad, though. After a few laps around the block, I found a nearby spot. The SoMa location is on a corner easily accessible from the freeway and has a sunny interior, with shades of yellow and cool old photos on the walls. It was noisy, not a place you'd like to sit for hours, but comfortable enough.

The menu features pho, bun, cm, banh mi, and a few special items like chao (rice porridge) and even xoi (sticky rice). Though I've been advised to try the pho sot vang, I had to first try Turtle Tower's specialty, the pho ga. It turned out to be an amazing choice.

Think of it as the best chicken noodle soup you will ever eat. A fragrant, flavorful chicken broth deepened with the wonderful spices that define pho. Excellent quality, though quite oily. Thick, fresh noodles that render you incapable of understanding how any restaurant can serve anything else, finished with a generous topping of green onions and cilantro to brighten the dish. It's heavenly. If you were hungover, sick, or depressed, I think this would fix you right up. It was damn near perfect, but the serving of chicken, though ample, was a tad dry.

Tender, moist chicken would have made this pho absolutely flawless, and would probably have had me on my knees with tears streaming down my face. I'm kind of glad it wasn't, so I could keep it together. But the one flaw could be overlooked, and I'll still consider this one of the best bowls of pho I've ever had. The portion was huge, too. We both ordered smalls, which were only $6.75, and were more than satisfied. I couldn't even finish, which was unusual for me! Thanks, Turtle Tower!


Rating Breakdown:

Taste (13/14):
Broth flavor- 5/5
Noodle & meat quality- 4/5
Garnish selection- N/A (automatic 2 pts)
Portion size- 2/2

Restaurant (14/16):
Service- 4/5
Cleanliness- 5/5
Atmosphere- 3/4
Speed of arrival- 2/2

Total: 27/30

Join the phoventure at www.phoacrossamerica.com

excerpts: Since I'm too lazy to Uber to the restaurant, I usually get delivery of 3 bowls: 1 dac biet (beef base broth), 1 chicken pho, and 1 egg chicken noodle soup.
chicken noodle soup.author: Momo M.
chicken noodle soup.review:
As a Vietnamese gal, every once in a while I would crave pho...

Since I'm too lazy to Uber to the restaurant, I usually get delivery of 3 bowls: 1 dac biet (beef base broth), 1 chicken pho, and 1 egg chicken noodle soup. 

The small bowls are actually REALLY filling (thank you American sizing) so I divide them in half, heat up the broth on stove, place the noodles in a soup bowl and then pour the broth into the noodles @ boiling temperature (3-5min). 

Can't really rate condiments because northern pho is less dressy than southern pho. But I cheat and use that bottle of hot sriracha in my refridgerator. 

My advice is to not order the rice wrapper rolls. They were really dry :( 

Also can't rate service or cleanliness of restaurant because I eat at home. With my cat.

excerpts: Put another way, this is as good as -maybe even better then- your grandma's chicken noodle soup.
Ya see, most noodle soup places have one or the other: great noodles or great soup.
Rarely does a place have both!
This is why i'm dissing your grandma in such a pubic place.
chicken noodle soup.author: Joseph C.
chicken noodle soup.review:
First a clarification: 
     I noticed that the 6th street location has significantly fewer stars compared to the original restaurant? I have been to both spots many times and  I'm telling you they are very very similar.  I have no idea what the Yelp others are talking about?  I dare you to a blinded, head to head taste test!

The review:
     Seriously now...yes, the chicken pho (Pho Ga)  is that good.  I call it a spa treatment for the stomach after a hard day (or night) .  Put another way, this is as good as -maybe even better then- your grandma's chicken noodle soup.  Ya see, most noodle soup places have one or the other: great noodles or great soup.  Rarely does a place have both! This is why i'm dissing your grandma in such a pubic place.
     If you are new in town or just visiting SF, here is how I order it;

LARGE PHO GA  (That's their chichen pho of course!)
     - i ask for less noodles because its always more than enough noodles and i want all the beautiful broth i can get.. 
     - if you or your friend are squeamish about chicken skin, you can ask for no skin or just breast meat for a little extra $)  
     -everyone gets a side of sliced jalapenos and lemon wedge. Dump the jalapenos into the soup (if you are into spicy) and ask for some extra lemon.  I squeeze one wedge in the soup and one in the little condiment dish, where I will add fish sauce and pepper to taste. This is your "house-made" dipping sauce for your chicken:)
     -please note  this is northern vietnamese style so you dont get that plate full of bean sprouts and herbs

IMPERIAL ROLL 
     -entree order so you get the lettuce, vermicelli, and herbs to make wraps.
      -order comes with three rolls.  But you can order them individually (without the sides) if you are alone or want a just a little more.
     - I use a drizzle of sriracha in the dipping sauce for a little kick.

VIETNAMESE COFFEE 
     -thank God they still use the individual drip method (i hate it when it comes premixed) 
     -after brewing, I will sometimes carefully spoon out some of the sweetened condensed milk at the bottom of the glass. Then of course stirring together the coffee/milk and pouring it over the ice. (Its sometimes too sweet if you don't...you"ll understand when you see it) 

HOUSE TEA
     - its free and good for you 

Post Scriptum:
     "But joe, my boyfriend is in the mood for beef and he gets kinda crabby when he's hungover?"  I hear ya! No worries, when I'm in that red meat mood, their beef Pho is a very good arternative. But actually i would recommend:

 PHO BO AP CHAO NUOC (Stir-fried Beef with Celery, Carrot, Onion, and Leek) Its pan-fried with the same noodle and then soup is poured over.  I love this one too!

excerpts: Reminded me of Campbell's canned chicken noodle soup.
chicken noodle soup.author: Franklin F.
chicken noodle soup.review:
There are a lot of reviews of this place that essentially rate it as "adequate."  That's being very charitable.  Or maybe people just have very low standards.  I think "terrible" is closer to the mark.  My wife ordered the Ph Gà. The chicken broth was bland and flavorless. Reminded me of Campbell's canned chicken noodle soup.  The cuts of chicken were all dark meat - fatty and gristly. No bean sprouts or basil, veggies which are standard with the dish everywhere else. I ordered the Bún Ch Hà Ni (pork with vermicelli). The pork came in a bowl with a greasy broth.  The Imperial Rolls were badly deep fried - dripping with grease.  

Sunflower (which is only ok, IMHO) is vastly superior.  If you want truly outstanding Vietnamese try Phuong Thao Sunnyvale.  Best I've had in the Bay Area.

excerpts: chicken noodle soup that I was looking forward to was way too salty.
we also ordered the stir fried beef with vegetables rice plate.
the beef was also very salty.
very disappointed.
chicken noodle soup.author: Linda O.
chicken noodle soup.review: chicken noodle soup that I was looking forward to was way too salty. we also ordered the stir fried beef with vegetables rice plate. the beef was also very salty. very disappointed.

excerpts: Sometimes you just need chicken noodle soup!!!
If you want more veggies, order number 5 with chicken instead of beef.
Then you get celery, carrot, and onions too.
I wish you could just buy the fried chicken leg without the whole rice plate and that they took credit cards bc
I don't often carry much cash.
chicken noodle soup.author: Patricia A.
chicken noodle soup.review: Sometimes you just need chicken noodle soup!!! If you want more veggies, order number 5 with chicken instead of beef. Then you get celery, carrot, and onions too. I wish you could just buy the fried chicken leg without the whole rice plate and that they took credit cards bc I don't often carry much cash.

excerpts: FREE Small pho ga chicken noodle soup (reg $6.20).
I loved it.
Steamed chicken w/ bone $8.20 small
- it was ok, nothing special.
chicken noodle soup.author: Ann L.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Went to this location of Turtle Tower Restaurant, 6th & Bryant, because of the Scoutmob deal.  It's a long walk from Civic Center Bart so I don't recommend walking.  Better to drive.

Wait was maybe 1hr, I don't know.  Very long.  We still put our name on the list.

FREE Small pho ga chicken noodle soup (reg $6.20).  I loved it.  B. not so much, he doesn't like their noodles, but I did.

Giu Cuon Spring rolls $5.15 - 2 rolls cut up w/ mint, shrimp, pork, fresh rice paper, peanut sauce on the side. Tasted ok.

I wanted Banh Cuon - it's hard to find everywhere, so was looking forward to it.  Sold out when I went.  So sad.

Steamed chicken w/ bone $8.20 small - it was ok, nothing special.  Lemon/salty dipping sauce on the side.

Iced condensed milk Vietnamese coffee $3.20 - That's pricey for Vietnamese iced coffee.  Tasted ok.

Our total about $18 before tip.  They take credit card.  One unisex bathroom in the back.

Closed Sun
M-Sat 10-9

Website:
www.turtletowersf.com

excerpts: Ok, I gave it another try, Was told that the Chicken noodle soup was the truth.
Yes indeed, it was good.
Come to find out that this is their pride and joy.
If you do happen to eat here, order this for sure.
The only thing they forget to add when taking to go orders is the lemon pepper sauce, which enhances the soup.
Double check to make sure they throw that in.
chicken noodle soup.author: Pedro N.
chicken noodle soup.review: Ok, I gave it another try, Was told that the Chicken noodle soup was the truth.  Yes indeed, it was good.  Come to find out that this is their pride and joy.  If you do happen to eat here, order this for sure.  The only thing they forget to add when taking to go orders is the lemon pepper sauce, which enhances the soup.  Double check to make sure they throw that in.

excerpts: Of course I stuck with the only thing I really know, their Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup).
chicken noodle soup.author: Lauren K.
chicken noodle soup.review:
The one on Larkin was way better than this.

I've been craving Turtle Tower for awhile now and decided to go to this location just because it closes later than the one on Larkin. They have a dinner menu and a lunch menu but you can order from either one. Of course I stuck with the only thing I really know, their Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup).

The Pho Ga broth was a bit salty than I last remembered it. So salty that I poured a quarter of my water in my bowl and probably could have gotten away with pouring the rest of my water in too (well maybe not). The noodles were also mushy and overcooked. Probably the reason why I didn't really feel like finishing it all up.

Their service was good. She made sure that right when I put my menu down, she would take my order so I wasn't left waiting.  I loved how they poured us water using the Brita Filter.

excerpts: I came here with a friend because she had a scoubt mob deal...free chicken noodle soup!
I expected it to be a small bowl of soup, but it was actually quite big and good.
It's a Vietnamese version of the dish.
chicken noodle soup.author: Margaret R.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I came here with a friend because she had a scoubt mob deal...free chicken noodle soup! I expected it to be a small bowl of soup, but it was actually quite big and good. It's a Vietnamese version of the dish. It definitely was not pho though.

The service was nice, but seemed a bit aggressive. I didn't like how they made us give them our email addresses. 

The imperials rolls were small. It cost $2 something for one teeny roll. Poo!

All in all, it was decent - probably because I only paid $4 including tip.

excerpts: After Anna explained that this wasn't your "typical" pho, and done in the style of North Vietnam, where they specialized in things like chicken noodle soup, I ended up ordering a pho ga, and getting an imperial roll to share.
The imperial roll, while tasty, was a surprisingly small bite-size portion (given the price), and greasy to boot.
chicken noodle soup.author: Johnny W.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Finding myself frequently in the mood for pho lately, Anna D and I dropped by Turtle Tower on her suggestion, seeing as I'd been avoiding them up until now. For what reason I did this is unclear now, and unfortunate, as it turns out that the food here is actually rather tasty.

After Anna explained that this wasn't your "typical" pho, and done in the style of North Vietnam, where they specialized in things like chicken noodle soup, I ended up ordering a pho ga, and getting an imperial roll to share. The imperial roll, while tasty, was a surprisingly small bite-size portion (given the price), and greasy to boot. The pho ga however, was enjoyable; it did, however, become fairly salty towards the end (probably a result of sitting in the broth so long).

And while I think they're a tad higher priced than most places, I can certainly see myself coming back for their noodles.

excerpts: Ga. The Chicken Noodle Soup.
The noodles are soft and not too hard.
The chicken is not too dry.
And the soup has a great taste.
chicken noodle soup.author: Alice T.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I LOVE Turtle Tower. I think it is THE best pho I have ever had. 

This place is northern Vietnamese food. Not your typical pho. So if you come in, don't expect it to be the skinny noodles with bean sprouts/basil and lime. They don't give you that extra condiments.

My favorite from there is the Pho Ga. The Chicken Noodle Soup. The noodles are soft and not too hard. The chicken is not too dry. And the soup has a great taste. I love coming here when I'm sick, cause it clears up my nose and makes me feel better. 

Every time I am in SF, especially if it is on a cold day, I will try to make my way to go to one. They have three locations, the one I usually go to is the one in Richmond. However, I was at AT&T Park and the one on 6th St. was closer.

If your gonna eat pho and your in the city, I would say go there. It's too good to not try it out.

excerpts: I honestly haven't had a better pho ga (chicken noodle soup) anywhere other then Turtle tower.
However, I haven't been to Vietnam
and I'm not declaring that it's the best ever
chicken noodle soup.author: Stephanie K.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I honestly haven't had a better pho ga (chicken noodle soup) anywhere other then Turtle tower. However, I haven't been to Vietnam and I'm not declaring that it's the best ever; It's just the best among the ones I've tasted in my lifetime. 

The broth is so simple and clean, yet packs the right amount of flavor for the noodles. 

At this particular location I only ordered my pho ga 'to go'. With a quick scan of the place, it seems to be a lot cleaner then the original location out in the tenderloin. I did realize recently that that location has gone through a renovation.

I also ordered the pork chop over rice. This dish however is pretty typical and doesn't quite stand out as anything out of the ordinary.

Overall thoughts: Definitely worth coming to Turtle tower for their pho ga! Getting it 'to go" is a great option as they separate everything for you to combine at your own convenience.

excerpts: Came here for their FREE Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup) from ScoutMob.
Let just say the noodles were not the vermicelli noodles I thought it would be and it also came with a limited amount of vegetables with only jalapenos.
You would also have to ask for sriracha sauce probably because they do not want you to drain it for them.
Well you can't beat the price of free I guess.

We also ordered spring rolls and it seemed different from what I would normally get from other Vietnamese restaurants because its not deep fried with fish sauce instead it was wrapped with rice wrap with vegetables and shrimp.
Another downside its that it is cash
only so when we payed with a card without knowing the worker pointed towards the ATM behind us with the heavy fees.
Tip for future customers! BRING CASH.
chicken noodle soup.author: Peter C.
chicken noodle soup.review: Came here for their FREE Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup) from ScoutMob. Let just say the noodles were not the vermicelli noodles I thought it would be and it also came with a limited amount of vegetables with only jalapenos. You would also have to ask for sriracha sauce probably because they do not want you to drain it for them. Well you can't beat the price of free I guess. We also ordered spring rolls and it seemed different from what I would normally get from other Vietnamese restaurants because its not deep fried with fish sauce instead it was wrapped with rice wrap with vegetables and shrimp. Another downside its that it is cash only so when we payed with a card without knowing the worker pointed towards the ATM behind us with the heavy fees. Tip for future customers! BRING CASH.

excerpts: Gà - Chicken Noodle Soup, I patiently waited another 15 minutes before the bowl of delicious came my way.
chicken noodle soup.author: Jason H.
chicken noodle soup.review:
3.5 Stars

I stopped by Turtle Tower's newest location in SOMA for a late lunch. I immediately noticed how much smaller this restaurant was compared to their Geary counterpart. Coming in at 2PM on a Friday I still had to wait roughly 15 minutes for a table and I was definitely surprised!

Once I got seated I continued to play the FUN waiting game since their was only one server handling the cash register and all the tables. I guess it can't hurt for the server to smile now and again. He definitely seemed exhausted.

Once I finally put in my order for a #9) Pho Gà - Chicken Noodle Soup, I patiently waited another 15 minutes before the bowl of delicious came my way. A couple other things to note:

1) The broth is amazingly tasty and light. You might get addicted to it too. I pretty much drank all the soup from the bowl.

2) Turtle Tower is Northern Vietnamese styled so your bowl of noodles won't be accompanied with a lot of extra condiments like bean sprouts and basil. Your order will come with sliced jalapenos and lemon though.

3) The noodles are flat and wider then your typical Southern Vietnamese styled Pho.

4) Remember to bring CASH, unless you want to use their ATM.

There was nothing wrong with the food and it was solid 4 stars. I was disappointed in the wait time and the service offered at this location so I slightly lowered my rating.

excerpts: The dish that everyone raves about, the pho ga (chicken noodle soup), is really just so so.
Besides, which chicken noodle soup comes with NO veggies?
Besides, which chicken noodle soup comes with NO veggies?
chicken noodle soup.author: Kristen S.
chicken noodle soup.review: The dish that everyone raves about, the pho ga (chicken noodle soup), is really just so so.  Besides, which chicken noodle soup comes with NO veggies?

excerpts: Chicken noodle soup of any kind out of a can has way more flavor.
The only real flavor was in the broth, which tasted vaguely fishy -- it was not in the least bit appetizing.
Service was non-existent -- I had to keep flagging someone down to refill the thimble-sized water glass.
It's a very short walk from home, which is appealing, but there wasn't a single thing about the experience that would compel me to return.
chicken noodle soup.author: Thomas M.
chicken noodle soup.review: I thought it would be better.  I had the chicken noodles.  There was not much flavor, curiously.  Chicken noodle soup of any kind out of a can has way more flavor.  The only real flavor was in the broth, which tasted vaguely fishy -- it was not in the least bit appetizing.  Service was non-existent -- I had to keep flagging someone down to refill the thimble-sized water glass.  It's a very short walk from home, which is appealing, but there wasn't a single thing about the experience that would compel me to return.

excerpts: Overally, it was nice alternative to the usual chicken noodle soup I eat.
The small was surprisingly filling.
chicken noodle soup.author: Virginia Y.
chicken noodle soup.review: Free pho ga!!!! I came here cause of scout mob's free deal. I think this place serves northern vietnamese food? The pho ga isn't the typical vermicelli noodles I usually get. It's wide flat rice noodles served with a clear chicken broth and pieces of chicken  with a side of jalapeños for your pleasure. The style of cooking felt more like chinese food. But like I said, it's probably northern vietnamese cooking. Overally, it was nice alternative to the usual chicken noodle soup I eat. The small was surprisingly filling.

excerpts: Chicken noodle soup : excellent soup base, tender pieces of shredded dark and white chicken meat.
chicken noodle soup.author: Christina T.
chicken noodle soup.review:
Since Turtle Tower in the Tenderloin closes fairly early, and the Richmond dist location is far from convenient, opening this one here to replace the once failed chain Quiznos has proved this chain Vietnamese restaurant made the right choice. They have longer business hours which cater to the late dinner crowds and also gives the SFPD a healthier option to McDonalds or Subway. 

We had to try this place out also because of their extended dinner menu offered here aside from the usual chicken noodle soups and beef stew noodle soups at the other locations. 

We ordered their chicken noodles soup (of course), with a side of 2 imperial rolls (dinner menu ones have crab and pork in them) and one order of their rice rolls with diced mushrooms and marinated pork. 

Chicken noodle soup : excellent soup base, tender pieces of shredded dark and white chicken meat.

Imperial rolls : not my favorite. It had a onion infused taste to it and I do not like onions at all. Imperial rolls at PPQ on Irving still gets my #1 vote.

Rice rolls with pork/mushrooms: very fresh (waitress made sure we knew they made a fresh batch of these rolls around noon.) The rice noodles were soft and not too chewy. The marinated pork and mushrooms inside were very tasty and I couldn't stop munching on the left over scraps that were on the plate. This is a dish I would recommend trying out if you want a different type of appetizer to go with your entree besides imperial rolls or spring rolls.

They also had whole roasted crab on their dinner menu, which I plan on trying out next time! 

Service here is where I had to knock off one whole star! Maybe because it's still new, they don't have a full staff for waiters/waitresses, but that night, they only had one server/waitress/hostess. She practically had to multitask all night. I felt a little bad for her. Given she was the only one, service was pretty slow and my water wasn't filled once. It's ok....I can't let the service here stop me from coming again. Overall, I enjoyed my meal and hopefully they hire more help so my next experience here would be completely awesome!

excerpts: Tried the chicken noodle soup, with egg noodles.
It was very flavorful & loaded with chicken, veggies & noodles.
Loved the fresh jalapeno to put on the soup.
All in all, a very good deal & staff was friendly.
Cash only!
chicken noodle soup.author: Donna W.
chicken noodle soup.review: Had jury duty & this place is very convenient at the corner of 6th & Bryant.  So glad I got there before the lunch crowd with a line out the door.  Tried the chicken noodle soup, with egg noodles.  It was very flavorful & loaded with chicken, veggies & noodles.  Loved the fresh jalapeno to put on the soup.  All in all, a very good deal & staff was friendly.  Cash only!

excerpts: I love their chicken noodle soup, the broth is so yummy.
I'll find myself spending the first 5 min of receiving it just sipping on the broth.
I'm glad they opened one by my work
chicken noodle soup.author: Rosie W.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I like Turtle Tower because they're different from most Vietnamese places I've been to. I can expect a healthy tasting, yet still delicious and fulfilling meal. I love their chicken noodle soup, the broth is so yummy. I'll find myself spending the first 5 min of receiving it just sipping on the broth. I'm glad they opened one by my work :) 

One disappointing thing I might add - the eggrolls are SMALL. I love fried eggrolls (the Imperial one) and I ordered it last week. It was the size of my index finger (length and width, no kidding) and they charged $2.15 EACH (I ordered three). Never again.

excerpts: Got the chicken noodle soup.. was not anything special.. would not go back there.
it was plain and boring.
chicken noodle soup.author: C A.
chicken noodle soup.review: Got the chicken noodle soup.. was not anything special.. would not go back there. it was plain and boring.

excerpts: Should not be on the top 100 things to eat before you die - should be on the 100 things to eat that make you want to die of disappointment list instead) and said, "Here's your chicken noodle soup".
Sorry, my what?
The broth was salty and tasted lemony, no flavor or substance really.
I basically got a heaping bowl of soggy noodles (not the kind I am used to with southern), bland broth, some slivers low-grade chicken (lots of fat and skin), and a side of mild jalapenos to dump in.
Oh, and a lemon wedge.
No hoisin, no bean sprouts, no veggies unless you count slivers of green onions.
If I wanted chicken noodle soup, I would have went to Safeway - Campbells is like $2 I am sure.
I wanted tasty pho ga.
If I wanted chicken noodle soup, I would have went to Safeway - Campbells is like $2 I am sure.
I wanted tasty pho ga.
chicken noodle soup.author: Adrienne C.
chicken noodle soup.review:
In a word: unimpressive.  In several words:

There is a reason that this the the bay areas "only authentic northern vietnamese" restaurant.  If this is is truly what northern vietnamese is supposed to be, then I will never bother trying it again.  What a disappointment - we were expecting the pho we are used to and instead got what looked like a poor man's pho.

When they brought me my much acclaimed pho ga (side note: wtf 7x7 mag?  Should not be on the top 100 things to eat before you die - should be on the 100 things to eat that make you want to die of disappointment list instead) and said, "Here's your chicken noodle soup".  Sorry, my what?  The broth was salty and tasted lemony, no flavor or substance really.  I basically got a heaping bowl of soggy noodles (not the kind I am used to with southern), bland broth, some slivers low-grade chicken (lots of fat and skin), and a side of mild jalapenos to dump in.  Oh, and a lemon wedge. No hoisin, no bean sprouts, no veggies unless you count slivers of green onions.  If I wanted chicken noodle soup, I would have went to Safeway - Campbells is like $2 I am sure.  I wanted tasty pho ga.  This may partly be because its authentic northern as opposed to southern, but if this is what northern is, I do need to try it again.

People, there is a reason it is so cheap - because you are not getting much.  In fact,  I think it might be over priced for what it is.  Oh, and the building is an old Quiznos, which they somehow found a way to make even dumpier.  And there was a TV blaring E! the whole time.  Whoever said it was like a spa for the stomach must be used to going to the scary cut rate ones in the tenderloin.

Avoid at all costs.  I will never go back.

excerpts: Awesome chicken noodle soup and gotta try the Vietnamese coffee!
chicken noodle soup.author: Alan M.
chicken noodle soup.review: Awesome chicken noodle soup and gotta try the Vietnamese coffee!

excerpts: no intro really needed here, it's only the most popular vietnamese chicken noodle soup in the city!
i say the food is solid, but not the best.
the broth is tasty and not too greasy.
portions are average with good amount of meat.
worth a visit to see what the fuss is all about.
chicken noodle soup.author: Melissa Y.
chicken noodle soup.review: no intro really needed here, it's only the most popular vietnamese chicken noodle soup in the city! i say the food is solid, but not the best. the broth is tasty and not too greasy. portions are average with good amount of meat. worth a visit to see what the fuss is all about.

excerpts: I also tasted the Chicken Noodle soup that my friend was having, and it's the same as everywhere else, Broth, Noodles and pieces of chicken (with skin - yuk).
We also ordered the Imperial Rolls and they were aaaaay, barely ok, nothing special.
So save your money and look for a better Vietnamese restaurant, there are a lot of them in the SF.
The restaurant accepts cash only which usually tells a lot about a place.
Can't complain to credit Card Company and they have a lot to hide, besides cash, which is not my business - but just saying.
chicken noodle soup.author: Tongue-Me e.
chicken noodle soup.review: OK, I am not sure why I was dragged there, but Yuk Yuk Yuk. What kind of food is that? I have had Vietnamese food before and it is by far tastier. I ordered the Beef sautéed in red wine (#17?), and what a bad choice I have made. First the meat was served in a small bowl that has "wine sauce", which is far from it. I think the way it cooked, is after boiling the meat, they added some red wine and cooked for couple of minutes and poured it in the bowl. Second the meat had a lot of fat on it more than the lean, it was like treasure hunt to find beef. The soup that came with the order was OK, since all of them taste the same, some made up broth (nothing special). I also tasted the Chicken Noodle soup that my friend was having, and it's the same as everywhere else, Broth, Noodles and pieces of chicken (with skin - yuk). We also ordered the Imperial Rolls and they were aaaaay, barely ok, nothing special. So save your money and look for a better Vietnamese restaurant, there are a lot of them in the SF. The restaurant accepts cash only which usually tells a lot about a place. Can't complain to credit Card Company and they have a lot to hide, besides cash, which is not my business - but just saying.

excerpts: Also, Pho Ga isn't just the Vietnamese version of the chicken noodle soup.
They've been eating it for hundreds of years.
As for the best Pho on the planet, it's a northern style place in Saigon, which I won't name since it's already too popular among the locals in Saigon.
The flavor of that Pho is so vastly different and better than any Pho
I've tasted across the USA.
I love the chicken version.
After finishing the noodles, I just sit there and sip on the soup base.
A very good meal for the winter weather.
When it comes to their other food, I have little experience.
I had a rice dish once at the Larkin location and left hungry
so I never order anything
but Pho at TT.
chicken noodle soup.author: Loc N.
chicken noodle soup.review:
I'm not going to be judgmental towards the people who wrote bad reviews or wrote that this place doesn't really serve Pho.  I've gone to this place 3 or 4 times since they've opened.  In the beginning, there were some opening pains with handling the crowds and the quality wasn't up to the one on Larkin St, but I went there today, and the quality was excellent.  I think it takes awhile before a new location gets its footing if it ever does.  For a restaurant that gets so much traffic, I cannot figure out why they didn't rent a larger space.  I will give the complainers that.

I can tell anyone who hasn't been to Vietnam that this is indeed real Pho.  Like any food, such as pizza or gumbo, there are many variations of Pho.  Most people have only experienced the southern flavor that is more aromatic and served with a side of herbs.  TT serves the northern style, the original version.  If you go to Vietnam, the northern style is the most favored version, even in the south.  It's actually harder to make good northern style Pho, and I wouldn't say TT has achieved the goal of matching northern style Pho that I've had in Vietnam.  With southern style, the herbs and spices sometimes cover up for mediocre soup.  Having eaten at the best Pho place on the planet many times, I can honestly say TT doesn't measure up, but it's pretty good for Pho in the USA, and it's the only northern style place I know of in America.  Also, Pho Ga isn't just the Vietnamese version of the chicken noodle soup.  They've been eating it for hundreds of years.  As for the best Pho on the planet, it's a northern style place in Saigon, which I won't name since it's already too popular among the locals in Saigon.  The flavor of that Pho is so vastly different and better than any Pho I've tasted across the USA.  It's really hard to describe.

Anyway, I like this location because it's in a better neighborhood and forces me to walk 6 blocks to get my meal.  A healthy tasty meal after a nice walk, how can you beat that?  I love the chicken version.  After finishing the noodles, I just sit there and sip on the soup base.  A very good meal for the winter weather.  When it comes to their other food, I have little experience.  I had a rice dish once at the Larkin location and left hungry so I never order anything but Pho at TT.

excerpts: I've tried the chicken as well as beef pho bowls and both were great!
I prefer the beef broth though.
The noodles are not typical thin pho noodles but these are very good as well and slippery haha prices are decent and service is great!
chicken.author: Jennifer Y.
chicken.review: The broth here is legit! It tastes authentic and light without excessive oil or MSG taste. I've tried the chicken as well as beef pho bowls and both were great! I prefer the beef broth though. The noodles are not typical thin pho noodles but these are very good as well and slippery haha prices are decent and service is great!

excerpts: it's the Pho Ga (chicken pho).
An older Asian lady was standing outside and wondering whether or not to go in and asked for my opinion.
When I broke down the knowledge for her I could tell she was surprised this young latino fellar was down with the underground...
I mean the pho lyfe.
When I actually verbalized this and said "surprised I know so much about pho
My best analogy would be that if you go to San Tung across town..you better get the Chicken Wings don't complain about the other dishes ...same thing with Turtle Tower , get the PHO GA.
chicken.author: Rod M.
chicken.review:
Big fan of Turtle tower and this is the one located on the corner of 6th and Bryant. 

Don't forget as I did to put your name on the waiting list as I got in. I got there before a couple people but because of my oversight a couple people got seated before me.

When I go to Turtle tower I know what I want , it's not the regular pho it's the Pho Ga (chicken pho). An older Asian lady was standing outside and wondering whether or not to go in and asked for my opinion. When I broke down the knowledge for her I could tell she was surprised this young latino fellar was down with the underground...I mean the pho lyfe.  When I actually verbalized this and said "surprised I know so much about pho" she got a good chuckle about it. 

Advice...get the PHO GA! The broth is awesome and I don't get Pho Ga very often but for this place it's the thing to get. For regular pho admittedly there  are better options but that's not why you go here. My best analogy would be that if you go to San Tung across town..you better get the Chicken Wings don't complain about the other dishes ...same thing with Turtle Tower , get the PHO GA. Your welcome and give me a follow if you like my reviews. 

4 stars for the Pho Ga...get it and Fuggetabout it!

excerpts: Chicken pho is one of those comfort items that I always enjoy.
LOVE the chicken pho here.
Very authentic to Hanoi style pho
and I have eaten in Hanoi recently.
So, luckily this is local and I always go here whenever I am in the city.
I always get extra jalapeños and add several scoops of Sriracha as the pho is even better spicy.
chicken.author: Kayli T.
chicken.review: Chicken pho is one of those comfort items that I always enjoy. LOVE the chicken pho here. Very authentic to Hanoi style pho and I have eaten in Hanoi recently. So, luckily this is local and I always go here whenever I am in the city. I always get extra jalapeños and add several scoops of Sriracha as the pho is even better spicy. The fried imperial rolls are delicious too. Just have to fork out $3.50 for one roll!

excerpts:
Small chicken pho ($9)
2.

Small pho with rare beef ($9) (because they wouldn't substitute anything for anything else or else I would have got the pho with rare beef, well done beef and tripe)
3.

Thai Tea ($4.25)
4.
Because people seemed to really like the chicken pho, that is what le bf got.
He thought that is was pretty good when compared to other chicken pho that he has had.
chicken.author: Carolyn Z.
chicken.review:
Extremely overpriced for the small portions.

Le bf and I visited this Soma location on a weekday evening for dinner. We ordered:
1. Small chicken pho ($9)
2. Small pho with rare beef ($9) (because they wouldn't substitute anything for anything else or else I would have got the pho with rare beef, well done beef and tripe)
3. Thai Tea ($4.25)
4. Fried Imperial Rolls with Vermicelli Noodle, Lettuce, Mint and Cilantro ($11.50)

We had some doubts before coming from reading what other people wrote on Yelp. Be warned, the other things they give you to accompany your pho are jalapeno slices and 1 wedge of lime each. Because people seemed to really like the chicken pho, that is what le bf got. He thought that is was pretty good when compared to other chicken pho that he has had. 

I normally get pho with rare beef and tripe. This place didn't have that combo. I tried to order the rare beef, well done beef and tripe and instead of well done beef, I wanted to get another portion of rare beef. I was sadly informed that they don't do any kind of substitutions. That is unfortunate. My pho came with 5 very small pieces of rare beef. I would have expected a bit more, even in SF. Overall, I've had richer broth, and the pho was just ok. It was edible, but nothing special. 

The Thai tea was laughably small for $4.25. It was just slightly larger than the small water glasses they provided. Total rip off. It tasted good, but had I known how large the cup was going to be, I wouldn't have ordered it. 

We also ordered the imperial rolls, which came out after both of us had finished our small bowls of pho. On the plate, we saw 3 tiny imperial rolls with 2 leaves of lettuce, some mint, cilantro, noodles, and dipping sauce. they didn't even give us enough lettuce leaves to eat our  If we ordered just one imperial roll, it was have been $3.25 each. If you were thinking about it, don't order it. The imperial rolls were about 3.5 inches long and very skinny, like if you tied 2 of your skinniest fingers together.

For more than $40 (including tax and tip), this was super, super expensive Vietnamese food. When we got into our Uber, the first thing le bf said was "that was super expensive". Even though we finished every single item, I was still hungry so we stopped by Taco Bell afterwards so that I could fill my tummy with the 3 taco combo. Needless to say, we will NOT be back. And we can't recommend this place unless you want to be willingly ripped off.

excerpts: We ordered a banh mi sandwich and the sticky rice with steamed chicken and Chinese sausage.
Everything about the dish was poorly executed: cold pieces of steamed chicken you could tell weren't fresh and Chinese sausage carelessly sprinkled over a bed of room temperature sticky rice.
Everything about the dish was poorly executed: cold pieces of steamed chicken you could tell weren't fresh and Chinese sausage carelessly sprinkled over a bed of room temperature sticky rice.
chicken.author: Cindy Y.
chicken.review:
Unfortunately, I was very disappointed with this place. Despite the lackluster Yelp reviews, I decided to give this place a try since it was conveniently located and I had noticed it had a decent amount of traffic (maybe just coincidence) the couple of times I passed by it.

We ordered a banh mi sandwich and the sticky rice with steamed chicken and Chinese sausage.

The banh mi sandwich was very average -- nothing special. The meat did not have any flavor, the pickled vegetables were not particularly fresh, and the bread was nothing but an edible envelope for bland ingredients.

The sticky rice dish was even more disappointing. When a dish categorized as a "Special" is as poorly executed as this one was, I know I'm not going to take a chance on coming back and trying something else. Everything about the dish was poorly executed: cold pieces of steamed chicken you could tell weren't fresh and Chinese sausage carelessly sprinkled over a bed of room temperature sticky rice. I've eaten at so many Vietnamese restaurants, and I have never been somewhere where a rice dish isn't composed of at least rice, vegetables of some sort (cucumber, maybe tomato), nuoc mam sauce, and meat.

I walked away hungry and frustrated that I had spent twenty dollars on such a disappointing meal... I will not be returning again. Heed the bad reviews; sometimes ethnic restaurants will have subpar reviews despite decent food since they have poor service. This does not apply here!

excerpts: I've tried many pho in my time...but nothing like the chicken pho here.
The broth here is amazing and flavorful!
The type of rice noodles they used for this also works out perfectly.
Definitely ons of the best chicken pho I've had.
chicken.author: Charlie T.
chicken.review:
I've tried many pho in my time...but nothing like the chicken pho here.  The broth here is amazing and flavorful! The type of rice noodles they used for this also works out perfectly.  Definitely ons of the best chicken pho I've had.

The service was quick as it was fairly quiet during my visit.

excerpts: Their Chicken Pho Ga is amazing!

The broth is super light and refreshing, the rice noodles are surprisingly chewy, and they give a decent amount of chicken giblets (also add the lime and jalapeños that they give you on the side into your pho!
they give another dimension to the broth).
chicken.author: Alice C.
chicken.review: Their Chicken Pho Ga is amazing! The broth is super light and refreshing, the rice noodles are surprisingly chewy, and they give a decent amount of chicken giblets (also add the lime and jalapeños that they give you on the side into your pho! they give another dimension to the broth).

excerpts:
Here's what I had:

PHO GA - CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP - $10.75
The selection of shredded chicken was both dark and white, and had a good amount of chopped green onions!
chicken.author: Tu-Anh N.
chicken.review:
I came here with 2 others just before noon and was able to beat the rush! We found free street parking just on Bryant St.  

Coming in we were greeted warmly and seated right away!

Here's what I had:

PHO GA - CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP - $10.75 (Large)
My sis and I decided to share a large bowl and it was the perfect amount for us both! I really really enjoyed the pho! The broth was so rich and flavorful.  The selection of shredded chicken was both dark and white, and had a good amount of chopped green onions! I enjoyed this very much!

VIETNAMESE COFFEE - $4.25
So happy this was prepared the traditional and correct way: over a small metal drip bar...that happens to have a faded Nike logo printed on it.  A tad pricey in my opinion but hey, I got exactly what I wanted!  It was sweet and rich and taste with a nice caffeine kick to it!

I really appreciated the stellar service here.  The staff was super friendly.  The restaurant was clean, well lit and I had a wonderful time!

excerpts: The noodle and meats ( either beef or chicken) are fresh and high quality.
The bowl of soup is huge and I got filled up and completely satisfied to the max.
The service is amazing and the waiters are fast and efficient.
The restaurant is clean.
Parking is reasonable.
And location is safe.
chicken.author: Ivory B.
chicken.review:
This Turtle Tower deserves a full 5 stars from me because of these reasons:

1. The broth of the soup is consistently fresh, clear, tasty, and super hot.
2.  The noodle and meats ( either beef or chicken) are fresh and high quality.
3.  The bowl of soup is huge and I got filled up and completely satisfied to the max.
4.  The service is amazing and the waiters are fast and efficient.
5. The restaurant is clean.   Parking is reasonable.  And location is safe.

excerpts: The chicken pho tastes like regular chicken soup with noodles.
It's fine but nothing special.
Don't get the giblets--they smelled really bad and were not fresh.
chicken.author: Kaison T.
chicken.review: The chicken pho tastes like regular chicken soup with noodles. It's fine but nothing special. Don't get the giblets--they smelled really bad and were not fresh.

excerpts: Pho Ga/Chicken Noodle Soup is a pretty popular choice here, I got that the first time I came.
In my opinion, the noodles at this location are too soft/mushy and feel as if they've been left in the broth too long.
Broth is pretty satisfying though!
The second time I came, I got the Spring Rolls and a side of Chicken Broth.
Chicken Broth - Comes in a small bowl and makes for a great side!
I noticed that it comes as a small side for the rice & meat plates which was nice.
Flavorful, bit on the salty side.
My friend got the rice plate with fried chicken and commented that it was pretty good.
chicken.author: Chelsea W.
chicken.review:
Authentic, inexpensive Northern Vietnamese fare. I often frequent and prefer the original Tenderloin location, but the Soma location has its conveniences. I only had some appetizers here recently, so probably can't give the most accurate review.

Service and cleanliness of the place is a bit shoddy but honestly not expecting much. Menu consists of pho, rice & meat plates, etc and entrees generally cost about $9-10. 

Pho Ga/Chicken Noodle Soup is a pretty popular choice here, I got that the first time I came. In my opinion, the noodles at this location are too soft/mushy and feel as if they've been left in the broth too long. Broth is pretty satisfying though! Has a very clean and light taste.

The second time I came, I got the Spring Rolls and a side of Chicken Broth. 

Spring Rolls - The so-called "Fresh" Spring Rolls didn't live up to its name. The meat was also pretty sparsely distributed in the roll. Given that this isn't a  particularly challenging appetizer to execute, this definitely fell short.

Chicken Broth - Comes in a small bowl and makes for a great side! I noticed that it comes as a small side for the rice & meat plates which was nice. Flavorful, bit on the salty side. My
main criticism is that it came with way too much cilantro.. but then again I'm not sure if thats a Vietnamese culinary practice. 

My friend got the rice plate with fried chicken and commented that it was pretty good. From observation, veggies at this restaurant don't seem too fresh.

Cheap Viet eats, but I think next time the Tenderloin location will be my go-to.

excerpts: The stir fried noodle with vegetable and chicken or beef is a unique take on a traditional favorite.
Whenever it's raining, or I'm sick, or just back from a hot beach vacation and want a reminder of what I love about San Francisco, I come to Turtle Tower or get takeout.
It's the best Pho in the West.
Very busy at lunchtime
so plan ahead or just get takeout.
chicken.author: Ben G.
chicken.review: Hands down the best Pho in San Francisco. Broth is rich and silky. The stir fried noodle with vegetable and chicken or beef is a unique take on a traditional favorite.  Whenever it's raining, or I'm sick, or just back from a hot beach vacation and want a reminder of what I love about San Francisco, I come to Turtle Tower or get takeout. It's the best Pho in the West. Very busy at lunchtime so plan ahead or just get takeout.

excerpts: Chicken was REAL, white meat with a mixture of dark.
chicken.author: Tangible H.
chicken.review:
Ordered the Pho Ga to go and it was delicious! Very good broth, well developed - a little high in the fish sauce department though. Chicken was REAL, white meat with a mixture of dark.
