I enjoyed the texture and size of the noodle; these were thicker rice noodles, but not as wide as chow fun. Made two meals out of the large. I will be back; I often always pass this place on the way home from work.

excerpts: The best part about the chicken pho here is the broth.
It's simple clean and comforting.
The noodles were quite soggy and the chicken was very dry though.
Also had spring rolls which were pretty small and over fried.
chicken.author: Olivia T.
chicken.review: The best part about the chicken pho here is the broth.  It's simple clean and comforting.  The noodles were quite soggy and the chicken was very dry though.  Also had spring rolls which were pretty small and over fried.

excerpts: Light chicken based soup.
Tender flat rice noodles.
This place is Northern Vietnamese pho, you'll notice the chicken based soup and softer noodles.
chicken.author: Thomas C.
chicken.review: Light chicken based soup. Tender flat rice noodles. This place is Northern Vietnamese pho, you'll notice the chicken based soup and softer noodles.

excerpts: I got #9 Pho Ga and was a bit disappointed at how little chicken and veggies there were in my bowl.
chicken.author: Susan C.
chicken.review:
This was my first time trying turtle tower. I got #9 Pho Ga and was a bit disappointed at how little chicken and veggies there were in my bowl. 

ASK FOR EXTRA EVERYTHING

Broth - no complaints
Noodles - no complaints

excerpts: So this is a take on pho ga but not quite sure what it encompassed other then the pho and chicken.
Whatever it was...it was delicious!
I believe the noodles were pan fried.
chicken.author: Spencer Q.
chicken.review:
Food:

F9 - secret menu!!!!! So this is a take on pho ga but not quite sure what it encompassed other then the pho and chicken.  Whatever it was...it was delicious!  I believe the noodles were pan fried.  Yum!

Service: very good waitstaff.  Friendly and attentive.

Ambiance: very casual and communal.

Overall:  yep I'll be back.

excerpts: Decided to order the #10 Pho Ga with chicken giblets.
The size large isn't that big, probably the size of a small or regular elsewhere.
The broth was extremely flavorful and aromatic.
The noodles were okay, could have been a bit chewier, but were nicely cooked and not stuck together.
The #10 has shredded chicken meat and skin which provides texture and fattiness to an otherwise very lean dish.
The chicken giblets were fantastic, although I did not care for the toughness of the kidneys (but that's just the nature of eating the kidneys).
The chicken giblets were fantastic, although I did not care for the toughness of the kidneys (but that's just the nature of eating the kidneys).
You won't miss them much, as the chicken flavor is so pure and rich.
I'll certainly be back for the pho ga, and maybe the steamed chicken with rice.
chicken.author: David D.
chicken.review:
Finally scratched something off my to-do list and finally tried the pho ga (chichen pho) at Turtle Tower.

Decided to order the #10 Pho Ga with chicken giblets. The size large isn't that big, probably the size of a small or regular elsewhere. The broth was extremely flavorful and aromatic. The noodles were okay, could have been a bit chewier, but were nicely cooked and not stuck together. The #10 has shredded chicken meat and skin which provides texture and fattiness to an otherwise very lean dish. The chicken giblets were fantastic, although I did not care for the toughness of the kidneys (but that's just the nature of eating the kidneys). 

This pho is from northern Vietnam which means it's not served with the plum sauce, sprouts, and basil that you might be used to.  You won't miss them much, as the chicken flavor is so pure and rich. 

Apparently the place has been recently remodeled and looks quite nice inside, although they have too many tables in a cramped setting, so much so that one of the tables needed to be left empty as no more customers could squeeze in around it.

I'll certainly be back for the pho ga, and maybe the steamed chicken with rice. 

Pro Tip: Please don't put your chili sauce / sriracha directly into the broth. You're disrupting a balance in flavor that took hours to achieve. Put your chili sauce into the small saucer provided, and use as needed!

excerpts: second for their fresh wide flat noodles, and third for having pho ga, chicken noodle soup.
Having said this, the rolls were a bit over fried and the fresh noodles were over cooked.
But I did enjoy the home style broth and would go back and give it another try.
chicken.author: Beatrice L.
chicken.review: I wanted to try this place,  first  when I saw that they make their Imperial Rolls with rice paper, which is the authentic recipe and method, second for their fresh wide flat noodles, and third for having pho ga, chicken noodle soup.  Having said this, the rolls were a bit over fried and the fresh noodles were over cooked.  But I did enjoy the home style broth and would go back and give it another try.

excerpts: Anyways, I read some reviews and saw people mention a secret menu for their chicken pho (pho ga), so I went for it.
I think it was like F9 or something like that.
Anyways, I had no expectations for what this will be like, so I was a little confused to see sliced ham(?)
on top of the soup.
I mixed it up and squeezed the lemon in.
First spoonful of soup was very flavorful.
It seems like they pan fry the noodles with some sauce before serving this.
The noodles were a tad too soft for my liking.
The chicken was plentiful and moist.
My only gripe is their use of MSG in their soup.
Overall, this place is good and better than some places for chicken pho, but I wouldn't come out of my way to eat here.
Y'all who want to make chicken pho at home, try using Costco rotisserie chicken bones!
chicken.author: Susanna C.
chicken.review:
My first time eating here after having turtle tower bookmarked for the longest time. This wasn't my first choice location but... I was brought here by jury duty, so I might as well try it after the WONDERFUL LONG hours of waiting for my name to be called. 

Anyways, I read some reviews and saw people mention a secret menu for their chicken pho (pho ga), so I went for it. I think it was like F9 or something like that. Anyways, I had no expectations for what this will be like, so I was a little confused to see sliced ham(?) on top of the soup. I mixed it up and squeezed the lemon in. First spoonful of soup was very flavorful. It seems like they pan fry the noodles with some sauce before serving this. The noodles were a tad too soft for my liking. The chicken was plentiful and moist. My only gripe is their use of MSG in their soup. As I sit here writing this review halfway done with my meal, my throat is parched and thirsts for water to wash away the MSG. 

Overall, this place is good and better than some places for chicken pho, but I wouldn't come out of my way to eat here. Y'all who want to make chicken pho at home, try using Costco rotisserie chicken bones!

Also, there's this awkward window ledge area for solo eaters (me) and the stools are kind of too tall for me to set my feet down, but there's no other foot holder, so I'm pretty uncomfortable. 

Overall, just happy I was no chosen for jury duty.

excerpts: (2) A bowl of chicken pho!
Fresh noodles, lots of green onion, cilantro, and lots of chicken... maybe too much chicken fat..
Chicken PHO! 5 stars!
chicken.author: Mindy Y.
chicken.review:
I LOVE, LOVE TURTLE TOWER! 

PARKING: there's always parking... just have to pay $.. but there are some free parking

FOOD:
(1) Imperial Roll - for 1 roll... $2.25-ish! EKS!
(2) A bowl of chicken pho! Fresh noodles, lots of green onion, cilantro, and lots of chicken... maybe too much chicken fat.. but I'll eat it!

DRINKS:
Vietnamese coffee - mMm!
 
**MUST GET: Chicken PHO! 5 stars!

excerpts: They are know for their chicken pho, and it is great.
This location has always seemed a little less busy than the other 2, so usually no wait.
Same great food.
Fast service too.
chicken.author: Peter K.
chicken.review: This is the SoMa location of the Turtle Tower of Tenderloin. They are know for their chicken pho, and it is great. This location has always seemed a little less busy than the other 2, so usually no wait. Same great food. Fast service too.

excerpts: They give you a plentiful amount of chicken and lots of onions - yum!
chicken.author: Sherry L.
chicken.review:
I've tried their other locations and I can say the same about this one. Their pho ga is one of the best i've had! They give you a plentiful amount of chicken and lots of onions - yum!

One of the downsides is that turtle tower always has a wait, but since they serve mostly noodles, the wait is not that bad.

excerpts: I ordered a pork, chicken, egg sandwich.
I expected it to be a tad bit bigger for the price
but I assumed it was the meats that made it pricy.
chicken.author: Jess S.
chicken.review:
While passing by San Francisco we spotted a Vietnamese restaurant so my partner and I were down to try it. Sadly we tried to avoid the Giants game restaurant area because it was jam packed with folks so this business was a calm get away from the hectic 'trying to find parking' streets.

I appreciate the attentiveness and friendliness of staff but unfortunately I love dipping my sandwiches into dips and they only provided fish  sauce and Sriracha sauce on the table and when asked the waiter was unable to communicate  in English but overall the language barrier was no problem. 

I ordered a pork, chicken, egg sandwich. I expected it to be a tad bit bigger for the price but I assumed it was the meats that made it pricy.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken with chicken giblets pho ga and nem cua fried imperial rolls with vermicelli noodles and lettuce.
Let me start by saying that the broth from the pho actually tasted like chicken.
The limited spice and fish sauce added to the broth was not too salty and overpowering that it did not take the essential chicken taste away.
The rice noodles were wide and soft.
I normally like my noodles al dente, but in this particularly case, it matched really well with the broth and meat.
Finally, the chicken was pulled and cut into small bite size pieces with a mixture of dark and white meat.
It was a good contrast between the soft and more flavorful dark meat verus the firm but subtle taste of the white meat.
It does not regulate the amount of time the chicken is outdoors, the size of the outdoor space, or its food source.
chicken.author: Chris W.
chicken.review:
Turtle Tower was my introduction to northern-style Vietnamese pho.  Previously, I didn't even know such a thing even existed.  And man was it delicious.  

I ordered the chicken with chicken giblets pho ga and nem cua fried imperial rolls with vermicelli noodles and lettuce.  Let me start by saying that the broth from the pho actually tasted like chicken.  The limited spice and fish sauce added to the broth was not too salty and overpowering that it did not take the essential chicken taste away.  The rice noodles were wide and soft.  I normally like my noodles al dente, but in this particularly case, it matched really well with the broth and meat.  Finally, the chicken was pulled and cut into small bite size pieces with a mixture of dark and white meat.  It was a good contrast between the soft and more flavorful dark meat verus the firm but subtle taste of the white meat.  The giblets added a fulfilling crunch to every bite. 

The nem cua was fried to perfection.  And in this particular case, I could actually taste the crab meat (There are a lot establishments elsewhere that would cheap out and increase the ratio of the pork filling). When eaten with the noodles and lettuce and dipped in the fish sauce, it's elevated to an whole new level.  Definitely recommend trying this dish here at least once.

What's keeping me from giving this 5 stars was that the portion size were too small.  I judge a restaurant by the culinary experience I received versus the amount I paid.  I have no problem giving a shabby "normal" place a perfect score if the value accurately reflects it.  In this case I left the restaurant not hungry but not fulfilled.  In addition I don't think claiming that the chickens were raised "free-ranged" can justify the increase in price.  The USDA states that free-range only means that the animal has access to outdoors.  It does not regulate the amount of time the chicken is outdoors, the size of the outdoor space, or its food source. 

In conclusion I definitely recommend this place to any pho lover.  I'm sure there are many non-Vietnamese people that would appreciate knowing there is a different style of pho out there.  Just don't expect to be stuffed of full when you finish your meal.

excerpts: A friend mentioned that this place is known for their chicken pho, but I decided to try #6.
chicken.author: Elizabeth L.
chicken.review:
Well.. I don't know what these other reviewers are saying, but this pho was BY FAR, the best bowl of pho I've ever had.  I've never had a bowl of noodles blow me away like this did.  A friend mentioned that this place is known for their chicken pho, but I decided to try #6.  The broth was flavorful, but because the vegetables and meat were stir-fried it gave the soup a "stir-fry" flavor as well that paired perfectly.  

I would definitely recommend and I would definitely come back into the city just for a bowl of their noodle soup.

Ambiance: 3/5
Food: 5/5
Service: 4/5
Overall Experience: 5/5

excerpts: I got a chance to stop by during my lunch break and ordered the Chicken leg special.
It was tasty and I will definitely be back to their restaurant more often for lunch.
I'm a fan!
chicken.author: Jess M.
chicken.review: I got a chance to stop by during my lunch break and ordered the Chicken leg special. It was tasty and I will definitely be back to their restaurant more often for lunch. I'm a fan!

excerpts: I ordered the Pho Ga (chicken pho) large.
Now here is where I was unhappy...
I didn't think that I would leave the restaurant after paying almost $11 for a bowl of large STILL HUNGRY...!
This is the first restaurant where they serve pho and don't offer Hoisin sauce.
To be honest, I was really put off by this.
The only options were fish sauce and hot sauce.
The waitress asked me if I wanted a lemon with jalapeños instead.
Well, that's not really the same as hoisin
but I took it anyways.
chicken.author: Allison S.
chicken.review:
So I had to try this place since I was in the area to see what the hype is all about.

I went around 3:30PM on a Monday so the place wasn't crowded, I was ready to be impressed. Well, the only thing I was really impressed with was how quick my food came out (There were only two other tables at the time).

I ordered the Pho Ga (chicken pho) large. Now here is where I was unhappy...I didn't think that I would leave the restaurant after paying almost $11 for a bowl of large STILL HUNGRY...! This is the first restaurant where they serve pho and don't offer Hoisin sauce. To be honest, I was really put off by this. The only options were fish sauce and hot sauce. The waitress asked me if I wanted a lemon with jalapeños instead. Well, that's not really the same as hoisin but I took it anyways. The jalapeños were a bit sad, just the edges, not even full pieces...so it honestly didn't make a difference in my food.

Service wise, the lady never even came back to offer me more water or give me my bill. I had to walk up to the counter, flag her down and ask if I could pay up front. I really don't think there is a good reason to come back. I'm a bit confused with all the high ratings saying they give a lot of food...my portion honestly looked like a size small but placed in a large sized bowl with a ton of broth to make up for it. Moving on...

excerpts: I like the chicken pho and imperial rolls a lot.
chicken.author: Jessica S.
chicken.review: My favorite pho place in San Francisco. The noodles here are the best and its overall super authentic. I like the chicken pho and imperial rolls a lot. I also love that they give you the option of ordering a whole plate of rare beef for $4. I'm surprised that's even legal to serve at a restaurant but I love adding extra rare beef to my pho at my own pace without worrying about it overcooking.

excerpts:
Seems most people I saw ordered this size.
-Fried chicken plate was tasty.
chicken.author: Junelle T.
chicken.review:
I was on a jury for nearly two months this past summer and Turtle Tower was a staple at the beginning of the trial. (Sidenote: did you know the court will provide free lunches from a restaurant across the street if you're on jury duty long enough? A fact I never needed to know first hand. Unfortunately this was not where the free lunches came from.)

Pros:
-Broth is good.
-The small size bowl of pho is a decent size if you're hungry. Seems most people I saw ordered this size.
-Fried chicken plate was tasty.

Cons:
-Might have a bit of a wait around 12-1:30 when most everyone has their lunch break at 850.
-Space. If you don't like being seated RIGHT NEXT to someone if you're a sole diner, don't come at peak lunch times. (I don't mind, but seriously some people need to mind their soup splatter as they slurp their noodles sometimes haha.)

excerpts: Nothing quite hits the spot after a night of dancing around in heels that the human feet were not evolutionarily adapted for than the Pho Ga, with chicken on the side paired with a serving of their lemon sauce.

Every single time, the hot soothing broth and delectable noodles will trick me into believing that I do, indeed, absolutely need to finish the entire bowl until I've reached the bottom, sodium levels disregarded.

A general PSA for the 10% of the population who suffers the genetic misfortune of cilantro tasting like soap: if I were to take away the broth, chicken, and noodles, you would be left with essentially a cilantro salad.
chicken.author: Jenni H.
chicken.review:
There are very few places I would brave torrential downpours or multiple MUNI transfers for, but Turtle Tower made the cut. My friends have long learned not to let me pick where to eat for weekend brunch because I will, without fail, default to TT - tendencies of a creature of habit. 

Nothing quite hits the spot after a night of dancing around in heels that the human feet were not evolutionarily adapted for than the Pho Ga, with chicken on the side paired with a serving of their lemon sauce. Every single time, the hot soothing broth and delectable noodles will trick me into believing that I do, indeed, absolutely need to finish the entire bowl until I've reached the bottom, sodium levels disregarded. It's become somewhat of a ritual for me by this point.

A general PSA for the 10% of the population who suffers the genetic misfortune of cilantro tasting like soap: if I were to take away the broth, chicken, and noodles, you would be left with essentially a cilantro salad. As I don't fall into this demographic, I fully embrace the herb heavy cilantro-to-soup ratio. 

2017: new year, new goals. Or in Turtle Tower's case, a new menu. Ask your server about the secret menu that's discreetly rolled out - I've been clued in that the secret F9 dish is an upgrade from my routine Pho Ga order (the noodles are pan fried first). Hat tip to Thé, one of the owners, whose comedic antics throughout my meal had me questioning whether my stomach hurt from laughing or from me attempting to consume a bowl that outsized my belly capacity.

excerpts: I ordered a small bowl of the chicken pho and a side order of imperial roll.
The first bite into the soup
and I thought "Hm this is pretty good.
The thicker cut noodles were cool.
But as I continued to eat it I realized it's just whatever.
It was decent.
Would I go out of my way to come back though?
chicken.author: Mellani L.
chicken.review:
Came here for lunch while serving for jury duty last week. I've heard good things about this place so I was kind of excited to try it. I was able to get seated before the big lunch crowd came.

I ordered a small bowl of the chicken pho and a side order of imperial roll. The first bite into the soup and I thought "Hm this is pretty good." The thicker cut noodles were cool. But as I continued to eat it I realized it's just whatever. It was decent. Would I go out of my way to come back though? No. 

Furthermore, the side order of imperial roll that I got was so tiny and partially burnt. It was just okay as well. Definitely not worth paying the $2.75 for, that's for sure.

Overall it was just okay. I think it's an alright place to get your pho fix while serving jury duty but if I had my choice I wouldn't come here otherwise. Sorry turtle tower, I had high hopes!

FYI: it's cash only!

excerpts: The soup has slightly more sodium than the #9 Chicken Pho, but it's still not too salty for a soup broth.
chicken.author: Kevin S.
chicken.review:
Ordered the large #2 Pho Tai Rare Beef Pho this time, and it was just as delicious. The way they make their rare beef is prepped almost like a beef burger patty but easier to rip off with each bite. Wished there was more meat though. The soup has slightly more sodium than the #9 Chicken Pho, but it's still not too salty for a soup broth. I can't say if the #2 or the #9 is better since they're in their own categories, but with either dish, you really can't go wrong.

Also I got a banh mi to go (pate, ham, & pork). It's really dry and short in length, not worth the $5 price. You're better off finding a a good sandwich in the TL.

excerpts: I ordered the Pho Ga chicken noodle soup and it was delicious.
The broth was cleansing and didn't taste like there was a bunch of MSG added.
In fact, the broth elevated the taste of the noodles.
The noodles absorbed much of the broth
so I didn't even need to add any sriracha to make it taste better.
There was a good amount of chicken to keep the balance well maintained and the Small size portion was perfect for me since I was able to finish the entire bowl and felt full but not overstuffed.
chicken.author: Diana C.
chicken.review:
What's the best food for hangovers, sick days, and rainy days? PHO! Today's lunch falls under rainy day weather and when I came at 15 minutes past noon, it was already packed with a line out the door that turned out was NOT people waiting for a bus. The wait wasn't too long but next time, I would come half an hour later just to skip the lunch rush.

It was my first time having Northern style pho and all my life, I've only had Southern style so I was a bit thrown off when observing everything. First off, 

-Northern style does not come with the beansprouts and basil plate that is usually in Southern style pho
-But you do get the jalapenos and limes
-There is no hoisin sauce
-But there is sriracha (in a jar container rather than in the bottle form)
-Noodles are flat and wider than Southern style pho
-Broth seems to be the focal point of the dish

I ordered the Pho Ga chicken noodle soup and it was delicious. The broth was cleansing and didn't taste like there was a bunch of MSG added. In fact, the broth elevated the taste of the noodles. The noodles absorbed much of the broth so I didn't even need to add any sriracha to make it taste better. There was a good amount of chicken to keep the balance well maintained and the Small size portion was perfect for me since I was able to finish the entire bowl and felt full but not overstuffed. 

Outside, the menu says Cash Only but I think they started to use Square now so they do take credit card. They have other items besides pho such as banh mi. Bowl sizes comes in just Small or Large and prices range from $6-9.

excerpts: They're famous for their pho ga (chicken pho), but I personally LOVE the beef pho.
Which beef pho?
All of them.
If you're adventurous, try them all out eventually.
chicken.author: Richard S.
chicken.review:
Excellent Vietnamese noodle soup. Turtle Tower serves northern style pho, so it might be different from what you're normally used to because the majority of Vietnamese pho restaurants here serve southern style pho. 

They're famous for their pho ga (chicken pho), but I personally LOVE the beef pho. Which beef pho? All of them. If you're adventurous, try them all out eventually. Otherwise you can never go wrong with the #1. 

There are three Turtle Tower restaurants in the city, and they are all 5 stars. It's ridiculous, that there's a discrepancy between them. Just goes to show that nobody knows anything, including yours truly.

excerpts: I went to the original Turtle Tower location and really enjoyed their chicken pho, so I tried to rally my coworkers to come over here.
chicken.author: Alice C.
chicken.review:
~*~*~ 1200th review! ~*~*~

It is disappointing, really. I went to the original Turtle Tower location and really enjoyed their chicken pho, so I tried to rally my coworkers to come over here. 

The noodles were too soft, like the food was soaking in the broth for a while before they delivered it to our table - which made sense because we waited forrrrreverrrrrr for our food.

At the end of our meal, we were told their POS system stopped working. Their ATM didn't work either. Seemed like they had a network issue. We had to run to some place across the street to get cash. It was quite annoying that the staff didn't mention anything and they weren't very helpful either.

We have been back just to give them another chance, but they consistently run out of pate for their banh mi. We have never seen it in stock, which is quite a shame - if they don't have it, just don't put it on the menu.

I guess this location is a no go. I hope the other one I like hasn't gone downhill as well.

excerpts: The female worker brings us two bowls and neither looks like chicken, what my lady ordered, and the other has tripe.
I keep it simple and always ALWAYS order Tai Chin (steak brisket) or chicken.
I've done this a billion times
yet this guy tells me this is what we ordered.
Okay buddy
chicken.author: David K.
chicken.review:
Absolutely the worst experience I've ever had at any restaurant in my life! I'm a generous reviewer and from this experience I have no problem dishing a bad rating.

Today my lady and I visited Turtle Tower on 6th during lunch and had the pleasure *sarcasm* to be waited on by the biggest douchebag waiter/server I've ever dealt with. Viet guy with backwards baseball cap and jeans. Quite simply a jerk. Yeah you know who you are. And for the restaurant's sake I hope it was a heat of the moment thing and you don't do that again. 

Entering the restaurant just after the peak lunch crowd we were seated at a table for two by the door. Seeing that there were two tables by the window I asked if we could sit by the window to "people watch" and observe this part of the city I wasn't very familiar with. This guy says "sorry you have two people and those tables are for four. Thank you." I'm thinking... well okay that sucks but it is what it is. No worries. He was polite up to this point. 

After ordering from him I look around and see a large booth with only two people on the other side of the restaurant. A customer then walks in and sits down gesturing another server if he can sit at one of the empty tables by the window, a female worker, and she gives her approval and orders food soon thereafter. Well alrighty then. The same female server brings us water and I ask her if we can sit at the other table and she immediately approves. Great! Well is it really? I believe around this time is where the male server started to mentally snap. 


I started to enjoy the view from my new window seat. Finally I get to try this Turtle Tower location even with its almost decent 79 health score. After all it's better than the other two right?! I've been to the Larkin location once and Geary location several times in the past and enjoyed the Northern style Vietnamese noodle soup. I'm from San Jose so I'm well versed in Southern style for almost two decades, so I like mixing it up from time to time. 

Here comes the food! Wait what is this? The female worker brings us two bowls and neither looks like chicken, what my lady ordered, and the other has tripe. The male server heard us and steps in front of the poor female server with a menu and insists on what we ordered. 

I don't like tripe and I didn't order the dac biet (special). I keep it simple and always ALWAYS order Tai Chin (steak brisket) or chicken. I've done this a billion times yet this guy tells me this is what we ordered. Okay buddy so you're straight up telling me that we are liars in front of all the other customers with a straight face. 

My lady argues with him and he has the AUDACITY (I never use this word in real life!!!) to tell my lady what she said didn't matter and for me to speak. WTF??? I was only quiet at that point because I was blown away and annoyed beyond measure. I did my best to coherently explain to him (albeit in annoyed fashion) that we know what we ordered and what was brought to us wasn't it. I had enough and said "let's just go" and that's when the server dashed away. As we got up the (poor) female server. Was bringing the corrected order and said something along the line of "so you're not staying?" I felt bad for her. She was caught in the middle of all this and if I stayed at the original table none of this would have happened. Leaving in haste I replied to her "no, that guy is giving us attitude" and left. 

There was 7-8 customers there when we ran off. I hope other Yelpers were there to see what disservice was done to us. Perhaps they could give me reassurance or perhaps another perspective. I am a fair person and would love to hear all sides. Many thoughts go through my mind, but as a customer I feel I was truly given bad treatment. I mean was it wrong to request a table by the window when there were plenty? Was it wrong to ask again to another server? 

In any case this may be my first 1 star review for a restaurant and 2nd ever in my 10 years of Yelping. I really hope the last because my blood pressure is up the roof!!! Argh! Anyway keep it real folks and let the customer voices be heard!

excerpts: They are known for the chicken pho-
if you order this, ask for a side of the salt, pepper & lemon dipping sauce.
chicken.author: Melanie N.
chicken.review:
Turtle Tower serves northern vietnamese style pho!  I like to think of it as a clean, simple & no fuss.   It comes with the fresh noodles, cilantro, green onions, jalapenos, & a wedge of lemon.   You don't need hoisen sauce, basil, or extra veggies here.  It's still very soothing, delicious and perfect on a cold day.  They are known for the chicken pho- if you order this, ask for a side of the salt, pepper & lemon dipping sauce.   I prefer the Pho Chin- which is the well done flank & brisket beef noodle soup.

I've been having Turtle Tower delivered to my work via Caviar.  I even got most of my co-workers to order pho now so the office will sometime smell like a Vietnamese pho shop! Lol.

For fast delivery...Caviar brings the best restaurants straight to your door. Sign up to get $15 off your 1st @TryCaviar order using my link!   https://www.trycaviar.com/r/9tenrj

Happy eating!

excerpts: All Turtle Tower locations in the city serve an honest bowl of northern Vietnamese pho featuring a tasty and clear chicken broth.
My favorite option is the #3 giving me the richness of rare beef and brisket on top of my noodles, a yummy combination with their famous chicken broth.
chicken.author: Denny C.
chicken.review: All Turtle Tower locations in the city serve an honest bowl of northern Vietnamese pho featuring a tasty and clear chicken broth. My favorite option is the #3 giving me the richness of rare beef and brisket on top of my noodles, a yummy combination with their famous chicken broth.

excerpts: The chicken pho is still superior to any pho ga in the city.
The broth has a strong but clean chicken flavor.
It's served very simple - with rice noodles, tender chicken, and some herbs and jalapenos.
No distractions like hoisin or sriracha to deter from the chicken.
chicken.author: Henry W.
chicken.review:
I kind of stopped coming to this location because the interior was pretty grimy and they didn't accept credit cards. But as of a couple months ago, they completely remodeled the place, take credit cards, and stopped wiping the tables with smelly rags! :)

The chicken pho is still superior to any pho ga in the city. The broth has a strong but clean chicken flavor. It's served very simple - with rice noodles, tender chicken, and some herbs and jalapenos. No distractions like hoisin or sriracha to deter from the chicken.

I also really like their rice vermicelli dish with imperial rolls served with herbs and nuoc cham. Super fresh and tasty. 

If you avoided coming here in the past because of the griminess - definitely come back and give it another shot!

excerpts: Chicken noodle soup - 3/5 - 7x7.
Stewed beef in wine sauce - 2/5

Fried imperial roll - 2/5
Grilled pork - 2/5

Overall, "A-OK" for chicken noodle soup.

Fried imperial roll - 2/5
Grilled pork - 2/5

Overall, "A-OK" for chicken noodle soup.
chicken.author: Mark O.
chicken.review:
Dinner review. 

Chicken noodle soup - 3/5 - 7x7. 
Stewed beef in wine sauce - 2/5
Fried imperial roll - 2/5
Grilled pork - 2/5

Overall, "A-OK" for chicken noodle soup.

excerpts: I like this restaurant I highly recommend especially chicken noodle soups
I came long way
and I was hungry and
when I couldn't have sit
I got little upset
chicken.author: Sezgin T.
chicken.review:
I m having my dinner almost every week couple times.
Best soup in the town ever.
I hope the owner will read this , operation hours is till 9 pm I went @8.30 and stuff told me that they are closing . This is second time happening if there is one table around 8.30 they don't take. New table .
I like this restaurant I highly recommend especially chicken noodle soups I came long way and I was hungry and when I couldn't have sit I got little upset

excerpts: I know the popular dish here is just the chicken noodle soup, but y'all should really try #11.
It's the same soup and chicken but with another type of pork meat and egg shreds added to it!
chicken.author: Juila L.
chicken.review:
I know the popular dish here is just the chicken noodle soup, but y'all should really try #11.  It's the same soup and chicken but with another type of pork meat and egg shreds added to it!  

I had an awesome experience at this location.  Waiter seems like whatever but he's actually very informative and straight forward about his suggestions which I really appreciate.  Some waiters just say, everything is good, but we all know that's not the truth. This guy is honest with his recommendation.

Yes it's kinda pricy but this is the standard turtle tower experience we all know.  It get get busy during the meal times, expect to wait or come early before or after the rush!  I'd be back again if I'm close by.  Parking isn't easy in the city

excerpts: My Pho Ga was exceptionally salty however the chicken was well-cooked
and I imagine if you were sick, this would be a bowl of heaven.
A small was the perfect size for me to finish but to be comfortably full.
My boyfriend's food was also a bit salty but the beef was seasoned well and the grilled vegetables added a nice depth.
chicken.author: Carrie W.
chicken.review:
My boyfriend and I came in last week for an early dinner before our Wine and Cheese class at the SF Wine Center which was next door. This location of Turtle Tower is right off of the freeway in SOMA and in a very industrialized location. We came pretty early in the night and were the only ones there but as we left, most tables were taken.

I ordered the small #9 Pho Ga and A got a large #6 Pho Bo Ap Chao Nuoc. Our noodles arrived blazingly fast with the normal plate of bean sprouts, lime and jalapenos. My Pho Ga was exceptionally salty however the chicken was well-cooked and I imagine if you were sick, this would be a bowl of heaven. A small was the perfect size for me to finish but to be comfortably full. My boyfriend's food was also a bit salty but the beef was seasoned well and the grilled vegetables added a nice depth. He was able to finish his large as well.

For 2 people, this meal was quite cheap coming in around $20. Would I rush back? Probably not unless I was in the area where there aren't many other options. I do think that there are better bowls of Pho in the city but for this particular day, it worked just fine and hit the spot.

excerpts: I always mean to try something else, but I always get the small pho ga (chicken noodle) with plenty of bean sprouts and cilantro.
Mmm!
It's tasty, filling and super comforting to help you deal with the fact that you have jury duty or jury selection.
Oh
and If you are falling asleep in the court room, get a Vietnamese iced coffee.
You might not be able to sit still, but you will be awake for sure! - just sweet enough and super tasty!
Enjoy!
chicken.author: Maile N.
chicken.review:
I love it!  If you have to have jury duty, then at least you can go to good places for lunch like Turtle Tower on 6th and Bryant - perfect location!  Put your name down on the list though - just because you're standing in line and you didn't put your name down (doh!), doesn't mean you go first.  Food is served fast so people know to eat quickly to make room for more people to dine.  If you are by yourself and it's packed, they might seat you with one other person, but that's ok, you'll have company, plus you'll be so busy eating, you won't even have time to feel awkward.    

I always mean to try something else, but I always get the small pho ga (chicken noodle) with plenty of bean sprouts and cilantro. Mmm!  It's tasty, filling and super comforting to help you deal with the fact that you have jury duty or jury selection.  ;)  Oh and If you are falling asleep in the court room, get a Vietnamese iced coffee.  You might not be able to sit still, but you will be awake for sure! - just sweet enough and super tasty!  Enjoy!

excerpts: I got the chicken pho and it was good.
The soup base is pretty bland
but thats the way I like it.
You get a lot of noodles in the small bowl and a lot of meat..
chicken.author: Kelley Y.
chicken.review:
FOOD:
I got the chicken pho and it was good. The soup base is pretty bland but thats the way I like it. You get a lot of noodles in the small bowl and a lot of meat.. I couldn't even finish mine. 

SERVICE:
One guy took care of all 10 tables and I was a happy customer. Really good service.

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? Maybe.

excerpts: Like so many before me, I have to recommend the (off menu) F9 (Special Chicken Pho).
It was a huge, reasonably priced, incredibly flavorful broth, big chunks of tasty chicken, amazing spices, tasty noodles, and just a few veggies to add to the whole thing.
Perfect on a rainy, chilly day like today.
The Vietnamese coffee was also tasty, though a little small.
Definitely coming back to get the F9 again, or possibly the P9 (which comes with extra protein)!!
chicken.author: Jeffrey S.
chicken.review: Like so many before me, I have to recommend the (off menu) F9 (Special Chicken Pho). It was a huge, reasonably priced, incredibly flavorful broth, big chunks of tasty chicken, amazing spices, tasty noodles, and just a few veggies to add to the whole thing. Perfect on a rainy, chilly day like today. The Vietnamese coffee was also tasty, though a little small. Definitely coming back to get the F9 again, or possibly the P9 (which comes with extra protein)!!

excerpts: Everyone knows the traditional beef or chicken noodle soups at TT but there are also off menu beef and chicken variations which have additional items to enrich the flavors.
The secret beef item is the "K6" and the chicken is the "F9" which denote the variation since number 6 on the menu is beef and
9 is chicken.
I tried the F9 which came with extra toppings such as sliced viet ham(I think), some other chicken meat and some bits of ginger.
There was even more in the soup
but I couldn't identify the frenzy of ingredients involved.
What I do know is that it was absolutely delicious.
The broth is richer and there's so much more meat that you get a piece with almost every bite.
The broth is still clean and not oily despite all the extra flavors involved.
chicken.author: James K.
chicken.review:
I'm about to drop some news more shocking than a Trump presidency....THERE IS A SECRET MENU at turtle tower!!! 

Everyone knows the traditional beef or chicken noodle soups at TT but there are also off menu beef and chicken variations which have additional items to enrich the flavors. The secret beef item is the "K6" and the chicken is the "F9" which denote the variation since number 6 on the menu is beef and 9 is chicken. I tried the F9 which came with extra toppings such as sliced viet ham(I think), some other chicken meat and some bits of ginger. There was even more in the soup but I couldn't identify the frenzy of ingredients involved. What I do know is that it was absolutely delicious. The broth is richer and there's so much more meat that you get a piece with almost every bite. The broth is still clean and not oily despite all the extra flavors involved. I can't wait to try the beef variation.

The best thing about secrets is sharing them. Live a little and try these secret items, you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: I had the well mentioned PHO GA (chicken) which was very clean and well seasoned.
Chicken in the PHO GA was ok and same with the noodles
(they get a little mushy toward the end).
I'm usually sensitive to very salty things
We also tried the fresh SPRING ROLLS, which were OK, but I'd opt for a side of the DIA GA LUOC (steamed chicken with bones) or something related to their very clean and enjoyable broth.
chicken.author: Patrick M.
chicken.review:
4 for food. 3 for service. 3 for atmosphere. 

Turtle Tower is a great place if you want consistency and a homey meal. 

This was my first time eating real Pho in SF. It is North Vietnamese style pho. I had the well mentioned PHO GA (chicken) which was very clean and well seasoned. Chicken in the PHO GA was ok and same with the noodles (they get a little mushy toward the end). I'm usually sensitive to very salty things (I feel my eyes get puffy) and I ate the entire bowl and did not get that feeling. 

No need for hoisen sauce (nor is there any). If you like the kick just dip your noodles in the red chili sauce from time to time. 

We also tried the fresh SPRING ROLLS, which were OK, but I'd opt for a side of the DIA GA LUOC (steamed chicken with bones) or something related to their very clean and enjoyable broth.

excerpts: I also had a chicken-vegetable stir fry, which just tasted kind of weird.
I guess there was some lemon in the gravy?
chicken.author: John L.
chicken.review:
The food is kind of boring. I had some salad-wrapped spring rolls, which had a remarkably bland flavor, despite containing shrimp and pork. I also had a chicken-vegetable stir fry, which just tasted kind of weird. I guess there was some lemon in the gravy? Not my cup of tea.

Fair disclosure: I'm not usually really into Vietnamese food, so it's unsurprising that I wasn't too enthused by this restaurant. I am probably not the best judge of the quality here.

excerpts: She told me they are known for the chicken broth, so
that's what I got.
I am not into gizzards and the like, so i asked for extra liver in the bowl that i ordered, and they delivered!
I loved it, and I won't mind coming back.
We did have to wait a bit for a table, but after we were seated everything went quickly.
chicken.author: Tracy L.
chicken.review: Yum yum!  My girl friend brought me here to have a casual lunch and I loved it!  She told me they are known for the chicken broth, so that's what I got. I am not into gizzards and the like, so i asked for extra liver in the bowl that i ordered, and they delivered!  I loved it, and I won't mind coming back. We did have to wait a bit for a table, but after we were seated everything went quickly.

excerpts: A+ star chicken pho!
Get the #10 large.
Won't regret it.
Except for maybe if you're not into chicken guts.
chicken.author: Minku L.
chicken.review:
A+ star chicken pho! Get the #10 large. Won't regret it. Except for maybe if you're not into chicken guts. Then get 9.

Really stepped up their game recently!

excerpts: I order the large chicken noodle soup for take out usually
and it's the best broth, noodles and chicken.
They use Free range btw.
The price is more than reasonable and everything tastes refreshing!
How much better can it get?!
Highly recommend.
chicken.author: Jenna C.
chicken.review: I don't quite understand the 3 stars for this incredible tasting noodle soup! I order the large chicken noodle soup for take out usually and it's the best broth, noodles and chicken. They use Free range btw. The price is more than reasonable and everything tastes refreshing! How much better can it get?! Highly recommend.

excerpts: The pho ga is the most flavorful chicken soup I may have ever had.
Both the rice and the egg noodles are great!
Prices are unbeatable.
chicken.author: Nick A.
chicken.review: This place is amazing. The pho ga is the most flavorful chicken soup I may have ever had. Both the rice and the egg noodles are great! Prices are unbeatable.

excerpts: First time there, decided to try Bahn mi grilled chicken sandwich.
I don't know if they forgot to put sauce, but the sandwich was dry and flavorless.
Very small sandwich and dry bread.
Carrots were not pickled with any flavor.
The grilled chicken was good but overall very disappointing sandwich and I won't be back.
chicken.author: Kudos K.
chicken.review: Stopped by prior to jury duty since it's right across the street. First time there, decided to try Bahn mi grilled chicken sandwich. I don't know if they forgot to put sauce, but the sandwich was dry and flavorless. Very small sandwich and dry bread. Carrots were not pickled with any flavor. The grilled chicken was good but overall very disappointing sandwich and I won't be back.

excerpts: For what its worth, i thought the chicken banh mi was better than the pork, more moist and flavorful.
chicken.author: William W.
chicken.review:
The bun cha hanoi is absolutely delicious - do yourself a favor and try something new! The banh mi however is not as exciting as other places in the city, e.g. saigon sandwich and what not. For what its worth, i thought the chicken banh mi was better than the pork, more moist and flavorful.

Also, I had quite a bit of problem attempting to call in an order tonight (12/10/16). Phone kept ringing and going to voicemail. Eventually just walked over and placed a togo order in person. The waiter claimed that the "cell phone doesn't get reception", but while I was waiting I heard what sounded like a landline ring several times w/o being answered by the staff. Not counting this against them, but it is definitely something that should be addressed.

excerpts: I recommended that he try the chicken noodle soup, which is what they're known for, or rare steak, but he wanted to try the same one I get, Pho Sot Vang.
I don't usually recommend this to people who haven't had pho because it's so different, and because both of my roommates have pretty much knocked it, but what do they know about Vietnamese food!?
Anyway he liked it, and though the service was slow, the food was on point.
chicken.author: Crystal C.
chicken.review:
Okay okay, I know I come here waaayyy too often, and sometimes the food is better or worse than other times, but Turtle Tower is truly my favorite pho I have ever experienced. There is nothing I don't like about the ambiance, the noodles, the meat, the veggies. It's all good, just not really consistently so. 

Last time I went, I brought my friend who had never ever had pho (!!) and he liked it a lot. I recommended that he try the chicken noodle soup, which is what they're known for, or rare steak, but he wanted to try the same one I get, Pho Sot Vang. I don't usually recommend this to people who haven't had pho because it's so different, and because both of my roommates have pretty much knocked it, but what do they know about Vietnamese food!? Anyway he liked it, and though the service was slow, the food was on point.

excerpts:
Chicken soup giblets is yum but dont
Expect service or extra napkins.
You get one napkin every time you ask for some.
They never check on you or ask you anything.
There is usually a wait.
If you dont want to wait, just go a few doors down for the same soup but with better service and a little tastier.
chicken.author: Theresa M.
chicken.review:
Chicken soup giblets is yum but dont
Expect service or extra napkins. You get one napkin every time you ask for some. They never check on you or ask you anything. There is usually a wait. If you dont want to wait, just go a few doors down for the same soup but with better service and a little tastier.

excerpts: I either get the chicken and giblet soup or the pork patties with vermicelli.
It northern Vietnam style cooking
and it's the bomb.
And don't knock it even if it sound weird.
Try it before you judge it people.
It's a small place like their original location was but still the pho is the shizzz!
chicken.author: Mary B.
chicken.review: I love turtle tower.  I either get the chicken and giblet soup or the pork patties with vermicelli.  It northern Vietnam style cooking and it's the bomb.  And don't knock it even if it sound weird.  Try it before you judge it people.  It's a small place like their original location was but still the pho is the shizzz!

excerpts: The Pho Ga hits the spot - chicken broth and scallions are so comforting.
Chicken strips dipped in sriracha add a little flavor.
chicken.author: Inga C.
chicken.review:
The Pho Ga hits the spot - chicken broth and scallions are so comforting. Chicken strips dipped in sriracha add a little flavor. 

The fresh spring rolls were just ok.

I think the Tenderloin Turtle Tower is better overall.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken noodle soup and they have the best broth I've ever had!
It didn't feel like it was doused in MSG or salt.
It felt clean and I'm pleased that they were generous with the chicken.
Bonus points for meaty pieces of chicken, also --
it wasn't just chunks of fat and skin!
I also love how the bowl was filled with cilantro and veggies.
I'll definitely be back.
I'm sure this would be the perfect place for a hangover ;)
chicken.author: Janet H.
chicken.review:
More like 3.5 stars...

I'm not a huge pho lover or maybe I've just never had amazing pho in my life, but Turtle Tower is solid! I ordered the chicken noodle soup and they have the best broth I've ever had! It didn't feel like it was doused in MSG or salt. It felt clean and I'm pleased that they were generous with the chicken. Bonus points for meaty pieces of chicken, also -- it wasn't just chunks of fat and skin! I also love how the bowl was filled with cilantro and veggies. I'll definitely be back. I'm sure this would be the perfect place for a hangover ;)

excerpts: The broth and the chicken were okay
but the noodles are the jam.
Overall it's very rich and savory but it could be a little greasier than average pho ga.
It's served with lots of green onions and cilantro but no sprouts or basil.
They have only one size, huge bowl for this menu
and it's $12.5.
People are very nice too:)
chicken.author: Diana Soyeon B.
chicken.review: I tried their secret menu F9. I'm a big fan of pho and this pho ga is a must-to-try. What's special about this pho is that they pan-fry the noodles so they have the barbecue flavor. Note that the noodles are very soft (maybe they overcooked mine). The broth and the chicken were okay but the noodles are the jam. Overall it's very rich and savory but it could be a little greasier than average pho ga. It's served with lots of green onions and cilantro but no sprouts or basil. They have only one size, huge bowl for this menu and it's $12.5. People are very nice too:)

excerpts: I think this place does their chicken pho really well - you have nice wide noodles, a good amount of meat (plus more with the giblets) and a very clear broth with a strong chicken flavor.
chicken.author: Dave N.
chicken.review:
I think this place is very mixed. Some things you can get here well done, other dishes are just mediocre. Service is definitely subpar though, unless you get what you want.

The dishes definitely fall under the cheaper end of the spectrum. I think this place does their chicken pho really well - you have nice wide noodles, a good amount of meat (plus more with the giblets) and a very clear broth with a strong chicken flavor. Do keep in mind they don't have a lot of hoisin sauce or whatever other add-ons you might be used to - what you see is you get. 

On the other end, I don't think their beef pho is very good, many places definitely do it way better.

As for service, it's inconsistent because I keep getting different employees. While some people are alright, other people don't speak English as well and may get items on your order wrong or completely missing. Kind of terrible, but nothing you can really do to avoid it. At least I haven't been overcharged for anything yet.

In the past this place seemed infallible to me. But now I see it as a small joint with a couple good offerings but not without its flaws.

excerpts: We had a bowl of the traditional beef pho and the "chicken noodle soup" with eggrolls.
The chicken noodle soup was actually my preference over the beef pho, though it was also very basic.
The chicken noodle soup was actually my preference over the beef pho, though it was also very basic.
chicken.author: Trish P.
chicken.review:
Came here on a HowAboutWe date which included two bowls of pho, two coffees, and an order of eggrolls.

When we arrived, there was a crowd of people waiting to get in.  When I went to the front counter to give my name, the woman seemed irritated and was short with me - probably due to the afternoon rush.

After about a 10 minute wait, we sat down at our little table near the bathroom.  The interior is modest, if not slightly dingy.  

The same woman seemed to have a change in attitude and politely explained our choices.  We had a bowl of the traditional beef pho and the "chicken noodle soup" with eggrolls. She even poured our Vietnamese coffees for us (strong as hell, but good).

Now, I'm Vietnamese American and am a little embarrassed to admit that this was my first time tasting Northern style.  The taste of the beef pho....surprised me. It was oily and had a grilled taste that overpowered the broth.  There was no hoisin or siracha. 

It wasn't bad, by any means, but just different than what I'm used to.  I found it to be lacking the complex and hearty flavors of Southern pho - it was simple and just okay. 

The chicken noodle soup was actually my preference over the beef pho, though it was also very basic.  The eggrolls were fine.  

Overall, just kind of a ho-hum experience.

excerpts: Turtle tower has fresh chicken.
The noodles are soft and silky.
Once you go in, you can smell the broth.
The broth is very refreshing but a little bit greasy.
I recommend turtle tower if you want a good warm bowl of noodle soup to comfort your stomach.
chicken.author: Heidi Y.
chicken.review: Turtle tower has fresh chicken. The noodles are soft and silky. Once you go in, you can smell the broth.  The broth is very refreshing but a little bit greasy. I recommend turtle tower if you want a good warm bowl of noodle soup to comfort your stomach.

excerpts: that's well known for their chicken pho, and
I highly recommend the chicken pho or the chicken pho with giblets if you like that kind of thing.
They also have new "secret menu" versions that are really good.
They add ham to it and something else, and it tastes a little saltier/richer than the regular versions.
chicken.author: Gary Y.
chicken.review:
My coworkers come here pretty regularly for lunch. It's the only place in the city that I know of that's well known for their chicken pho, and it's always on point.

I highly recommend the chicken pho or the chicken pho with giblets if you like that kind of thing. They also have new "secret menu" versions that are really good. They add ham to it and something else, and it tastes a little saltier/richer than the regular versions.

excerpts: Had my favorite chicken pho with lots of cilantro floating and slivers of good free range chicken.
I normally don't drink the soup, but the soup is so good for these sad cold summer days of sf.
There is free parking after 6 pm so this place is great for after work crowd.
Service is great with this young guy.
Can you imagine this place is run by the young guy and the Mexican cook in the kitchen?
Amazing.
This is Hanoi style
and they emphasize on the menu that there is no bean sprouts or basil or mint leaves.
Chili pepper comes with it.
Afterwards, i feel so satisfied, better than Jewish chicken soup.
chicken.author: Helen L.
chicken.review: Gosh, its been 4 years since I've been here?  How could that be.  Prices gone up.  Had my favorite chicken pho with lots of cilantro floating and slivers of good free range chicken.  I normally don't drink the soup, but the soup is so good for these sad cold summer days of sf.  There is free parking after 6 pm so this place is great for after work crowd.  Service is great with this young guy.  Can you imagine this place is run by the young guy and the Mexican cook in the kitchen?  Amazing.  This is Hanoi style and they emphasize on the menu that there is no bean sprouts or basil or mint leaves.  Chili pepper comes with it.  Afterwards, i feel so satisfied, better than Jewish chicken soup.

excerpts: chicken pho aka heaven in a bowl.
I cannot rave enough about the chicken pho!
Inside secret:  ask for some lemon pepper sauce to dip your chicken in.
The sauce is made of salt, pepper and lemon juice but if you dip the chicken in that sauce AND also dip it in sriracha, it will completely change the way you eat chicken pho!
chicken.author: Christy Y.
chicken.review:
If you are looking for a quick meal that is also mind-blowingly awesome, this is the place to be!  The first and only thing you should ever try here is the #9, pho ga aka chicken pho aka heaven in a bowl.  I cannot rave enough about the chicken pho!

Inside secret:  ask for some lemon pepper sauce to dip your chicken in.  The sauce is made of salt, pepper and lemon juice but if you dip the chicken in that sauce AND also dip it in sriracha, it will completely change the way you eat chicken pho!

excerpts: The chicken pho here is so good!
Came here with my friends and the staff was really friendly.
Despite previous reviews they let us use our credit card to pay.
I'll be coming back here since it's right around the corner from my place!
chicken.author: Andrea H.
chicken.review: The chicken pho here is so good! Came here with my friends and the staff was really friendly. Despite previous reviews they let us use our credit card to pay. I'll be coming back here since it's right around the corner from my place!

excerpts: Number 9 chicken noodle soup is really good
but sometimes if I'm feeling intestines I get the number 10.
Coffee is nice but takes awhile
chicken.author: Cm Tú Đ.
chicken.review: Number 9 chicken noodle soup is really good but sometimes if I'm feeling intestines I get the number 10. Coffee is nice but takes awhile

excerpts: I've also tried the Chicken Noodle Soup, which was tasty as well.
I only wish that they would remove the skin from the chicken!
The pho noodles resemble more like "Haw Fun" and it is not served with bean sprouts!
chicken.author: Steven L.
chicken.review:
My favorite is the Combination Rare Beef, Tripe and Well Done Beef Noodle Soup!  It is very tasty and the broth was full of flavor.  I've also tried the Chicken Noodle Soup, which was tasty as well.  I only wish that they would remove the skin from the chicken!  The pho noodles resemble more like "Haw Fun" and it is not served with bean sprouts!  I believe it's from a different part of Vietnam.  

Service is good and workers are friendly, but often a very long wait during lunch time. They have a sign in sheet at the door, but you know it may be awhile when you see folks congregating outside.

excerpts:
I ate chicken pho and spring roll.
Regular size Pho is only ＄7!
It tastes good and very reasonable.
chicken.author: Kayoko K.
chicken.review:
I ate chicken pho and spring roll.
Regular size Pho is only ＄7!
It tastes good and very reasonable.

excerpts: The broth was not too salty and the chicken was surprisingly not dry.
I never order Pho Ga at other places because the chicken has always been so dry and shreddy that it's disgusting and inedible.
Also, portion sizes here are humongous!
The small is more like a medium-sized bowl.
I ordered a small and could not finish all my noodles.
And I eat a lot!
chicken.author: Ingrid C.
chicken.review:
Turtle Tower is Northern Pho so it's a refreshing change from the more common Southern pho with thin noodles, bean sprouts, hoisin sauce, and basil. The noodles are wider and the broth is more simple. If you get one thing for lunch/dinner, you must get the Pho Ga! 

-- Food / Drink --
-------------------
Pho Ga ($7): The pho came with lemon and jalapeno slices. I always squeeze at least two lemon / lime slices into my broth to top it off. The broth was not too salty and the chicken was surprisingly not dry. I never order Pho Ga at other places because the chicken has always been so dry and shreddy that it's disgusting and inedible. Also, portion sizes here are humongous! The small is more like a medium-sized bowl. I ordered a small and could not finish all my noodles. And I eat a lot! One thing that I would have liked -- the broth could have been warmer. 

Fresh Spring Rolls ($5.50): Each order includes four mega spring rolls and comes with peanut sauce. One spring roll was more than enough for me. I liked the long pieces of green onion and how the roll had less mint than normal.  

Three Color Bean Dessert($3.15): Compared to the dessert chain Bambu, the three color bean dessert drink is more watered down and less sweet. The jelly was also soft but maybe it's because we got the last two drinks and they were sitting there the entire day. 
-------------------

I've heard mixed reviews about Turtle Tower but in the end, I liked the pho. I would come back to try the various beef pho's and also get another bowl of the pho ga! 

** It's cash only but there's an ATM inside. The restaurant was packed on a Thursday night but we only waited 10 minutes to get a four person table.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken noodle soup, and we got it extremely fast.
I ended up giving my roommate all my chicken and tried to go for the noodles and soup.
chicken.author: Brittany P.
chicken.review:
Mannnn, I don't know if it was that day or if it was me but I did not have a good expereince at Turtle Tower. 

My friend and her boyfriend love this place, so I decided to try it out with her. The server was super sweet and nice but the place was a little dirty. They sat us down, but there was noodles and soup all over the table and seat. (I don't mind, I understand he was busy) I ordered the chicken noodle soup, and we got it extremely fast. 

Something about the soup turned me off, it had a weird stench to it, to the point where it didn't smell clean. I ended up giving my roommate all my chicken and tried to go for the noodles and soup. I liked that the noodles were thick comparing it to the other pho, but it was reallllllyyyy soggy. 

I am hoping the next time I go, it will be a better taste! I want to love you, Turtle Tower, I really do... 

Tasty Tip: I don't have one...

excerpts: Had the number 5 with chicken and its plain out right amazing.
I can't say enough how tasty the soup was without it having it taste like msg.
Great lunch spot as they are quick and fast service.
They do have a few more locations in the city so you do have options.
A must try if you like Pho.
chicken.author: Jon L.
chicken.review: Had the number 5 with chicken and its plain out right amazing.  I can't say enough how tasty the soup was without it having it taste like msg.  Great lunch spot as they are quick and fast service.   They do have a few more locations in the city so you do have options.  A must try if you like Pho.

excerpts: Their Chicken Noodle Soup Vietnamese Style tastes the same here.
chicken.author: Tiffany D.
chicken.review:
The surrounding area has no crowd or anything enticing besides this restaurant.  The location to have this restaurant there seems random, but if you want to dine in seclusion, this place is it!  

Their Chicken Noodle Soup Vietnamese Style tastes the same here.  

At least you can pay by credit card and not only cash.  It is the smallest Turtle Tower compared to the other two places in San Francisco.  Inconvenient that it is closed on Sundays.

excerpts: Next visit I'll have to try their Pho Ga (chicken pho).
chicken.author: Jessica I.
chicken.review:
The boyfriend and I came here on New Year's Day to satisfy our pho craving. The place was packed but we didn't wait longer than 15 minutes or so. Both of us opted for the #4 which is a combination of rare beef, tripe, and well done beef.  We decided not to get rice plates or any other side dishes since the pho is what this place is known for. 

We've both only tried southern style pho so this was different. No hoisin, bean sprouts, or basil given as garnishes, and the noodles were much thicker. Just green onions, and a side of jalapeños and lime. 

After the first sip of soup, our eyes were as round as saucers because it was sooooooooo delicious. I can't explain it, but it just tasted so much "cleaner" without all the frills of the pho I'm used to. The thicker noodles complemented it so well too! 

That's why this place gets 5 stars because when I'm craving pho, I will no longer be craving southern style pho. It will definitely be northern style pho! Next visit I'll have to try their Pho Ga (chicken pho).

excerpts: The chicken pho had only noodles and soup with nothing else.
The chicken rice dish or #16, had charred vegetables and overcooked chicken meat that wasn't de-tendoned or de-boned.
chicken.author: Sam C.
chicken.review:
DON'T GO HERE!

Under any circumstances even if this was the last Vietnamese restaurant on earth.

Service: Horrible. We were served by a old Vietnamese man with a terrible attitude.

Waiting time: I literally saw the cooks just sit and fool around while me and my girlfriend were waiting for our order to be made.

Condiments: Has insects in them... not surprising when their inspection score is 79, Which most places in San Francisco are 90+.

Food: Horrendous. I've been to many Vietnamese restaurants in San Francisco and this one has the worse food I've ever eaten in my life. The chicken pho had only noodles and soup with nothing else. The chicken rice dish or #16, had charred vegetables and overcooked chicken meat that wasn't de-tendoned or de-boned. 

I would hardly consider this to be in any sense of the word a "restaurant" because the food is so terrible that between this and day old sushi from a gas station, I would gladly choose the latter.

excerpts: Nothing hits the spot like a delicious bowl of northern Vietnamese style chicken noodle soup (pho ga)!

This time, I ordered off the "secret menu" and got the F9 pho ha which came with some extras (julienned pieces of the fancy pork, some pieces of the rice noodles pan fried with corn oil which created some more complex flavors in the bowl) and was delightful.
If you like pho ga, try the secret menu version for a yummy twist.
chicken.author: Diana W.
chicken.review: Nothing hits the spot like a delicious bowl of northern Vietnamese style chicken noodle soup (pho ga)!  This time, I ordered off the "secret menu" and got the F9 pho ha which came with some extras (julienned pieces of the fancy pork, some pieces of the rice noodles pan fried with corn oil which created some more complex flavors in the bowl) and was delightful.  If you like pho ga, try the secret menu version for a yummy twist.

excerpts: I've always preferred the taste of chicken broth to beef broth, and I loooooved the broth in the chicken pho.
They pack so much flavor into it!
I definitely did not do a good job of monitoring the soup to noodle ratio....
I think they taste different too, but I think it's probably that they soak up chicken broth v. beef broth.
I went a few days ago, and I've been craving their chicken pho every single day since then.
One of my new faves in the city :D and for less than $10 for a large (which I couldn't even finish cuz that thing is big).
chicken.author: Abby S.
chicken.review:
I've been wanting to try Turtle Tower for months, and it definitely lived up to the hype!! I've always preferred the taste of chicken broth to beef broth, and I loooooved the broth in the chicken pho. They pack so much flavor into it! I definitely did not do a good job of monitoring the soup to noodle ratio....I downed that broth haha. 

The noodles themselves are also really good - as other reviewers have said, they're much wider and softer than the noodles you find at most pho places. I think they taste different too, but I think it's probably that they soak up chicken broth v. beef broth. 

I went a few days ago, and I've been craving their chicken pho every single day since then. One of my new faves in the city :D and for less than $10 for a large (which I couldn't even finish cuz that thing is big).

excerpts: Love the #6 with chicken instead of beef-  weird that chicken is $1 extra but whatever.
Plus $1 in the tip jar.
I get home and they gave me beef
I'm starving and not walking back 7 blocks for them to correct their mistake...
chicken.author: eVa J.
chicken.review:
Love the #6 with chicken instead of beef-  weird that chicken is $1 extra but whatever. Plus $1 in the tip jar. I get home and they gave me beef  I'm starving and not walking back 7 blocks for them to correct their mistake...Imperials on the house next visit would be nice though!

- Check your to-go order before you leave.
- Don't tip till you check your to-go order.

excerpts: Love the chicken pho with giblets from here.
Service is speedy, space is clean and staff is friendly.
Definitely recommend.
chicken.author: Xixi C.
chicken.review: Been coming here for a few years now, feel like it's time to write a review. Love the chicken pho with giblets from here. Service is speedy, space is clean and staff is friendly. Definitely recommend.

excerpts: I got a chicken broth pho with grilled veggies and no meat and got to say that it didn't disappoint!
chicken.author: Jenn N.
chicken.review:
Just started my day off at Turtle Tower restaurant in the SOMA district. First of all, first time at this location and the decor is similar to the other ones - it is very neat and has a really cozy ambiance. Second, sometimes it gets too busy (probably a good thing?) and so if you don't go at the right times, you might have to sign your name up to get seated. Third, food is decently priced. My significant other got a bahn mi (Viet sandwich) and paid around 4.75 - damn good price. I got a chicken broth pho with grilled veggies and no meat and got to say that it didn't disappoint!

The one thing though, it is a Northern style Viet phô so they use flat noodles and there are no bean sprouts or mint. However, you will get jalapenos and lime which makes up for it. Come in with an open heart and an empty stomach, you won't regret it.

Happy eating!

excerpts: Chicken Pho nomnomnom~ rainy day, sick day, cold day, or just any day~ also just learned about the secret menu today.
Can't wait to try the  F9 (variation of the regular chicken pho).
And bonus:
Thé, the owner is the BEST !!
Super friendly, funny, nice guy =)
chicken.author: Sy K.
chicken.review: The very best!!! Chicken Pho nomnomnom~ rainy day, sick day, cold day, or just any day~ also just learned about the secret menu today. Can't wait to try the  F9 (variation of the regular chicken pho). And bonus: Thé, the owner is the BEST !! Super friendly, funny, nice guy =)

excerpts: Aside from all that, I'm definitely a fan of the pho ga (chicken pho).
I find myself craving the wide pho noodles that characterize it...
they're just so soothing to slurp.
I haven't a problem with the broth, though abovementioned partner is Vietnamese and therefore an expert due to the millions of bowls of pho he has consumed over his lifetime...
he says it's nothing special.
chicken.author: Kate V.
chicken.review:
I never got around to trying Turtle Tower while I still lived in SF, and even if I did, this location bordering the cuts of SOMA and the freeway most definitely would not have been the one for me to take a leisurely jaunt over to. However, I now date someone who lives in the Mission, and convenience combined with car access (convenience x2) has made this my go-to pho spot when I'm in town.

The problem? They're like, never open! Ok, I shall explain: they are NOT open on Sundays. That is stated... somewhere. I now know after showing up a couple of times on the Sabbath and being greeted with a sad "Sorry, we're closed" sign. Another time, we arrived just a couple minutes past 9pm, which is their closing time. As we left I waved forlornly at those customers who were finishing up their meals inside. Finally, one other time we came here at the ripe dinner time of 6pm, and they were closed for a private party. UGH. Perhaps this is just my bad luck, but this spot tends to be very picky with its hours! More so than I'd expect from a pho restaurant (which should be open whenever I want it to be, of course), but I guess it might have to do with its weird location. Anyway, thought I'd warn you.

Aside from all that, I'm definitely a fan of the pho ga (chicken pho). I find myself craving the wide pho noodles that characterize it... they're just so soothing to slurp. I haven't a problem with the broth, though abovementioned partner is Vietnamese and therefore an expert due to the millions of bowls of pho he has consumed over his lifetime... he says it's nothing special. I think it's worth trying, but perhaps you should NOT go out of your way and check out either the Richmond or Little Saigon locations first.

Other happenings of note:
* It's very clean for a pho restaurant.
* Once they seated two of us in a booth and after ordering moved us to a smaller table to accommodate a party of 4 waiting outside. We did it without fuss, but still, kinda weird.

excerpts: I love the chicken pho here, the secret is to make the sauce.
You use the small dish, and soak the jalapenos in vinegar and fish sauce.
I've also had the beef and leek stir fry soup noodles, that's good but not as clean and savory as the Pho ga (chicken pho).
The beef pho is also good, depending on your mood.
I don't see many people getting the banh mi or rice plates here.
If it's your first time, definitely try the chicken pho with the fish sauce/vinegar!
chicken.author: Joanna S.
chicken.review:
Albeit the hair I've found in my spring roll, and the jalapeno being dried up, I still come back often to this Turtle Tower. 

Some people say that the quality differs between each location, I sort of see it, but I don't care! It's convenient, it's cheap, and it's good!!! 

I love the chicken pho here, the secret is to make the sauce. You use the small dish, and soak the jalapenos in vinegar and fish sauce. Then with every spoonful of noodles, take a little of that jalapeno or sauce as well, and it's just super tasty. 

I've also had the beef and leek stir fry soup noodles, that's good but not as clean and savory as the Pho ga (chicken pho). The beef pho is also good, depending on your mood. I don't see many people getting the banh mi or rice plates here. If it's your first time, definitely try the chicken pho with the fish sauce/vinegar! yum! 

pro tip: the soup is a GREAT hang over cure. and wonderful on a cold day. 
pro tip #2: you can order delivery from trycaviar.com (but i think it's $10 delivery charge)

excerpts: Arguable the best chicken noodle soup in SF!
Be sure to try the imperial roll as well, delicious.
Owner came out and chatted with us, great guy and a great place!
chicken.author: Chris C.
chicken.review: Highly recommend! Arguable the best chicken noodle soup in SF! Be sure to try the imperial roll as well, delicious. Owner came out and chatted with us, great guy and a great place!

excerpts: and I always get the very comforting chicken pho which is perfect for a cold day or hangover cure.
The sandwiches taste good and feels freshly made.
chicken.author: Lian F.
chicken.review: Fast service and I always get the very comforting chicken pho which is perfect for a cold day or hangover cure. The sandwiches taste good and feels freshly made.

excerpts: A chicken in chicken broth with "secret ingredients".
Sounds sketchy at first, but when you taste it...
you would not regret ordering it.
I got my usual pho tai, but I was educated a little about the different type of pho out there...
I suppose I'm a little sheltered in this area of food.
Thicker noodles than what I'm used to, and no hoisin sauce!
Taste
(5) Service (5) Clean (5)
Will we come back?
Hell yeah!
chicken.author: Megan M.
chicken.review: First timers! & treated like a regular :) We were greeted by Tay (sp.?) and let me say, customer service is a make or break it for me. He was super nice, and even told us about a secret menu, which I'm sure won't stay secret for very long. Husband tried it, and it was soooo good! A chicken in chicken broth with "secret ingredients". Sounds sketchy at first, but when you taste it... you would not regret ordering it. I got my usual pho tai, but I was educated a little about the different type of pho out there... I suppose I'm a little sheltered in this area of food. Thicker noodles than what I'm used to, and no hoisin sauce! Taste (5) Service (5) Clean (5) Will we come back? Hell yeah!

excerpts: It's a good price for the bowl you get, which comes with a good amount of chicken and plenty of noodles.
The broth isn't as flavorful as Quan Ngon (my holy grail chicken pho on Noreiga), and not as consistent.
One day it was more watery than the other, bleh.
But you could say it was my fault for ordering a rice dish at a chicken pho place.
Spring rolls are below average and the peanut sauce is whatever.
Service is average -- I don't have anything to complain about, nor is it particularly memorable.
Overall, a decent chicken pho restaurant.
chicken.author: Doris K.
chicken.review:
This is a popular lunch spot for my co-workers, as well as everyone else in the area. It's located in VERY close proximity to our office, so it's always a very convenient lunch option as long as we go before or after the rush (which is usually 12-1 p.m.). If you come during the rush, expect a good 30 minute or so wait I would guess -- we just call in and let them know when we're coming haha 

The small pho ga is, I believe, about $6.95. It's a good price for the bowl you get, which comes with a good amount of chicken and plenty of noodles. The broth isn't as flavorful as Quan Ngon (my holy grail chicken pho on Noreiga), and not as consistent. One day it was more watery than the other, bleh. I do, however, like how they slice up the jalapenos super thin and give you a lot!

I ordered a rice dish to go once -- it was absolutely terrible. But you could say it was my fault for ordering a rice dish at a chicken pho place. Spring rolls are below average and the peanut sauce is whatever. Service is average -- I don't have anything to complain about, nor is it particularly memorable. Overall, a decent chicken pho restaurant.
