However, to avoid bahn-mi regret, drive over to Saigon Sandwich in the Tenderloin (down the street from the Turtle Tower-Tenderloin).  

Now the little things: 

Dining room is way too small for a pho house.  

Disposable wooden chopsticks are a no-no for pho.  I can't explain why.

I prefer my noodles slightly more al dente than how Turtle Tower does theirs (at all three locations).  

Tea, not water, should be served automatically on cold days, ALWAYS--no exceptions.  Hell, even on hot days.  And nix the tea charge on the menu, even if you have no intention of actually charging for tea.  

Iced coffee was good.  I never use a straw, but my wife would have appreciated one.  

Not the cheapest bowl of noodles, but it was one of the better bowls in SOMA.

excerpts: Came here for their FREE Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup) from ScoutMob.
Let just say the noodles were not the vermicelli noodles I thought it would be and it also came with a limited amount of vegetables with only jalapenos.
You would also have to ask for sriracha sauce probably because they do not want you to drain it for them.
Well you can't beat the price of free I guess.

We also ordered spring rolls and it seemed different from what I would normally get from other Vietnamese restaurants because its not deep fried with fish sauce instead it was wrapped with rice wrap with vegetables and shrimp.
Another downside its that it is cash
only so when we payed with a card without knowing the worker pointed towards the ATM behind us with the heavy fees.
Tip for future customers! BRING CASH.
chicken.author: Peter C.
chicken.review: Came here for their FREE Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup) from ScoutMob. Let just say the noodles were not the vermicelli noodles I thought it would be and it also came with a limited amount of vegetables with only jalapenos. You would also have to ask for sriracha sauce probably because they do not want you to drain it for them. Well you can't beat the price of free I guess. We also ordered spring rolls and it seemed different from what I would normally get from other Vietnamese restaurants because its not deep fried with fish sauce instead it was wrapped with rice wrap with vegetables and shrimp. Another downside its that it is cash only so when we payed with a card without knowing the worker pointed towards the ATM behind us with the heavy fees. Tip for future customers! BRING CASH.

excerpts: It was literally flat rice noodles, chicken broth, and a few strands of chicken
mixed together in a gigantic bowl.
It was the worse I've ever had, and dare I say, a waste of calories!
I could have whipped it up in my kitchen in a few, and it would have tasted a lot better.
chicken.author: Mabel Y.
chicken.review:
WTF?! I do not understand the hype about this place whatsoever. 

I ordered the pho ga, and geez louise, it was soooo plain and boring! It was literally flat rice noodles, chicken broth, and a few strands of chicken mixed together in a gigantic bowl. It was the worse I've ever had, and dare I say, a waste of calories! I could have whipped it up in my kitchen in a few, and it would have tasted a lot better. Well, there's a caveat: I'm a spoiled little girl whose daddy buys her fresh "hand-pulled" egg and rice noodles from the local Asian grocers.

For an appetizer, my tongue was also poisoned by the imperial rolls. It was just a deep-fried mess! The oil tasted old, as if the restaurant used the same wok of oil for endless days.

Do yourself a favor, and skip to another pho place. Toodles, Turtle Tower! We will never ever meet again!

excerpts: Gà - Chicken Noodle Soup, I patiently waited another 15 minutes before the bowl of delicious came my way.
chicken.author: Jason H.
chicken.review:
3.5 Stars

I stopped by Turtle Tower's newest location in SOMA for a late lunch. I immediately noticed how much smaller this restaurant was compared to their Geary counterpart. Coming in at 2PM on a Friday I still had to wait roughly 15 minutes for a table and I was definitely surprised!

Once I got seated I continued to play the FUN waiting game since their was only one server handling the cash register and all the tables. I guess it can't hurt for the server to smile now and again. He definitely seemed exhausted.

Once I finally put in my order for a #9) Pho Gà - Chicken Noodle Soup, I patiently waited another 15 minutes before the bowl of delicious came my way. A couple other things to note:

1) The broth is amazingly tasty and light. You might get addicted to it too. I pretty much drank all the soup from the bowl.

2) Turtle Tower is Northern Vietnamese styled so your bowl of noodles won't be accompanied with a lot of extra condiments like bean sprouts and basil. Your order will come with sliced jalapenos and lemon though.

3) The noodles are flat and wider then your typical Southern Vietnamese styled Pho.

4) Remember to bring CASH, unless you want to use their ATM.

There was nothing wrong with the food and it was solid 4 stars. I was disappointed in the wait time and the service offered at this location so I slightly lowered my rating.

excerpts: Not been impressed so far with the pho or chicken on rice dishes.
Coming from eating at countless pho places all around southern cali, I've been shocked at what passes as cheap and good up here in SF.
chicken.author: Rharrison79 ..
chicken.review: Not been impressed so far with the pho or chicken on rice dishes. Coming from eating at countless pho places all around southern cali, I've been shocked at what passes as cheap and good up here in SF.

excerpts: The dish that everyone raves about, the pho ga (chicken noodle soup), is really just so so.
Besides, which chicken noodle soup comes with NO veggies?
Besides, which chicken noodle soup comes with NO veggies?
chicken.author: Kristen S.
chicken.review: The dish that everyone raves about, the pho ga (chicken noodle soup), is really just so so.  Besides, which chicken noodle soup comes with NO veggies?

excerpts: I usually order my chicken rice soup to go, then find a drafty, solitary location.
Maybe I eat fast.
Though not as fast as my BF.
The Chicken rice soup (it might go by another name

but right now, I'm too lazy and unmotivated to lift a finger to research what the proper menu name might be) is made with chicken broth, rice cooked until it is quite loose but not yet paste, cilantro, chicken parts and water.
The cilantro makes it better.
All you people who cannot taste the true enlightening flavor of cilantro should feel sad that you will never know the grace of god in the form of cilantro.
Has anyone realized that the issue of cilantro has divided the world as much as the religion?
chicken.author: Christina C.
chicken.review:
I have very healthy, active sweat glands.  They are easily activated.  Especially when I wear long sleeved shirts, eating hot soup with spicy red spicy spice can be a near-death-by-dehydration experience.  Simply put, it's really embarrassing to watch me put away a bowl of hot anything.  Everything is fine until I start sweating, without warning or a build up, SUDDENLY sweat is pouring down my brow.  And my neck.  And my upper lips.  It looks like I'm having a hot flash, sudden death, and food sweats all at the same time.  Really quite frightening.

This brings us to the reason why I have never eaten a meal at Turtle Tower.  I usually order my chicken rice soup to go, then find a drafty, solitary location.  Maybe I eat fast.  Though not as fast as my BF.  And apparently Jessica T. is a hoover when it comes to food.  

The Chicken rice soup (it might go by another name but right now, I'm too lazy and unmotivated to lift a finger to research what the proper menu name might be) is made with chicken broth, rice cooked until it is quite loose but not yet paste, cilantro, chicken parts and water.  The cilantro makes it better.  All you people who cannot taste the true enlightening flavor of cilantro should feel sad that you will never know the grace of god in the form of cilantro.  Has anyone realized that the issue of cilantro has divided the world as much as the religion?  I think I just found a conspiracy!

As with most viet restaurants, MSG is a common seasoning in the kitchen.  When I eat MSG, it feels like someone put ruffies in my food.  One minute I'm chatting and doing fine, the next minute I've passed out, face first on the desk/floor/bathroom stall.  I won't remember anything when I wake up.  It's like those few hours of my life were stolen from me.  Now, what girl wouldn't like a decent black-out every now and again.  However, it's really frowned upon when that happens at work.  And everyone is staring at me.  Yeah.  I tend to drool a lot when I'm in these MSG-induced comas.

excerpts: I had the chicken noodles.
There was not much flavor, curiously.
Chicken noodle soup of any kind out of a can has way more flavor.
The only real flavor was in the broth, which tasted vaguely fishy -- it was not in the least bit appetizing.
Service was non-existent -- I had to keep flagging someone down to refill the thimble-sized water glass.
It's a very short walk from home, which is appealing, but there wasn't a single thing about the experience that would compel me to return.
chicken.author: Thomas M.
chicken.review: I thought it would be better.  I had the chicken noodles.  There was not much flavor, curiously.  Chicken noodle soup of any kind out of a can has way more flavor.  The only real flavor was in the broth, which tasted vaguely fishy -- it was not in the least bit appetizing.  Service was non-existent -- I had to keep flagging someone down to refill the thimble-sized water glass.  It's a very short walk from home, which is appealing, but there wasn't a single thing about the experience that would compel me to return.

excerpts:
Fried Chicken
2.
chicken.author: Carli F.
chicken.review:
They finally open until 9pm and they are located within my vicinity.  Turtle Tower is not only the best hangover food but a remedy for being sick or a hot spot to bring your friends that are in town.

You have to forewarn people that it isn't the traditional southern style pho that they are used to.  If I haven't eaten anything all day before coming here, I can probably finish a large bowl myself.

This location offers a few things that the other Turtle Towers don't offer that you should check out:

1. Fried Chicken
2. Banh Mi with fried egg

This location is also cleaner and the staff is a lot nicer unlike the other location.

excerpts: I like this place the chicken Pho was really good and clean, nothing more nothing less.
chicken.author: Luigi B.
chicken.review:
I like this place the chicken Pho was really good and clean, nothing more nothing less. 

I had the sauteed beef soup and it tasted like beef chow fun soup and I dont know if you like chow fun, see i love chow fun. The soup was really good, it didnt taste too oily or make me feel bloated after. I genuinely like this place, the food all taste very fresh and clean, unlike most other Pho places. Overall great place, parking in this area though, sucks.

excerpts: However, after understanding that Turtle Tower serves northern style pho and learning the differences between the regional varieties I went back, tried chicken instead of beef, and became a huge fan.
chicken.author: Krystle S.
chicken.review:
I'll admit it, after my first visit to the original Turtle Tower, I was not impressed. I went in expecting southern style pho and was devastated by the absence of bean sprouts, extra difficulty in picking up the thicker noodles, and...umami that accompanied all my previous pho experiences. However, after understanding that Turtle Tower serves northern style pho and learning the differences between the regional varieties I went back, tried chicken instead of beef, and became a huge fan. 

Eventually my frequent cravings for pho ga started creeping into dinnertime, so I decided to give this outpost a try.  From one unsavory part of the city to another, the pho ga seems pretty consistent to me - piping hot with a nice, clean broth that leaves me feeling fully comforted. The service has always been friendly and I like how I've never had to wait for a table when my weekday dinner or weekend lunch cravings strike. I've even branched out and tried the stir fried beef noodle soup (basically chow fun soup), the stir fried beef over vermicelli noodles, and the grilled pork vermicelli dish, finding all to be pretty delicious (though salty) when the mood strikes.

excerpts: Their Pho Ga (Chicken Pho) has a tasty broth that tastes clean and free of any unwanted msg.
This isn't a bowl of pho i would need to add anything too.
A little chili sauce and jalapenos for some heat does just the trick.
I normally add heavy amounts of sirarcha and oyster sauce but Turtle Tower doesn't need either!
Just FYI, It's a little pricier than most pho restaurants.
I'd rather pay a couple extra bucks for better quality noodle soup though.
chicken.author: Samantha L.
chicken.review: My favorite pho to date. Their Pho Ga (Chicken Pho) has a tasty broth that tastes clean and free of any unwanted msg. This isn't a bowl of pho i would need to add anything too. A little chili sauce and jalapenos for some heat does just the trick. I normally add heavy amounts of sirarcha and oyster sauce but Turtle Tower doesn't need either! Just FYI, It's a little pricier than most pho restaurants. I'd rather pay a couple extra bucks for better quality noodle soup though.

excerpts: I had always heard great things about the chicken broth.
I can't say that I've ever been disappointed.
The servers here try hard to tend to everyone and shuffle poeple in and out so that there's not a huge wait.
My suggestion arrive before 11:30am or after 1:30pm in order to avoid a long wait and write your name down!
chicken.author: Monique T.
chicken.review: I come here often on my lunch hour.  I had always heard great things about the chicken broth.  I can't say that I've ever been disappointed. The servers here try hard to tend to everyone and shuffle poeple in and out so that there's not a huge wait.  My suggestion arrive before 11:30am or after 1:30pm in order to avoid a long wait and write your name down!

excerpts: Came here after a night at City Beer because ScoutMob had a free Pho Ga (Chicken Pho).
Worse decision ever.
The chicken tasted like something awful and I literally picked out all the little pieces from my bowl.
The broth tasted like msg (not in a good way)
and I was so thirsty afterwards that I actually started to feel sick.
chicken.author: Sue Y.
chicken.review:
Came here after a night at City Beer because ScoutMob had a free Pho Ga (Chicken Pho). Worse decision ever. My apologies to everyone for dragging them out there.

It's north Vietnamese, so I'm not going to complain about how "different" the dishes were. The sticky rice and sausage looked decent and the egg roll was at least pretty, but the soup noodles were easily the worse I've ever had. The chicken tasted like something awful and I literally picked out all the little pieces from my bowl. The broth tasted like msg (not in a good way) and I was so thirsty afterwards that I actually started to feel sick. The beef pho wasn't much better.

Skip this joint. Your taste buds will thank you.

excerpts: I stopped coming here after I ordered take out and this weird brown thing was hanging on my chicken.
When I looked closer, it was a feather.
First I was like...
okay whatever.
I mean...
I'm sure I've eaten more nastier things without knowing it... especially when you eat in Chinatown.
But at least they try to hide it better!!!
Then I found a few more pieces with feathers still stuck to the chicken.
By then, I lost my appetite and just stopped eating.
THE END.
chicken.author: Johnson S.
chicken.review: I stopped coming here after I ordered take out and this weird brown thing was hanging on my chicken. When I looked closer, it was a feather. First I was like... okay whatever. I mean... I'm sure I've eaten more nastier things without knowing it... especially when you eat in Chinatown. But at least they try to hide it better!!! Then I found a few more pieces with feathers still stuck to the chicken. By then, I lost my appetite and just stopped eating. THE END.

excerpts: Othere dishes are also pretty good, their chicken dishes is okay....
chicken.author: Alice C.
chicken.review:
I think people either love or hate the pho here. I love it here, because it is one of those few places that you can find northern style pho, which the broth is lighter, and they don't make it too salty. Those who b1tch about the sprouts need to get over it.

They use the wider rice noodle here, a large is probably more like medium in other place. My favorite is large #4, I can eat that day after day.

Othere dishes are also pretty good, their chicken dishes is okay....

Quick service, clean setting, it is your typical neighborhood stop.

Cash only now.

excerpts: It's wide flat rice noodles served with a clear chicken broth and pieces of chicken  with a side of jalapeños for your pleasure.
The style of cooking felt more like chinese food.
But like I said, it's probably northern vietnamese cooking.
Overally, it was nice alternative to the usual chicken noodle soup I eat.
The small was surprisingly filling.
chicken.author: Virginia Y.
chicken.review: Free pho ga!!!! I came here cause of scout mob's free deal. I think this place serves northern vietnamese food? The pho ga isn't the typical vermicelli noodles I usually get. It's wide flat rice noodles served with a clear chicken broth and pieces of chicken  with a side of jalapeños for your pleasure. The style of cooking felt more like chinese food. But like I said, it's probably northern vietnamese cooking. Overally, it was nice alternative to the usual chicken noodle soup I eat. The small was surprisingly filling.

excerpts: Chicken was plentiful although quite a few pieces still had a very unappetizing strip of fat.
chicken.author: Jason B.
chicken.review:
So so pho.

Noodles were substantial and soaked up the broth nicely.

Chicken was plentiful although quite a few pieces still had a very unappetizing strip of fat.

Broth seemed clear and healthy at first but the glaze of oil along the container was disappointing.

Small and efficient space. Friendly service.

Neither of the last two make up for underwhelming pho. Sorry Turtle Tower.

excerpts: The broth was flavorful, the chicken tender, and the noodles clean.
chicken.author: Tom P.
chicken.review:
After having Turtle Tower in the TL a year ago, I swore to myself I would never come back. Never having been a huge fan of Northern Vietnamese cuisine, I just didn't like the idea of eating pho without any condiments or any of the usual accouterments.

But like a moth gravitating towards a flame, Scoutmob's promise for a free bowl of pho ga shamefully pulled me back. But you know what, this time it was worth it.

Though my position on Northern Vietnamese-style pho hasn't really changed, this Turtle Tower's pho ga was definitely legit. The broth was flavorful, the chicken tender, and the noodles clean. I thoroughly enjoyed my bowl and wished the deal was for a bigger bowl after I was done with it.

The location itself isn't ideal. It's still in the TL and the streets can really smell depending on the time of day. The space is small inside and when it's crowded, the hostesses will ask if you mind sharing a table with others. 

Overall, if Norther Vietnamese cuisine is your thing, definitely stop by for a bowl. It's a better alternative than many other pho joints in the city.

excerpts: Both times I order the Pho ga, (flat rice noodle with chicken broth and chicken).
I think their soup is inconsistent.
The first time I had it the soup tasted great, can't remember anything wrong with it.
But the second time, the soup was definitely a bit more saltier.
chicken.author: Amy L.
chicken.review:
I've been to this particular one twice. Both times I order the Pho ga, (flat rice noodle with chicken broth and chicken). I think their soup is inconsistent. The first time I had it the soup tasted great, can't remember anything wrong with it. But the second time, the soup was definitely a bit more saltier. The soup was good, but just a bit too salty for me. 

Service was good, they were able to seat me right away on a late sat afternoon. Took my order promptly. The food usually comes out pretty quick here. Vietnamese Ice coffee was okay, it didn't drain that well and I couldn't drink it until after I was done with my noodle so I had to get it in a to go cup, even then there was still half the coffee trying to drip through.

I've tried the one on Geary, twice also, and I think that one might be a bit better, because I remember the first time I had the Pho ga there it was freaking AWESOME!

Ambiance/atmosphere: Both places were kind of your typical Vietnamese noodle place...although it felt like this place had a younger crowd.

excerpts: Had chicken pho last night from there.
It gave me the stomach flu.
Up all night and morning, feeling the full symptoms.
Called into work sick.
Will never ever go back there again.
If u want the stomach flu, eat there.
Terrible place.
chicken.author: Jonathan B.
chicken.review: Had chicken pho last night from there. It gave me the stomach flu. Up all night and morning, feeling the full symptoms. Called into work sick. Will never ever go back there again.  If u want the stomach flu, eat there. Terrible place.

excerpts: My parents and I like coming here when we want to order chicken pho.
They don't give a lot of chicken, but the soup tastes great.
The only thing is they don't give you any bean sprouts and mint leaves.
There is no veggies with this pho ga.
They are doing well since there are three different locations in SF.
I will be coming back.
Their pho ga is listed as 1 of the top 100 food you should eat in a SF magazine.
chicken.author: Jennifer T.
chicken.review: My parents and I like coming here when we want to order chicken pho. They don't give a lot of chicken, but the soup tastes great. The only thing is they don't give you any bean sprouts and mint leaves. There is no veggies with this pho ga. They are doing well since there are three different locations in SF. I will be coming back. Their pho ga is listed as 1 of the top 100 food you should eat in a SF magazine.

excerpts: The only good thing on the menu was the chicken pho.
The spring rolls and imperial rolls were no bueno.
chicken.author: StylesUlove F.
chicken.review: The only good thing on the menu was the chicken pho. The spring rolls and imperial rolls were no bueno.

excerpts: I made a little salt, pepper, vinegar and lemon mixture to dip my chicken in and it was nice and zesty.
The flavors together were great.
I also had a thai tea which was just ok, a little bit sweet, but I don't mind it.
Now I know if I'm craving pho, I can come here for the noodles I prefer.
chicken.author: Stine H.
chicken.review:
For a vietnamese girl, I am sad to say that I really don't like pho. I'll probably eat it once in the duration of an entire year.

On a good note, I came here for lunch the other day because the weather's been chilly and I've been having an odd craving for noodle soups. Knowing that turtle tower offers northern style fresh noodles (banh pho tuoi), I opted to try pho here than the competitor down the street.

Coming from an anti-pho person, I think their pho ga was pretty good. The noodles were nice and soft, and the broth wasn't bland nor salty. One thing I have to point out though is you can see that their broth is very oily. You can see the layer of oil sitting atop the soup. Other than that...it was pretty tasty.

I made a little salt, pepper, vinegar and lemon mixture to dip my chicken in and it was nice and zesty. The flavors together were great. I also had a thai tea which was just ok, a little bit sweet, but I don't mind it. Now I know if I'm craving pho, I can come here for the noodles I prefer.

excerpts: Great chicken noodle Pho, and the meat is organic, so you can rest easy eating it.
This place is no frills, just good food.
The pho is Northern style, which has a lighter broth and is perfect on rainy days or when you're feeling ill.
My girlfriends and I go here often after work and enjoy a nice hot bowl of goodness.
Highly recommend.
chicken.author: Ashley K.
chicken.review: Great chicken noodle Pho, and the meat is organic, so you can rest easy eating it.  This place is no frills, just good food.  The pho is Northern style, which has a lighter broth and is perfect on rainy days or when you're feeling ill.  My girlfriends and I go here often after work and enjoy a nice hot bowl of goodness.  Highly recommend.

excerpts:
We had to try this place out also because of their extended dinner menu offered here aside from the usual chicken noodle soups and beef stew noodle soups at the other locations. 

We ordered their chicken noodles soup (of course), with a side of 2 imperial rolls (dinner menu ones have crab and pork in them) and one order of their rice rolls with diced mushrooms and marinated pork. 

Chicken noodle soup : excellent soup base, tender pieces of shredded dark and white chicken meat.
chicken.author: Christina T.
chicken.review:
Since Turtle Tower in the Tenderloin closes fairly early, and the Richmond dist location is far from convenient, opening this one here to replace the once failed chain Quiznos has proved this chain Vietnamese restaurant made the right choice. They have longer business hours which cater to the late dinner crowds and also gives the SFPD a healthier option to McDonalds or Subway. 

We had to try this place out also because of their extended dinner menu offered here aside from the usual chicken noodle soups and beef stew noodle soups at the other locations. 

We ordered their chicken noodles soup (of course), with a side of 2 imperial rolls (dinner menu ones have crab and pork in them) and one order of their rice rolls with diced mushrooms and marinated pork. 

Chicken noodle soup : excellent soup base, tender pieces of shredded dark and white chicken meat.

Imperial rolls : not my favorite. It had a onion infused taste to it and I do not like onions at all. Imperial rolls at PPQ on Irving still gets my #1 vote.

Rice rolls with pork/mushrooms: very fresh (waitress made sure we knew they made a fresh batch of these rolls around noon.) The rice noodles were soft and not too chewy. The marinated pork and mushrooms inside were very tasty and I couldn't stop munching on the left over scraps that were on the plate. This is a dish I would recommend trying out if you want a different type of appetizer to go with your entree besides imperial rolls or spring rolls.

They also had whole roasted crab on their dinner menu, which I plan on trying out next time! 

Service here is where I had to knock off one whole star! Maybe because it's still new, they don't have a full staff for waiters/waitresses, but that night, they only had one server/waitress/hostess. She practically had to multitask all night. I felt a little bad for her. Given she was the only one, service was pretty slow and my water wasn't filled once. It's ok....I can't let the service here stop me from coming again. Overall, I enjoyed my meal and hopefully they hire more help so my next experience here would be completely awesome!

excerpts: Tried the chicken noodle soup, with egg noodles.
It was very flavorful & loaded with chicken, veggies & noodles.
Loved the fresh jalapeno to put on the soup.
All in all, a very good deal & staff was friendly.
Cash only!
chicken.author: Donna W.
chicken.review: Had jury duty & this place is very convenient at the corner of 6th & Bryant.  So glad I got there before the lunch crowd with a line out the door.  Tried the chicken noodle soup, with egg noodles.  It was very flavorful & loaded with chicken, veggies & noodles.  Loved the fresh jalapeno to put on the soup.  All in all, a very good deal & staff was friendly.  Cash only!

excerpts: Their Pho Ga is getting better and order a side of Ga Luoc, their poached chicken on the side.
You'll enjoy the greater parts of the chicken, and it comes with a side dish of lime/salt/pepper.
chicken.author: Christopher L.
chicken.review:
I've been frequenting this place a whole lot more since I work no more than 3 blocks away.

Their Pho Ga is getting better and order a side of Ga Luoc, their poached chicken on the side. You'll enjoy the greater parts of the chicken, and it comes with a side dish of lime/salt/pepper.

Still, don't order their beef Pho, not much more than broth and noodles. 

I'll continue to return here on my lunch breaks and hopefully try something new, and when I do, expect another update!

excerpts: - it was a toss up between the beef and the chicken, but i'm always more partial to beef pho.
I got a 'small' bowl which is essentially more than enough for a person.
It came steaming hot with broth, a good healthy portion of meat and noodles.
chicken.author: Christine B.
chicken.review:
beef pho - it was a toss up between the beef and the chicken, but i'm always more partial to beef pho. I got a 'small' bowl which is essentially more than enough for a person. It came steaming hot with broth, a good healthy portion of meat and noodles. You really get the pungent taste of the beef broth and the meat is pretty tender and ready to melt into your mouth. 

I do have to warn you though, the pho is a bit more like the northern hanoi style so you won't get hoisin sauce or the bean sprouts. I know everyone complains about this, but give this type of pho a chance!  The only things they give you to add into your pho are jalopenos, lemon and fish sauce. 

Some other highlights are the 'che' aka vietnamese dessert - my favorite is the 3 colors one " che ba mau" -- green pandan pudding/jello, sweet beans, cocconut milk ice, and more asian jellos. DELICIOUS! 

I also had a bite of my friends vietnamese sandwich -- good solid sandwich: meat, pickled vegetables, pate, butter sauce, on a big crispey crunchy roll.

excerpts: I've tried the other turtle towers and I really enjoy Chicken pho as well.
So every time I'm craving a chicken pho, or have a hangover (like my friend did the day we came), soup noodles is the way to go!
Ordered a small chicken pho.
Tried the soup, ate the noodles and chicken.. there is definitely something missing.
I can't pin down what it is.
chicken.author: Tiffany T.
chicken.review:
Came here for lunch with some friends, since we were going to be in the area. I've tried the other turtle towers and I really enjoy Chicken pho as well. So every time I'm craving a chicken pho, or have a hangover (like my friend did the day we came), soup noodles is the way to go!

Ordered a small chicken pho. Tried the soup, ate the noodles and chicken.. there is definitely something missing. I can't pin down what it is. Might be the soup base, but it just doesn't taste as tasty as the other Turtle Towers that I've been to.

Overall, this place wouldn't be on the top of my Turtle Tower list, but will stop by only if I'm in the area. I've had better...

excerpts: My favorite thing to get here is the chicken banh mi, though the pho is also quite delicious.
What makes the chicken sandwich is the fact that they grill it right before
and it's very fresh.
After I ate one, I literally retraced my steps and had to go back to get another!
chicken.author: Jimmy H.
chicken.review: This place is one of the best and most consistent Vietnamese restaurants on the city. My favorite thing to get here is the chicken banh mi, though the pho is also quite delicious. What makes the chicken sandwich is the fact that they grill it right before and it's very fresh. After I ate one, I literally retraced my steps and had to go back to get another!

excerpts: She always gets chicken
and I always get some beef mix.
chicken.author: Paul B.
chicken.review:
We went to the little saigon location more than a yr ago and the wife didn't like it but I thought it was ok. I figured she didn't like the decor or 'hood and that impacted her decision. One bad experience and she writes it off forever. I'm much more forgiving.  So I was excited to try it again closer to our own 'hood.

First off I ordered spring rolls. The rice paper was dry like it had been sitting out for some time or not wet enough. Not a good start to help sell the wife. Second there were no condiments on the table so we had to ask. I thought these were staples to a Vietnamese place. Third and the biggest killer was that we both thought the pho broth was bland. She always gets chicken and I always get some beef mix. I got just rare beef this time and the meat looked beat up and was a bit on the tough side.

I convinced her to go back again and we'll pass on pho and see if their rice dishes or sandwiches are any good. if either are good I might upgrade the rating. 

Everyone has their go to pho place but this one is not on our list. Not even close.

excerpts: Turtle Tower offers banh mi with butter, mayo, veggies and a choice of 3 items: pate, jambon, sausage, grilled chicken, grilled pork, and a fried egg.
But how can you offer pate and jambon for banh mi if you don't have cha lua??!!?!
It's a disgrace to the banh
mi.
Btw, if you want to pay an additional $3.50 for extra chicken for your pho ga, you should know that it comes on a small condiment dish.
I also don't like how the banh mi comes in a basket.
chicken.author: Peggy N.
chicken.review:
I had such high hopes for this place due to the 4.5 stars my fellow yelpers gave.  Unfortunately, my hopes were all shattered.  

The wait was excruciating.  With a long list on their whiteboard, I would think they would make every effort to turn their tables quickly.  I hate getting my check before I ask for it in a nice high end restaurant - but at a casual joint like Turtle Tower, they should be dropping those checks on the table as soon as the customer takes that last bite of banh mi or swallows that final spoonful of soup.  Not to say that they need to rush their customers but sometimes, a nudge in the right direction is just what you need.  Better for revenue, better for tips, and better for the people waiting in line.

The staff seemed confused.  If you ask for a simple change in one of their menu items, they have to check with the boss first.  That is something you can prep your staff on beforehand.  I noticed one customer ordered a small bowl of noodles, received a big bowl, was charged for the big bowl, and when he questioned it on his bill, the server looked doubtful and asked another server for help.  I thought they would adjust his bill and only charge him for a small bowl but they didn't.  That doesn't seem like a smart business decision.

The banh mi is weird and not exactly authentic.  I'm not normally concerned about the cultural authenticity of my food - as long as it tastes good.  Turtle Tower offers banh mi with butter, mayo, veggies and a choice of 3 items: pate, jambon, sausage, grilled chicken, grilled pork, and a fried egg.  But how can you offer pate and jambon for banh mi if you don't have cha lua??!!?!  It's a disgrace to the banh mi.  I'm not even going to discuss the randomness of having a sausage and fried egg option.  

Btw, if you want to pay an additional $3.50 for extra chicken for your pho ga, you should know that it comes on a small condiment dish.  I also don't like how the banh mi comes in a basket.  Considering how it's a sit down lunch, shouldn't my food at least come on a regular plate?

I give it one star, partly because yelp is making me do it, partly because they pour their water out of a Brita pitcher, partly because the disposable chopsticks are the good kind.

excerpts: For my main, I ordered chicken pho with stir fry veggies.
The bowl was large and the flavor was good, but the chicken was on the fatty side and thus the broth was greasy.
The other Turtle Tower gives nice thick slices of chicken breast.
chicken.author: Janet Z.
chicken.review:
Setting: early dinner with a fellow pho lover!  The place was clean and parking was easy. Unfortunately the restaurant isn't on google so it's easy to get lost and go to the wrong turtle tower. Make sure you explicitly clarify the address with your dining companion! 

Order: Empress rolls to start. Or rather, an empress roll. Not a lot of value there, but it was crispy, hot, and quite good. For my main, I ordered chicken pho with stir fry veggies. The bowl was large and the flavor was good, but the chicken was on the fatty side and thus the broth was greasy.  The other Turtle Tower gives nice thick slices of chicken breast.  There were also a lot fewer accoutrements than I'm used to (no basil, sriracha, etc). 

Cost: $13 including tax and tip. Still a solid deal for dinner.

excerpts: We asked if they would substitute an entree to be redeemed, but the staff member pointedly claimed that the deal was only valid for chicken pho.
chicken.author: Andrew M.
chicken.review:
After an hour wait on a chilly San Francisco night to redeem our Scoutmob deal, we were informed that they had run out of pho noodles.  We asked if they would substitute an entree to be redeemed, but the staff member pointedly claimed that the deal was only valid for chicken pho.

I understand that is exactly what the deal was for, but they must have known they were running low on pho noodles, and could have kindly informed those waiting outside about the situation.  Also, with a couple hours left on the last day of the deal, could they really not satisfy the handful of customers who were still steadfastly waiting to try the noodles?

This wasted hour will leave a bitter taste in my mouth should I consider their pho in the future.

excerpts:
The pho itself - we ordered pho ga (chicken pho): 
- Love the flavor of the soup
- Noodles are wider than the normal pho noodles you see

- Soup is more of the northern style pho you'd get (we just went to Hanoi earlier this year, and it was reminiscent of the pho there)
- Along with that, you don't get the "normal" toppings of basil, and bean sprouts.
You do get some jalapenos.
- Meat is actual pieces of chicken, as opposed to the thinner shabu shabu style chicken.
Overall, this is the best chicken pho I've had in SF.
It's the most authentic chicken pho I've had, and I would definitely go back.
chicken.author: Erin Y.
chicken.review:
I came here with my trusty scoutmob "free pho ga" coupon. I've been meaning to make a trip out, since this location is more convenient for me. They've been alternately not open for dinner, then open but pho only available for take out. This seems to have changed, since we came early on a Friday (at 5 pm), and were promptly seated for some sit-in pho.

The ambience is bright and clean, though you might have to share tables when you come during a busier time. The waitress was very friendly, even when we told her we were using our scoutmob coupons. Probably the best service I've had at a pho place, although it was a little hard to get their attention to get our check.

The pho itself - we ordered pho ga (chicken pho): 
- Love the flavor of the soup
- Noodles are wider than the normal pho noodles you see
- Soup is more of the northern style pho you'd get (we just went to Hanoi earlier this year, and it was reminiscent of the pho there)
- Along with that, you don't get the "normal" toppings of basil, and bean sprouts. You do get some jalapenos.
- Meat is actual pieces of chicken, as opposed to the thinner shabu shabu style chicken. I liked that.

Overall, this is the best chicken pho I've had in SF. It's the most authentic chicken pho I've had, and I would definitely go back.

excerpts: Ga. The chicken broth is just delicious.
The people are always nice and courteous.
North Vietnamese food doesn't have oyster sauce (unfortunately) but with the flavors here you shouldn't miss it.
I would give it 5 stars if their beef pho was as good.
It's not bad - I'd order it again.
But really the chicken dish is the must try here.
chicken.author: Nivay A.
chicken.review: The Pho Ga is really special here. It has that "just like mom used to make" feel and flavor. Warning: the large dish is VERY large. It is so delicious that I can't stop myself from eating it all and then I feel like I am about to explode - it is a love hate type relationship. Mostly love ;) Even for people who don't typically enjoy Pho, I would recommend the Pho Ga. The chicken broth is just delicious. The people are always nice and courteous. North Vietnamese food doesn't have oyster sauce (unfortunately) but with the flavors here you shouldn't miss it. I would give it 5 stars if their beef pho was as good. It's not bad - I'd order it again. But really the chicken dish is the must try here.

excerpts: I went back about a week later and there was almost no chicken skin in my pho ga!
chicken.author: S. Y.
chicken.review:
They must have read my review!  I went back about a week later and there was almost no chicken skin in my pho ga!  Right on!!!  

Imperial rolls are still a little expensive.  I'll just eat fewer.

excerpts: However, their famous chicken pho was on par with their other locations.
The place nice and clean.
There was no sticky floors or sticky tables.
In the absence of crackheads, this location offers something the Larkin location doesn't...
Bahn mi.
chicken.author: Siao W.
chicken.review:
I've always wondered if having to fight off crackheads is what makes the pho at the Larkin Turtle Tower so delicious. To answer this question, I tried this new Turtle Tower in SOMA. I found that without crackheads on the street, the pho is JUST as delicious.
     This week was the grand opening, so they only offered a limited menu. However, their famous chicken pho was on par with their other locations. The place nice and clean. There was no sticky floors or sticky tables.
     In the absence of crackheads, this location offers something the Larkin location doesn't...Bahn mi. Not the best I've ever had, but the bread was fresh, the pate, pork, and ham were all flavorful. THe carrots and cucumbers added great texture, but no daikon radish.
     I see a lot of potential in this place. With this location being so close to me, I'll definitely be back when they are ready with the full menu.

excerpts: Be afraid of their chicken pho.. its like crack.. makes me come back for more!!
I usually get 2 if I have a crazy hang over along with vietnamese coffee.
chicken.author: Calvin H. L.
chicken.review:
Be afraid of their chicken pho.. its like crack.. makes me come back for more!! I usually get 2 if I have a crazy hang over along with vietnamese coffee. yee~ baby! 

I have been eating at Turtle Tower's other locations in SF for years. Both Larkin and Geary locations are great. But this new location on 6th and Bryant is even better!!! How convenient!!!!

THE ENDUP Sat/Sunday afterhours/day party crowd will fill this place up as soon as this place opens on Sunday. Str8 crackhead status no doubt.

excerpts: It did not have much chicken but the broth was flavorful.
I shared the Imperial roll which was not as good
I am use to..
They were small and very greasy..
chicken.author: Robert O.
chicken.review:
A cute clean place.. The staff was extremely friendly. I ordered the Pho Ga
and it was massive.. They use wide rice noodle which is different than I am use to but still good. It did not have much chicken but the broth was flavorful.
I shared the Imperial roll which was not as good I am use to.. They were small and very greasy..

excerpts: I love their chicken noodle soup, the broth is so yummy.
I'll find myself spending the first 5 min of receiving it just sipping on the broth.
I'm glad they opened one by my work
chicken.author: Rosie W.
chicken.review:
I like Turtle Tower because they're different from most Vietnamese places I've been to. I can expect a healthy tasting, yet still delicious and fulfilling meal. I love their chicken noodle soup, the broth is so yummy. I'll find myself spending the first 5 min of receiving it just sipping on the broth. I'm glad they opened one by my work :) 

One disappointing thing I might add - the eggrolls are SMALL. I love fried eggrolls (the Imperial one) and I ordered it last week. It was the size of my index finger (length and width, no kidding) and they charged $2.15 EACH (I ordered three). Never again.

excerpts: I got to choose 3 meats from a list (fried egg, grilled chicken, grilled pork) and the sandwich came with the usual veggies and slathered with butter.
chicken.author: Frances N.
chicken.review:
:: Service, Setting ::
Just opened, so service is disorganized. 

The place is generally set-up for tables of 2 people. Went with 4 people and ended up waiting for 30min as pair after pair who walked in the door were seated minutes later.

:: Food ::
Vietnamese sandwich was DELICIOUS, and only $4.50. I got to choose 3 meats from a list (fried egg, grilled chicken, grilled pork) and the sandwich came with the usual veggies and slathered with butter.

Maybe it was the wait, but the sandwich was to die for.
Note: HaNoi cuisine, but I forget the veggie their menu said they don't use

excerpts: She has the chicken pho and the chicken was juicy.
I had the beef and there was a good amount of beef
but waaay too much noodles for me.
I guess thats not a bad thing.
Give this place a try.
chicken.author: Dang L.
chicken.review: Didn't realize this was Ha Noi style pho, being Vietnamese myself I have never had this. It was good, though I prefer the regular style pho. My GF really enjoyed it though so there is another perspective for you. She has the chicken pho and the chicken was juicy. I had the beef and there was a good amount of beef but waaay too much noodles for me. I guess thats not a bad thing. Give this place a try.

excerpts: Pho is not chicken soup.
The broth is supposed to be a magic elixir.
But here the pho is just chicken soup with curly noodles...
no magic.
But we went back and it got worse.
OK, so they just opened this location, but really the customer service isn't just bad because the folks are new, there is a passive aggressive element to the service...or lack thereof.
We wanted rice instead of noodles under one of the dishes.
The counter person walked to the back, checked the rice cooker, confirmed that there was plenty of rice and then refused to give us any because...
the dish is supposed to be served with noodles.
wtf?
Check my reviews, I am a pushover, but this place was truly a two star experience and freefalling.......
Went to the guy across the street at "Grab and Go".
Terrible name for a little Vietnamese hole in the wall, but he is friendly, works hard and cranks out three star cuisine every day.
chicken.author: Miss F.
chicken.review:
Pho is not chicken soup. The broth is supposed to be a magic elixir. But here the pho is just chicken soup with curly noodles...no magic.  
But we went back and it got worse.
OK, so they just opened this location, but really the customer service isn't just bad because the folks are new, there is a passive aggressive element to the service...or lack thereof. 
We wanted rice instead of noodles under one of the dishes. The counter person walked to the back, checked the rice cooker, confirmed that there was plenty of rice and then refused to give us any because...the dish is supposed to be served with noodles. wtf? 
Check my reviews, I am a pushover, but this place was truly a two star experience and freefalling.......
Went to the guy across the street at "Grab and Go". Terrible name for a little Vietnamese hole in the wall, but he is friendly, works hard and cranks out three star cuisine every day.

excerpts: They serve the same good chicken pho I love, they don't give me attitude when I ask for sriracha sauce and the staff is much much much nicer here.
chicken.author: Natalie N.
chicken.review:
Let's face it. The TT in the TL is not in the most desirable part of town. Once you see how dirty the side alley and streets are, you sort of lose your appetite. Lucky for them, the noodles are good but over the years the hype has gone up, the place has gotten dirtier, the staff has become less friendly and more importantly, they started to phase out the sriracha. I've found myself going less frequently.

... That is until Turtle Tower opened up a shop at a smaller but cleaner location! They serve the same good chicken pho I love, they don't give me attitude when I ask for sriracha sauce and the staff is much much much nicer here. I hope it stays this way.

If you can't afford to spend $6.75 on a bowl of noodles, you probably shouldn't eat in SF.

NOTE: I've only come here for lunch but I do know this location is closed on Sundays.

excerpts: Both the chicken broth and the beef broth is too salty and blend at the same time (if that is possible)as if you put salt in just water.
I'll say instant cup noodle tasted better.
I talked to my Vietnamese friend who said if you want T.T noodle just go to Larkin and only order the chicken soup.
OK thanks for the tip!
chicken.author: Mar H.
chicken.review: I went here because I heard it was good but this is the wrong location.  I didn't know they have another T.T on Larkin.  Anyway, I rather have KFC or Micky D rather then eating here.  The soup is not edible.  Both the chicken broth and the beef broth is too salty and blend at the same time (if that is possible)as if you put salt in just water.  I'll say instant cup noodle tasted better.    I talked to my Vietnamese friend who said if you want T.T noodle just go to Larkin and only order the chicken soup.  OK thanks for the tip!

excerpts: The grilled pork noodles dip 'bun cha', chicken pho 'pho ga', rice silk crepe with ground pork and mushroom 'banh cuon' and 'pho ap chao' are really done in the Hanoian way (my hometown).
chicken.author: Anh N.
chicken.review: Like a hidden gem. The grilled pork noodles dip 'bun cha', chicken pho 'pho ga', rice silk crepe with ground pork and mushroom 'banh cuon' and 'pho ap chao' are really done in the Hanoian way (my hometown).

excerpts: Got the chicken noodle soup.. was not anything special.. would not go back there.
it was plain and boring.
chicken.author: C A.
chicken.review: Got the chicken noodle soup.. was not anything special.. would not go back there. it was plain and boring.

excerpts: Whenever I come to Turtle Tower I always get the large Chicken Pho.
It's my go to dish, and when I'm craving pho, Turtle Tower always comes to mind.
The service has always been great, but just a bit slow.
They're known for their Chicken Pho, so
if you order anything else, sorry
If you don't want the skin you have to ask for skinless chicken, but they do charge extra for that.
If they only give you cilantro and NOT basil for your pho, they probably think you don't know the difference, so definitely ask for it.
It's a really small spot, so if you're heading there for lunch, expect to wait 20-30 minutes to be seated.
chicken.author: Rachel L.
chicken.review:
Whenever I come to Turtle Tower I always get the large Chicken Pho.  It's my go to dish, and when I'm craving pho, Turtle Tower always comes to mind.  The service has always been great, but just a bit slow.  They're known for their Chicken Pho, so if you order anything else, sorry but you may be disappointed.  

Just a few things to keep in mind:
*If you don't want the skin you have to ask for skinless chicken, but they do charge extra for that.
*If they only give you cilantro and NOT basil for your pho, they probably think you don't know the difference, so definitely ask for it.
*It's a really small spot, so if you're heading there for lunch, expect to wait 20-30 minutes to be seated.

excerpts: The pho ga is also not an awesome pho, but as a chicken soup it rocks!
If you are feeling sick come go here and harness the healing power of pho!
Er, chicken soup!
chicken.author: J D.
chicken.review: Northen vietnamese vs southern vietnamese? I don't know about all of that, but the pho here is not what you would expect. Not a big fan of their beef pho. I mean it's ok, but not awesome. The pho ga is also not an awesome pho, but as a chicken soup it rocks! If you are feeling sick come go here and harness the healing power of pho! Er, chicken soup!

excerpts: Chicken Pho is good here, do NOT order any of the rice dishes.
Cash only, there is an ATM inside.
chicken.author: Daniel K.
chicken.review: Chicken Pho is good here, do NOT order any of the rice dishes. Cash only, there is an ATM inside.

excerpts: Love, Love, Love the chicken pho.
It is that good!!
chicken.author: Amanda T.
chicken.review: Yummy!! Love, Love, Love the chicken pho. It is that good!!

excerpts: Chicken Pho is alright...
don't love it nor do i hate it.
But maybe if i was hungover, I'd give it another star.
chicken.author: Lana L.
chicken.review: Chicken Pho is alright... don't love it nor do i hate it. But maybe if i was hungover, I'd give it another star.

excerpts: , order a #3 and while you're there, pick up some authentic orange chinese chicken from panda express, you god damned hacks.
chicken.author: J puff marshmellowman C.
chicken.review:
reading reviews on this TT location just solidifies my opinion that 75% of all yelpers are provincial retards without a clue about cultural cuisine...

"oh why no accompanying herbs and sprouts?"
"why no bean sauce?"
"2 stars because the meat was ground and looked cheap!"

why none of the above?!
its northern Vietnamese cuisine...THATS WHY.

seriously.  head on over there to pho hoa, order a #3 and while you're there, pick up some authentic orange chinese chicken from panda express, you god damned hacks.

excerpts: when the sandwich came, it looked great, and my husband ate half and loved it.  for the second half, he opened up the sandwich to put on some hot sauce when he saw something that looked like shredded chicken on top of the egg.
he told me to taste it, and it tasted like chicken.
we called over a waitress and asked her if it was chicken, and she said, "yes, it's part of the house dressing," which comes w/ the sandwich.
never in my right mind did i think that the house dressing would include meat!!!
i was very disappointed, and the waitress asked if we wanted a new sandwich w/o the house dressing.
the waitress was nice enough to take 20% off my bill, but at the same time, i think they should warn people that "dressing" includes chicken.
her reasoning was that their menu does not include any vegetarian food, so you would have to actually say "no meat" if you wanted the sandwich w/o meat, but how was i supposed to know?
chicken.author: Helen T.
chicken.review:
i love pho, and i have been to both of the other turtle tower locations on numerous occasions.  my husband is vegetarian and does not eat pho, so i was psyched to find out that this location has banh mi w/ fried egg...something to satiate the veg palate! 

i have had a serious pho craving for the last few weeks, and i wanted to fulfill it before moving to london for 6 months.  i ordered the pho ga for myself and the banh mi w/ fried egg for my husband.  the waiter asked me what other meats he wanted (you have a choice of up to 3 for only $4.50), and i said just egg, b/c he's vegetarian.  

when the sandwich came, it looked great, and my husband ate half and loved it.  for the second half, he opened up the sandwich to put on some hot sauce when he saw something that looked like shredded chicken on top of the egg.  he told me to taste it, and it tasted like chicken.  we called over a waitress and asked her if it was chicken, and she said, "yes, it's part of the house dressing," which comes w/ the sandwich.  never in my right mind did i think that the house dressing would include meat!!!  i was very disappointed, and the waitress asked if we wanted a new sandwich w/o the house dressing.  by this point, my husband had lost his appetite, and he didn't finish the 2nd half of his sandwich.  

the waitress was nice enough to take 20% off my bill, but at the same time, i think they should warn people that "dressing" includes chicken.  her reasoning was that their menu does not include any vegetarian food, so you would have to actually say "no meat" if you wanted the sandwich w/o meat, but how was i supposed to know?

excerpts: I had #11 (Bún Thang - Chicken, Finely Sliced Egg, Ground Pork, & Shrimp Paste Vermicelli Noodle Soup)
chicken.author: Yanika S.
chicken.review: I had #11 (Bún Thang - Chicken, Finely Sliced Egg, Ground Pork, & Shrimp Paste Vermicelli Noodle Soup) and my bf had #5 (Pho Sot Vang - Beef Stewed in Wine Sauce Noodle Soup). Both were great. I loved my soup! The flavors were superb and  I felt full afterwards. Too bad they didn't accept cards and the atm was broken... had to walk a few blocks to the ATM.

excerpts: , they used to only use free ranch chicken and now they mix it with reg.
frozen  chicken, They try to serve dinner on TT location, but their food is terrible , their sizzling beef taste like oyster beef
it is so blend and the portion is so small, it is so pricey , I'll never return again.
chicken.author: Antonio L.
chicken.review: I been to Turtle Tower for 8 years already, it getting worst and worst, they used to only use free ranch chicken and now they mix it with reg. frozen  chicken, They try to serve dinner on TT location, but their food is terrible , their sizzling beef taste like oyster beef it is so blend and the portion is so small, it is so pricey , I'll never return again.

excerpts: I was disappointed with the Pho Ga here because the chicken didn't taste as fresh and the soup wasn't piping hot like the other location.
chicken.author: Yvonne N.
chicken.review: Location is much better than Larkin and parking is easier.  This location also accepts credit cards if you make a minimum order.  I was disappointed with the Pho Ga here because the chicken didn't taste as fresh and the soup wasn't piping hot like the other location.

excerpts: I had the egg noodle with chicken soup here yesterday for lunch, during my jury duty service.
Let me say that it wasn't the best pho I ever had.
The noodles was clumpy as it was undercooked.
There were like 7 pieces of chicken, at least the Broth was different.
The food pickings are definitely slim around  the Bryant street courthouse.
chicken.author: Lawrence F.
chicken.review: I had the egg noodle with chicken soup here yesterday for lunch, during my jury duty service. Let me say that it wasn't the best pho I ever had. The noodles was clumpy as it was undercooked. There were like 7 pieces of chicken, at least the Broth was different. The food pickings are definitely slim around  the Bryant street courthouse.

excerpts: Should not be on the top 100 things to eat before you die - should be on the 100 things to eat that make you want to die of disappointment list instead) and said, "Here's your chicken noodle soup".
Sorry, my what?
The broth was salty and tasted lemony, no flavor or substance really.
I basically got a heaping bowl of soggy noodles (not the kind I am used to with southern), bland broth, some slivers low-grade chicken (lots of fat and skin), and a side of mild jalapenos to dump in.
Oh, and a lemon wedge.
No hoisin, no bean sprouts, no veggies unless you count slivers of green onions.
If I wanted chicken noodle soup, I would have went to Safeway - Campbells is like $2 I am sure.
I wanted tasty pho ga.
If I wanted chicken noodle soup, I would have went to Safeway - Campbells is like $2 I am sure.
I wanted tasty pho ga.
chicken.author: Adrienne C.
chicken.review:
In a word: unimpressive.  In several words:

There is a reason that this the the bay areas "only authentic northern vietnamese" restaurant.  If this is is truly what northern vietnamese is supposed to be, then I will never bother trying it again.  What a disappointment - we were expecting the pho we are used to and instead got what looked like a poor man's pho.

When they brought me my much acclaimed pho ga (side note: wtf 7x7 mag?  Should not be on the top 100 things to eat before you die - should be on the 100 things to eat that make you want to die of disappointment list instead) and said, "Here's your chicken noodle soup".  Sorry, my what?  The broth was salty and tasted lemony, no flavor or substance really.  I basically got a heaping bowl of soggy noodles (not the kind I am used to with southern), bland broth, some slivers low-grade chicken (lots of fat and skin), and a side of mild jalapenos to dump in.  Oh, and a lemon wedge. No hoisin, no bean sprouts, no veggies unless you count slivers of green onions.  If I wanted chicken noodle soup, I would have went to Safeway - Campbells is like $2 I am sure.  I wanted tasty pho ga.  This may partly be because its authentic northern as opposed to southern, but if this is what northern is, I do need to try it again.

People, there is a reason it is so cheap - because you are not getting much.  In fact,  I think it might be over priced for what it is.  Oh, and the building is an old Quiznos, which they somehow found a way to make even dumpier.  And there was a TV blaring E! the whole time.  Whoever said it was like a spa for the stomach must be used to going to the scary cut rate ones in the tenderloin.

Avoid at all costs.  I will never go back.

excerpts: Had the chicken egg noodle soup and a banh sandwich.
chicken.author: David H.
chicken.review:
Been here numerous times because I live in the neighborhood, but had to write a review after my visit tonight.  Had the chicken egg noodle soup and a banh sandwich.  

Both were mostly underpar, but what I really wanted to call out was how freakin' salty the soup was.  It was like the kitchen accidently knocked over the whole salt container into the soup.  Undrinkable to say the least.  Very disappointed.

As for the sandwich, pretty dry and the bread wasn't even toasted.

Maybe they had a bad night, but just felt compelled to share my terrible experience there tonight.

excerpts: I like the free range chicken strips and the tasty soup.
I can't complain, it was free!
Service was good and
no wait to be seated.
This place is smaller than the TL location but there's an adequate amount of tables.
I wouldn't normally come to this location since its in a questionable neighborhood but good for those serving jury duty at in courthouse just up the block.
chicken.author: Candace F.
chicken.review: Thanks Scoutmob for 100% off a small pho ga. Pho ga is pretty much the only thing I order at TT. On a cold windy day, it warms the soul. It's my comfort food. I got a pretty decent serving for a small bowl. I like the free range chicken strips and the tasty soup. I can't complain, it was free! Service was good and no wait to be seated. This place is smaller than the TL location but there's an adequate amount of tables. I wouldn't normally come to this location since its in a questionable neighborhood but good for those serving jury duty at in courthouse just up the block.

excerpts: Awesome chicken noodle soup and gotta try the Vietnamese coffee!
chicken.author: Alan M.
chicken.review: Awesome chicken noodle soup and gotta try the Vietnamese coffee!

excerpts: Love this place, the fresh spring rolls and the Chicken Pho are the best in town.
chicken.author: Sarah F.
chicken.review: Love this place, the fresh spring rolls and the Chicken Pho are the best in town.

excerpts: Probably should have ordered the Chicken PHO.
chicken.author: Cathy D.
chicken.review: This Review is ONLY for their pork rice plate dish & sticky rice....NOT VERY GOOD AT ALL.....Probably should have ordered the Chicken PHO.

excerpts: Randomly being in the neighborhood, I dropped in to this new location and grabbed the pho ga, which many say is the definitive dish at Turtle Tower, and a banh mi with pate, fried egg, and grilled chicken.
The service was a bit slow considering how empty the restaurant was at 11AM on a weekday, but the food arrived in honestly under a minute
so I wasn't mad about it.
So...about that pho ga.
I'll be blunt: it wasn't the dish that was sold to me.
Sure, the broth was balanced and the noodles were supple and well-cooked, but everything was just average.
I wasn't blown away.
The pho ga is good for a quick bite and a warm dish on a cold SF night, but that's about it.
As for the banh mi, it was generously loaded with the meats and eggs, but almost too generously loaded.
The pickled vegetables and cilantro were really afterthoughts in this sandwich, causing it to be very heavy and laden with fat.
chicken.author: Frank Y.
chicken.review:
Turtle Tower: Hype machine?

Whenever I asked my Vietnamese friends about pho, my left ear would be falling off from the barrage of praise for Turtle Tower. I've always been skeptical, though. I've been more of a Kevin's Noodle House kind of guy, like as in the "I've gone to Kevin's since middle school" kind of guy. Was Turtle Tower worth the trip?

Randomly being in the neighborhood, I dropped in to this new location and grabbed the pho ga, which many say is the definitive dish at Turtle Tower, and a banh mi with pate, fried egg, and grilled chicken. The service was a bit slow considering how empty the restaurant was at 11AM on a weekday, but the food arrived in honestly under a minute so I wasn't mad about it. So...about that pho ga. I'll be blunt: it wasn't the dish that was sold to me. Sure, the broth was balanced and the noodles were supple and well-cooked, but everything was just average. I wasn't blown away. The pho ga is good for a quick bite and a warm dish on a cold SF night, but that's about it. As for the banh mi, it was generously loaded with the meats and eggs, but almost too generously loaded. The pickled vegetables and cilantro were really afterthoughts in this sandwich, causing it to be very heavy and laden with fat. Sure, the banh mi was good, but I could barely stomach a half before calling it quits.

All in all, Turtle Tower was just another dining experience, nothing noted positively or negatively. It was just a forgettable meal, for better or worse.

excerpts: I felt the pho ga though it came with a decent amount of chicken strips was a bit too bland for my liking.
I don't mind bland food
but I felt if the broth were just a little bit more flavorful it would have tasted better.
At least I now know that their pho must be MSG free.
chicken.author: Helen L.
chicken.review: My friend and I came here to take advantage of the free bowl of pho ga from scoutmob. Though there were people waiting, the wait was fairly short (maybe 10 mins) for free food. I felt the pho ga though it came with a decent amount of chicken strips was a bit too bland for my liking. I don't mind bland food but I felt if the broth were just a little bit more flavorful it would have tasted better. At least I now know that their pho must be MSG free.

excerpts: The Pho Ga was bland, not the rich chicken broth at the Larkin location.
The banh cuon was ok, but I've never seen pink, bacon looking meat in my banh cuon ever before.
The texture of the banh cuon was ok, a little too thick...
I've had better.
The beef stew was bland (literally like beef stewed in water), although the meat was tender.
I won't be coming here ever again.
When I crave chicken pho, I'll be going to the Turtle Tower in the TL.
chicken.author: Kimling L.
chicken.review: Edible, but inconsistent with its original counterpart in the Tenderloin. The Pho Ga was bland, not the rich chicken broth at the Larkin location. The banh cuon was ok, but I've never seen pink, bacon looking meat in my banh cuon ever before. The texture of the banh cuon was ok, a little too thick... I've had better. The beef stew was bland (literally like beef stewed in water), although the meat was tender. I won't be coming here ever again. When I crave chicken pho, I'll be going to the Turtle Tower in the TL.

excerpts: The flavors were subtle and blended really well together, a generous amount of chicken and perfect noodles.
I'll be back for sure, can't wait to try their sandwiches.
chicken.author: Antony M.
chicken.review: Ate here for the first time due to the Free Pho' Scoutmob deal. It's actually genuinely good, simple, fresh, clean and tasty food. The flavors were subtle and blended really well together, a generous amount of chicken and perfect noodles. I'll be back for sure, can't wait to try their sandwiches.

excerpts: Had the chicken pho - it was ok.
Surprisingly didn't come with any limes, basil, or mint or any of that yummy brown sauce (whatever that is :)
Broth was ok - kind of salty.
Chicken pieces had random pieces of fat / bone.
Noodles were soft and yummy.
My friend got vegetables in hers - would highly recommend that.
Had a fried roll and that was ok.
chicken.author: Cathy L.
chicken.review:
This place isn't bad per se...but I'm guessing there are better places for pho in San Francisco :)
Had the chicken pho - it was ok.  Surprisingly didn't come with any limes, basil, or mint or any of that yummy brown sauce (whatever that is :)
Broth was ok - kind of salty.  Chicken pieces had random pieces of fat / bone.  Noodles were soft and yummy.  My friend got vegetables in hers - would highly recommend that.
Had a fried roll and that was ok.

excerpts: For all the chicken bits, skin and fat
I found in the porridge none of it registered any taste or flavor.
At the risk of hyperbole, it reminded me of gruel from Oliver Twist.
I might suggest Turtle remove it from the menu altogether and continue to focus on the pho.
The last bit of my experience was humorous, but should serve as a caveat to diners looking to order off menu and snack on imperial rolls.
I asked if I could place an imperial roll order to which the cheerful waiter said okay.
I didn't realize he was going to bring out a single imperial roll the size of my thumb.
And needless to say, the roll came after I was done with the porridge.
I asked, "Is that all?"
Thinking surely a dog must of swiped the other imperial rolls on the way to the table.
Without an iota of hesitation, he replied, "It's what you ordered, right..?
One imperial roll
" Sheepishly, I had to chuckle aloud and channel more Twist, Please
Sir, I want some more.
Something was certainly lost in translation
chicken.author: Aaron Y.
chicken.review:
I was surprised with my subpar experience at the 6th street location considering the original Larkin Street location's reputation. For a small venue, they seemed understaffed and bit overwhelmed by an average lunchtime flow. I waited for about 20 mins to be seated even though tables were available, they couldn't clean and set with any predictability. I would recommend you NOT order the rice porridge. For all the chicken bits, skin and fat I found in the porridge none of it registered any taste or flavor. At the risk of hyperbole, it reminded me of gruel from Oliver Twist. I might suggest Turtle remove it from the menu altogether and continue to focus on the pho. The last bit of my experience was humorous, but should serve as a caveat to diners looking to order off menu and snack on imperial rolls. I asked if I could place an imperial roll order to which the cheerful waiter said okay. I didn't realize he was going to bring out a single imperial roll the size of my thumb. And needless to say, the roll came after I was done with the porridge. I asked, "Is that all?" Thinking surely a dog must of swiped the other imperial rolls on the way to the table. Without an iota of hesitation, he replied, "It's what you ordered, right..? One imperial roll" Sheepishly, I had to chuckle aloud and channel more Twist, Please Sir, I want some more.
Something was certainly lost in translation

excerpts: Chicken pho was tasty, spring rolls were fresh as well as imperial rolls,  could be a little bit cheaper.
chicken.author: Li L.
chicken.review: Service was good, small place best time to go around 2-4 pm but watch out for 3pm towaway on 6th st. Chicken pho was tasty, spring rolls were fresh as well as imperial rolls,  could be a little bit cheaper.

excerpts: All in all the chicken pho was still pretty darn good.
The eggrolls were as good as I remembered from TL store.
Nothing beat hot brothy pho on cold SF day...
huh

chicken.review:
OK I would give it another star but  I like the TL shop better. Sure this one is cleaner and has better parking but the food didn't live up to TL locale. All in all the chicken pho was still pretty darn good. The eggrolls were as good as I remembered from TL store. 
Nothing beat hot brothy pho on cold SF day...huh

excerpts: no intro really needed here, it's only the most popular vietnamese chicken noodle soup in the city!
i say the food is solid, but not the best.
the broth is tasty and not too greasy.
portions are average with good amount of meat.
worth a visit to see what the fuss is all about.
chicken.author: Melissa Y.
chicken.review: no intro really needed here, it's only the most popular vietnamese chicken noodle soup in the city! i say the food is solid, but not the best. the broth is tasty and not too greasy. portions are average with good amount of meat. worth a visit to see what the fuss is all about.

excerpts: I also tasted the Chicken Noodle soup that my friend was having, and it's the same as everywhere else, Broth, Noodles and pieces of chicken (with skin - yuk).
We also ordered the Imperial Rolls and they were aaaaay, barely ok, nothing special.
So save your money and look for a better Vietnamese restaurant, there are a lot of them in the SF.
The restaurant accepts cash only which usually tells a lot about a place.
Can't complain to credit Card Company and they have a lot to hide, besides cash, which is not my business - but just saying.
chicken.author: Tongue-Me e.
chicken.review: OK, I am not sure why I was dragged there, but Yuk Yuk Yuk. What kind of food is that? I have had Vietnamese food before and it is by far tastier. I ordered the Beef sautéed in red wine (#17?), and what a bad choice I have made. First the meat was served in a small bowl that has "wine sauce", which is far from it. I think the way it cooked, is after boiling the meat, they added some red wine and cooked for couple of minutes and poured it in the bowl. Second the meat had a lot of fat on it more than the lean, it was like treasure hunt to find beef. The soup that came with the order was OK, since all of them taste the same, some made up broth (nothing special). I also tasted the Chicken Noodle soup that my friend was having, and it's the same as everywhere else, Broth, Noodles and pieces of chicken (with skin - yuk). We also ordered the Imperial Rolls and they were aaaaay, barely ok, nothing special. So save your money and look for a better Vietnamese restaurant, there are a lot of them in the SF. The restaurant accepts cash only which usually tells a lot about a place. Can't complain to credit Card Company and they have a lot to hide, besides cash, which is not my business - but just saying.

excerpts: I ordered a bahn mi with pork and chicken to go.
It was full of burnt grizzle - disgusting.
Even if it was only $4.50 I'd rather go across the street to Little Vietnam Cafe or walk a few blocks to Sunrise Cafe.
chicken.author: Anonymous S.
chicken.review: I ordered a bahn mi with pork and chicken to go.  It was full of burnt grizzle - disgusting.  Even if it was only $4.50 I'd rather go across the street to Little Vietnam Cafe or walk a few blocks to Sunrise Cafe.

excerpts: Also, Pho Ga isn't just the Vietnamese version of the chicken noodle soup.
They've been eating it for hundreds of years.
As for the best Pho on the planet, it's a northern style place in Saigon, which I won't name since it's already too popular among the locals in Saigon.
The flavor of that Pho is so vastly different and better than any Pho
I've tasted across the USA.
I love the chicken version.
After finishing the noodles, I just sit there and sip on the soup base.
A very good meal for the winter weather.
When it comes to their other food, I have little experience.
I had a rice dish once at the Larkin location and left hungry
so I never order anything
but Pho at TT.
chicken.author: Loc N.
chicken.review:
I'm not going to be judgmental towards the people who wrote bad reviews or wrote that this place doesn't really serve Pho.  I've gone to this place 3 or 4 times since they've opened.  In the beginning, there were some opening pains with handling the crowds and the quality wasn't up to the one on Larkin St, but I went there today, and the quality was excellent.  I think it takes awhile before a new location gets its footing if it ever does.  For a restaurant that gets so much traffic, I cannot figure out why they didn't rent a larger space.  I will give the complainers that.

I can tell anyone who hasn't been to Vietnam that this is indeed real Pho.  Like any food, such as pizza or gumbo, there are many variations of Pho.  Most people have only experienced the southern flavor that is more aromatic and served with a side of herbs.  TT serves the northern style, the original version.  If you go to Vietnam, the northern style is the most favored version, even in the south.  It's actually harder to make good northern style Pho, and I wouldn't say TT has achieved the goal of matching northern style Pho that I've had in Vietnam.  With southern style, the herbs and spices sometimes cover up for mediocre soup.  Having eaten at the best Pho place on the planet many times, I can honestly say TT doesn't measure up, but it's pretty good for Pho in the USA, and it's the only northern style place I know of in America.  Also, Pho Ga isn't just the Vietnamese version of the chicken noodle soup.  They've been eating it for hundreds of years.  As for the best Pho on the planet, it's a northern style place in Saigon, which I won't name since it's already too popular among the locals in Saigon.  The flavor of that Pho is so vastly different and better than any Pho I've tasted across the USA.  It's really hard to describe.

Anyway, I like this location because it's in a better neighborhood and forces me to walk 6 blocks to get my meal.  A healthy tasty meal after a nice walk, how can you beat that?  I love the chicken version.  After finishing the noodles, I just sit there and sip on the soup base.  A very good meal for the winter weather.  When it comes to their other food, I have little experience.  I had a rice dish once at the Larkin location and left hungry so I never order anything but Pho at TT.

excerpts: both the pho chin (beef) and pho ga (chicken) were solid - tasty broth, fresh noodles, generous portions of beef/chicken to top it off.
we'll be back to try the non-pho dishes...
overall pleased to have
an inexpensive and very pleasant eatery join the area
chicken.author: lois j.
chicken.review: a welcome addition to the neighborhood! both the pho chin (beef) and pho ga (chicken) were solid - tasty broth, fresh noodles, generous portions of beef/chicken to top it off. we'll be back to try the non-pho dishes... overall pleased to have an inexpensive and very pleasant eatery join the area

excerpts: The fried imperial rolls are delicious too.
Just have to fork out $3.50 for one roll!
fried imperial rolls.author: Kayli T.
fried imperial rolls.review: Chicken pho is one of those comfort items that I always enjoy. LOVE the chicken pho here. Very authentic to Hanoi style pho and I have eaten in Hanoi recently. So, luckily this is local and I always go here whenever I am in the city. I always get extra jalapeños and add several scoops of Sriracha as the pho is even better spicy. The fried imperial rolls are delicious too. Just have to fork out $3.50 for one roll!

excerpts: Fried Imperial Rolls with Vermicelli Noodle, Lettuce, Mint and Cilantro ($11.50)
fried imperial rolls.author: Carolyn Z.
fried imperial rolls.review:
Extremely overpriced for the small portions.
